story:
My Story

I'm Joshua Weissman, a high school student who is a dedicated, real-food advocate and food blogger who writes and photographs the blog Slim Palate.  By the age of 8 I began to struggle with weight problems, and my health began to decline. I was physically and verbally harassed at school, which caused frequent bouts of depression and was crushing to my self esteem.

I wanted to change my life and my eating habits, After doing extensive research, I found a way to use whole, natural foods to create elegant, palate-pleasing recipes that helped me lose 100 pounds without sacrificing flavor. My affinity for food and cooking compelled me to share my philosophy of food, kitchen tips and tempting, nourishing recipes with the world. And so I wrote  "The Slim Palate Paleo Cookbook" which is in pre-sales at Amazon now and will be available in Bookstores and Online starting March 11.



Praise From A Cooking Master

"Joshua Weissman's Slim Palate Paleo Cookbook is a lovely volume, certainly, with fine recipes for any level of cook and exceptional photography by the author. But embedded within this is a philosophy of food that I hope more people will embrace, one of common sense and a full-on bear hug of excellent food cooked at home with abandon. More important even than that, this book is an extraordinary story of a young man, a teenager, who transformed himself through food and cooking and is thus a living emblem of the power of food to transform our lives."

                      ....Michael Ruhlman, the James Beard Award winning author of "Ruhlman's Twenty: A Cook's Manifesto", "Charcuterie", "The Soul of a Chef" and numerous other books on food and cooking. 



What I Am Seeking

I would like your help to travel to key cities to let people know about the book, how changing the way they eat, eating Real Food and sourcing locally can improve their health and help them combat overweight tendencies in themselves and their children.

Funding is for the expenses related to touring the country for book signings and speaking opportunities.  Planes, Trains, Hotels and Rental Cars, which will cost about $1,000 to 2,000 a city. The tour would be from March 14 to approximately May 15th, depending on funding.

Locations: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Houston, Austin, Boulder, Seattle and Portland, as finances will allow. We will likely add more places to this list if they are requested.



Enticements and Offerings

The Taste Tester -  $10 - Our unending gratitude and appreciation for your support!

The Fine Diner - $25 - A personal thank you letter and our gratitude!

The Foodie - $50 - A Limited Edition copy of "The Slim Palate Paleo Cookbook", Signed and Numbered!

The Gourmande - $100 - An Invitation to the Book Launch Party at Yonder Way Farm on March 15th near Houston! AND A Pre-Publication copy of the cookbook, signed and numbered!

The Sous Chef - $250 - A Framed and signed recipe from the book printed on archival paper!  AND An Invitation to the Book Launch Party at Yonder Way Farm on March 15th near Houston! AND A Limited Edition copy of "The Slim Palate Paleo Cookbook", Signed and Numbered!

The Executive Chef - $500 - A personalized recipe for a meal designed around your choice of the main ingredient. To include all the ingredients and complete cooking directions. AND An Invitation to the Book Launch Party at Yonder Way Farm on March 15th near Houston! AND A Limited Edition copy of "The Slim Palate Paleo Cookbook", Signed and Numbered! AND A personal thank you letter!

The Umami King (or Queen) - $1000 - 10 pounds of bacon made from local pastured pork belly, cured and smoked by Joshua. Sliced, packaged and delivered to your door! AND An Invitation to the Book Launch Party at Yonder Way Farm on March 15th near Houston! AND A Limited Edition copy of "The Slim Palate Paleo Cookbook", Signed and Numbered! AND A personal thank you letter!



The Book Launch Party at Yonder Way Farm

One of my favorite perks is a ticket to the Book Launch Party.  Join us for a dinner at a farm outside of Houston celebrating quality, locally sourced food, cooked according to the Paleo lifestyle. Enjoy a delicious dinner in a beautify country setting.



Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially? That's okay! If you can, please help to spread the word about this as much as possible!  Please use Social Media to mention this campaign and the links below; all of which would incredibly helpful


Indiegogo campaign: igg.me/at/slim-palate
The Book on Amazon: http://amzn.to/KQ8pSX
Slim Palate Blog: http://slimpalate.com/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SlimPalate
Twitter: https://twitter.com/slimpalate
Instagram: http://instagram.com/slimpalate#

story:
As a weekly WWE pod caster (www.facebook.com/slowburnwrestling), I have decided to take the leap, follow my dream, and enter the ring, myself! Since I was a kid, I have loved pro wrestling. I would tune into what was then the WWF and be in awe. I admired the wrestlers' grueling athleticism and coordination, as well, the mental sharpness required to master such “choreography.” However, not an athlete, I ruled myself out. It's time to turn that around. I have been dreaming about this since high school. I'm ready to turn this dream into action and would greatly appreciate your support on this journey to enter the pro wrestling arena myself.

 

 As a kid, I remember the excitement that pro wrestling brought me; yelling at the TV at those characters I detested and cheering for those I supported. I hope to bring the same excitement that I felt watching wrestling to the faces of kids as they watch me in the ring. I'm sure many of you that tune into pro wrestling on TV or have come to a live event can relate to seeing that pure joy on the faces of you own kids, nephews, or nieces.

 

Much like, Indiegogo's founders, I am trying to raise money for something I am passionate about.  And that passion isn't just about wrestling, it's about following through with a dream.  I have always wanted to wrestle, but have often discounted myself.  Even though I am older than most who enter the sport now, I am making a leap and trying to follow through with this dream.  If I can make this happen, I hope others, who may think their dreams have passed them by will look at me and say, You know what, I can do that too," and then set out to achieve their own goals. 

 

I greatly appreciate any support you can offer towards my effort.  Believe in me and yourself. Thank you for anything you can contribute!

story:
Short Summary

I need money to help offset the cost of my upcoming surgery. The goal amont (1,000) is less than what I need, but they take 10% (as opposed to 4%) if I dont reach that goal. I figured a grand is do-able in 60 days on this thing.  Yeah.

What We Need & What You Get

I need your support and donations to get the surgery I need. In return, you get my undying love, some hugs and cheap liquor. 

    The Impact

    I don't think words can ever accurately articulate the impact of the procedure I need. Outside of making my life much more simple and less stressful, I will finally have the chance to feel complete and happy. 

      Risks & Challenges

      The only risk and challenge facing you (the contributor) is the risk of  being around me when I take my shirt off in public, flex my huge guns, and proceeding with day as though nothing happened. 

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

        ~Do you have a small business or craft/make things? Rad! If you are able to donate an item for the silent auction, I would love that.

        ~Share this page in SAFE spaces. That may include your personal facebook, or not.

         ~Myspace message all your friends and tell them to come or donate. 

        ~If I am able to raise the amount I need for my surgery, you can always offer a helping hand to be there for me during the long, strenuous recovery.

         ~If you bake goodies, that's always appreciated too!

        ~Hugs always help too

story:
Help ZING ZAP Childhood Obesity


ZING knows we have a problem and together we can do something about it.

One-in-three children and two-in-three adults are overweight or obese, and 79 million are pre-diabetic.

These aren’t just statistics.  These are your friends, family, children, and perhaps even you. 

About 90 percent of our $3 trillion healthcare bill is directly attributed to PREVENTABLE conditions – conditions that one out of two people currently face.

ZING's job is to let kids and their families know about the FREE revolutionary new tool that can help  solve this problem. 

With your support, TODAY is the beginning of a new chapter to restoring health and wellness. 

We are delighted to announce Healthy Kids - Healthy You™, a program to help busy families take a healthy leap forward in improving their family wellness.

Healthy Kids–Healthy You is made possible through a partnership of leading organizations, beginning with NutriStyle™, a technology company that helps people quickly and painlessly balance nutrition with lifestyle goals. NutriStyle is joined by Building Healthier America, Produce for Better Health Foundation, Consolidar and the prestigious American Council on Exercise.

We are committed to bringing Healthy Kids–Healthy You to you and your community, no matter what.  But with your help we can do it much sooner.  Help us make Healthy Kids–Healthy You available for the 2014-15 school year. 

Join ZING in Hawaii!!!!

How it works:

Healthy Kids - Healthy You is powered by a sophisticated computer system created by NutriStyle that makes it easy to create menu plans for you and your family. It features the foods you like from the grocery store where you shop. It even provides you a shopping list, lets you include your favorite recipes, and helps you track and adjust for things such as weight goals, activity levels and food restrictions. You can even train it so it knows your food likes and dislikes.

"This highly flexible, multi-layered approach to generating menus acknowledges that every individual is unique. It blows the cookie cutter approach of other systems away”.  Steve Kinsley - Registered Dietitian

Our goal:

Through support from people just like you, we want to introduce our Healthy Kids- Healthy You program and the NutriStyle engine FREE OF CHARGE to those who are on the front lines of nutrition. This includes school leaders, agency staff and young families. With your support, we’ll do the following:

  • Reach out to PTAs where parents and school leaders can share this exciting tool with families.
  • Reach out to agency counselors through programs like the popular Women, Infants and Children program so they can provide this tool to their clients.
  • Secure the involvement of grocery stores to help us connect this tool to schools and families in your community.

With your support, we’ll be able to provide a Spanish version of the application.  We are confident that the Healthy Kids - Healthy You program will help Latino families achieve a more balanced and healthy diet. Latino leaders tell us this family-friendly program will help reverse rising obesity and diabetes rates and help the nation’s 50+ million Latinos achieve a better quality of life.


We are working diligently to introduce Healthy Kids - Healthy You as early as possible for this school year.  You can help us accomplish our ambitious goals by being part of our crowd-funding campaign on Indiegogo.

  • Just $10 supports a family of four.
  • Just $250 supports an entire classroom. We’ll have that classroom listed as “Class of the Day.”
  • Just $2,500 supports an entire school and gets that school listed as “School of the Week.”

Our web site: www.healthykidshealthyyou.com

Help us introduce this game-changing platform beginning with the 2014-15 school year. Please alert your neighbors, work colleagues, friends, and family about the Healthy Kids–Healthy You program. It is only possible through your generosity.

FLING ZING to 5 of your Friends: www.healthykidshealthyyou.com/zing/

Our targets:

1.  Target Goal: $500,000

  • 90 days post funding Healthy Kids - Healthy You will be launched with Web, Tablet, and Mobile applications.
  • Supports at least 50,000 Families on Healthy Kids - Healthy You via School and WIC outreach.

2.  Goal for Latino Program: $1,000,000

  • 90 days post Healthy Kids - Healthy You launch, we will have a Spanish version for Latinos with Web, Tablet, and Mobile applications
  • Supports 100,000 Families on Healthy Kids - Healthy You via School and WIC outreach.
3.  Stretch Goal

  • Help us to reach more schools and families. The more you give the more we can reach. We are ready to scale our program nationally, even globally.

Make a contribution and start making a difference today.

With gratitude,

Healthy Kids - Healthy You Team

story:
Hi there,

 I firmly believe that when a person gets to know something, sees its value, and comes to appreciate it, they will care for it. Getting people into the wilderness who would not otherwise have the confidence or skills to explore freely is key to saving wilderness areas. After all, if "wilderness" is just a concept that they see in movies or read about, it doesn't seem real. This is why I believe that running a guiding service is the best thing that I can do to help protect our fragile planet, while doing two of the things I love: being with people and being in the wilderness. 

 My name is Jeff Lush and I live in beautiful British Columbia. For many years I have been going on long treks into the wilderness and since my teens people have suggested that I start a business taking people with me. I will be officially launching Northwest Trailguides in June 2015, and begin taking people on guided day hikes. One of the prerequisites that I need to fulfill to start this service is to renew my certification in advanced wilderness first aid. This course by Slipstream First Aid is designed to help wilderness guides care for sick or injured clients until the client can be evacuated. In the past i have taken the course and obtained certification twice primarily for self-care during my many long trips into the wild, but it is expired now. Achieving recertification in AWFA  is a necessity for obtaining business insurance and re assuring clients that I can take care of them. In the world of first aid, the approved practices and procedures are constantly evolving so that people like me can provide the best and most up to date care available.

 The course is roughly $700. The remaining $500 that I am raising is to help pay my bills during the 10 days that I will miss work to take the course. If I am unable to raise the full amount needed during this indiegogo campaign, I will run it again to raise the rest of the funds. Any money raised in excess of of the goal will be used to add extras like a stethoscope and pulse oximeter to my first aid kit. Slipstream's 2015 calendar is not yet posted, but I plan to take the course in April or May 2015.

 In 2001/2002, I worked as a senior field guide for a program that takes at-risk youth on multi week expeditions into the Sonoran desert. With the skills I developed there, plus the five one-week long survival classes that I took at the famous Tracker School, and the many long trips I have taken on my own, I am more than qualified to lead people in the outdoors. 

 I sincerely thank you for your support in helping me achieve self employment, and the Earth will thank you for helping to bring more people into her wild places.

story:
Though i have no children, i am concerned about the type of world we will leave to coming generations. There are too many things wrong -- and getting worse. I thought i could make a difference where i am by founding a sustainability initiative in Washington DC. I soon realized that this was not enough; no local efforts by themselves can reverse the decline. Our problems are systemic, the result of the monetary system and profit-seeking. The solution must be systemic - and global.     

                  

My background is varied so i just call myself an imagineer. I have imagined a new economic paradigm that redefines value and resets relationships. A Net Planetary Value (NPV) index will allow us to manage resources equitably and sustainably.

 

Chart showing comparison of monetary system with NPV. For details go to the website.

 

Everyone counts. Everything is counted.

I'm not an economist or mathematician, just a visionary. I've set out in a paper as much as i am capable of, the full text of which is accessible on the website. I have completed so far two of a series of, possibly six or seven, pixel paintings (digital compositions/mashups) to accompany the text. This will be published as a book in a number of formats. Books, paintings and myself will comprise a traveling lecture/exhibition for whomever will have us.

 

 

 

Paintings completed to date - left Commodity: Sugar; right: Commodity: Tobacco, each 27 x 39 inches. Others planned may include cocoa, coffee, bananas, bauxite, tourism. The series and exhibition will be entitled "Case Study: Jamaica", the country with which i am most familiar, demonstrating the colonial, exploitive, hierarchical structure made possible by money, and cause of environmental degradation and the plight of the 99%. Monetarily, Jamaica  is a basket case, along with Greece, Spain, Ireland and other countries. The title alludes to the Jamaican expression, "given basket to carry water," an inherently impossible undertaking. The untenable and inequitable relationships can be replicated in all countries and situations, your own included, where your labor is the declining and expendable commodity.   

Your contributions to this campaign will go to:

  • Publishing costs for the book outlining the new economic paradigm
  • Completion of the series of paintings to be included in book
  • Production and preparation of content for traveling exhibition
  • Covering cost of perks to funders. Perks will include t-shirts with the PANACEA logo so you can help promote the idea, copies of books and prints.
  • Idiegogo fees which may be as much as 12% of amount raised. 

The estimate may seem low to accomplish so much but i will be doing much of the work myself, having already self-published successfully. Whether or not the target is reached, the project will continue as i am fully committed to it. There is nothing more critically urgent and important for me to do at this time.   

I'll be first to recognize the irony of soliciting money for a project that sets out to supplant it, but it is the system in which we are embedded. It leaves me no choice. With NPV, crowd-funding will be unnecessary, but websites such as this will still perform the function (which is how they increase their NPV) of bringing projects and ideas to public attention. How you vote on a given scale would influence the assigned NPV of the enterprise.

Other aspects presaging and fully supported by NPV, and already familiar to most, are Open Source, Creative Commons, cradle-to-cradle manufacturing, and access to goods and services without owning, like Netflix, ZipCar, bicycle share, tool-lending libraries, etc.

Case in point: Contributors outside of the US, please add 10% to defray shipping costs. The US Postal Service needs our support. Under NPV, the USPS will be self-sustaining, having access to resources concomitant with its level of value creation. No need to go a-begging a recalcitrant Congress.  

The Impact

If this takes off, this will be a game-changer, in the league of Copernicus' heliocentrism and Einstein's relativity. Our whole concept of value will be freed of the corrupting and corroding taint of money. Everything associated with barter, exchange, profit, exploitation, interest, investment, insurance, and banking will fade away. Not to mention bribery and embezzlement. Profit-making will be replaced by value creation. The environment will be saved. Poverty and deprivation will be no more.

You can choose to be a pioneer, help make history, by supporting this pivotal campaign. Everyone will be impacted down the line.   

The task now is to spread this idea as widely as possible, but more importantly, to seize the imagination of those who can see it through to implementation. This could be you, some student in a dorm room, a geek in Hyderabad, who gets holarchitecture, system design, algorithms, and has a driving passion to make a difference.

  • Donate what you can.
  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Join the team to do whatever it is you do best to help get this going.
  • Like us on Facebook

 

Some reviews

THE NPV economic theory is brilliant, exciting, and elegant in its functional simplicity. The NPV system integrates the foundation economy, the ecosystem, with the more recent, emergent evolutionary holon: the complexity of the human economic system. NPV is structured such that it automatically synchs the measurement and health of ecosystems, both micro and macro, with human economies -- IN REAL TIME! 

NPV is not a blank slate concept. It allows for human nature as it is, and appropriately, to my mind, allows the market to work, reflecting the innate, bio/cultural differentiation of human abilities, drive and execution of goals. Healthy ecosystems and our ability to create almost infinite things from these finite resources, are intrinsically balanced with NPV.

As I understand it, NPV is a huge step forward in cultural evolution. 

NPV is a postgenetic code that encompasses a huge swath of human information processing. It’s the most hopeful concept I’ve read to deal with the multiple dilemmas resulting from our exponential growth in both population and technological power. Frankly, I love it!

- C. E. Atkins, Editor at Postgenetic.com

------------------------------

I think this plan is genius and long overdue.

- Jefferson (Comment left on blog)

-------------------------------

Excellent and just the kind of out of the box thinking that will pull the species and biosphere from the brink of extinction ... The ideas you are putting forth are highly cogent and exactly the kind of retooling humanity needs if we are going to escape with our heads intact ... As for what you have outlined for NPV I do see it as a very strong framework for evolving our monetary system beyond its current myopic dimensions and toward a much saner and holistic "resource accounting system" which properly folds in the wider social & ecological costs which we can no longer afford to ignore without catastrophic consequences.

- Brian Thompson, blogger at Imagine Emergence

-------------------------------

Your idea rocks...!!! I have read the whole PANACEA site ... i'm very excited and moved to learn about this perspective, hell of a notion, really ... how to organize human culture in an optimal way, and the NPV index is just such a natural idea.

- Jyre Heffron, musician

--------------------------------

If you haven’t already come to the conclusion that financial fictions such as money, taxes, fees, interest, debt and insurance are the root of all evil, then read on and become part of a growing universal community eager to embrace Net Planetary Value and forego the toxic effects of money and the wage slavery and suppression it causes.

I am convinced that the Net Planetary Value system envisioned is the environmental, social and ethical values based system that will lead us to a more equitable distribution and positive use of our planetary assets – natural and human resources, and time.

If implementing Larry Chang’s Net Planetary Value proposition means more of us will follow our bliss, pursue learning, become more engaged in governance, healthy community building and sustainability and we will eliminate a market economy founded on wealth, then take my money now and apply it toward creating planetary value!

- Lynn Fitzpatrick

--------------------------------

You have bolstered my spirits in my effort to "Wake People Up". Although there are times I think my life would be so much simpler if I just took the Blue Pill.

- Liberalthinker1

-------------------------------

I'd really like to see these ideas in action ... Well, it is amazing. Keep at it. I wish you the best of luck.

- Zeitgeist

-------------------------------

It is very accurate and true, and even the idea for the new system sounds decent and reasonable. There are a lot more details and factors to consider and work out, but it's not bad.

- Psychedelic94

-------------------------------

PANACEA

About Larry Chang
story_txt:
Though i have no children, i am concerned about the type of world we will leave to coming generations. There are too many things wrong -- and getting worse. I thought i could make a difference where i am by founding a sustainability initiative in Washington DC. I soon realized that this was not enough; no local efforts by themselves can reverse the decline. Our problems are systemic, the result of the monetary system and profit-seeking. The solution must be systemic - and global.     

                   

My background is varied so i just call myself an imagineer. I have imagined a new economic paradigm that redefines value and resets relationships. A Net Planetary Value (NPV) index will allow us to manage resources equitably and sustainably.
 

Chart showing comparison of monetary system with NPV. For details go to the website.
 
Everyone counts. Everything is counted.
I'm not an economist or mathematician, just a visionary. I've set out in a paper as much as i am capable of, the full text of which is accessible on the website. I have completed so far two of a series of, possibly six or seven, pixel paintings (digital compositions/mashups) to accompany the text. This will be published as a book in a number of formats. Books, paintings and myself will comprise a traveling lecture/exhibition for whomever will have us.

 
 
 
Paintings completed to date - left Commodity: Sugar; right: Commodity: Tobacco, each 27 x 39 inches. Others planned may include cocoa, coffee, bananas, bauxite, tourism. The series and exhibition will be entitled "Case Study: Jamaica", the country with which i am most familiar, demonstrating the colonial, exploitive, hierarchical structure made possible by money, and cause of environmental degradation and the plight of the 99%. Monetarily, Jamaica  is a basket case, along with Greece, Spain, Ireland and other countries. story:
Rick Powell Needs Our Help - Please Read

My name is Erik Armstrong. I am starting this campaign for my very good friend, Rick Powell, who was working Monday April 1, 2013 in Seattle as a driver for a car service when on break late that night, was suddenly approached by a 19-year old who attempted to rob him and then shot him three times without provocation, hitting him with all shots in the upper chest area.

Rick fought back bravely and the suspect escaped, but was captured a short time later and will soon face justice. The battle had just begun for my friend.

Because of the wounds he sustained, Rick nearly died in the street that night, and was it not for the quick response of the paramedics and the work of the emergency room surgeons at Harborview Medical Center; he would not be with us today.

Rick is that person that you are so glad your life has crossed paths with. There isn't anyone in the world who can say anything but great things about this man, and of course, Rick always has great things to say about everyone as well.

Along with being just a wonderful human being, Rick Powell is a very talented musician and very active in the local Seattle music scene. In years past, I personally had the opportunity to be in two different bands with him and it was definitely some of the best times in my life. He always has something funny or interesting to say and the kind of outlook on life that motivates other people to want to do better.

Right now, Rick is recovering from this horrendous act of random violence and needs our help. He has needed a great deal of life saving care thus far and will need much more help during his long recovery process. The bills for this care, needless to say, are going to be very high.

To Summarize

Rick is without medical insurance, and like a lot of people, especially younger people trying to make ends meet, this is an unfortunate reality. My goal is to raise $25,000 through this campaign so that every penny can go towards paying whatever hospital bills or procure whatever services Rick needs during his recovery.

The Impact

Contributing to this campaign to help my dear friend, Rick Powell, will mean that you are helping a truly decent and good human being in his darkest time. In spite of all that has happened, he is in good spirits at the hospital and I know that he will make a full recovery because of the kind of character that he is made of and his positive outlook on life.

 

Thank You,

Erik Armstrong

story:
Short Summary

We are a three year old business who makes the finest quality hockey masks in the world.  We are developing the ultimate hockey mask for all levels of hockey player from serious amateur to college player both men and women and high school and prep players to midget and youth hockey.  We are raising funds in this manner to maintain quality product development outstanding service and to avoid venture groups who have offered to take 85% of our company, raise the product cost to the consumer and cheapen production.  We think differently.  I was the inventor of the two piece combination hockey masks in 1974.  After a long executive career in broadcast, cable, digital technology and satellite TV,  I decided three years ago restart the invention of hockey masks and take the product to a new level of design, quality and customer service to hockey players at all levels worldwide. 

Hockey players are plagued with wearing full wire cages which impede vision and are considered a weapon by the NCAA committee on hockey face shields.  We have a better idea and have proven our point over the last three years. We are seeking funding to develop a new injection molded two piece polycarbonate hockey mask that will give a player wonderful vision, high impact protection and a choice of colors for the light weight polycarbonate cage frame for organizations and teams.  

The prototypes for the new mask design, the Elite mask are compete.  Both lens and mold drawings are done. We need this working capital to move forward in a timely manner to meet the spring and fall 2014 orders for this new mask.  To see the Elite mask design you can visit our Boulder Hockey Shield Co website www.hockeyfaceshields.com at http://hockeyfaceshields.com/update-design.html.  We currently sell all the major hockey dealers in the US at Hockey Monkey, Hockey Giant, Pure Hockey, Peranis, Total Hockey and many more.  We have seven hockey reps who are commissioned to sell.  We also sell on our website.  We believe that players, parents and leagues have been looking for a better face shield since I invented hockey shields and visors in 1973.  After a long career in broadcast, cable, satellite and digital technology I restarted my vision of better protection for hockey players.  Please see our story from the 2010 Denver Post Business section article here;  http://www.denverpost.com/search/ci_16568628#ixzz1535e7spq


What We Need & What You Get

Our use of funds:  

Please considering funding us for a minimum investment of $75.00.  Your investment of $75.00 will reward you with a brand new Avision Ahead Elite mask that retails for $120.95 saving you $45.95.  We will also send you your mask at no charge.  You be the very first hockey players to own a two piece convex hockey mask with a snap out- replaceable lens.  The mask will come in clear or black cage frames to start.  Like our current models will will mold up to 10 colors of cage frames.  All lens are distortion free- optically correct and crystal clear.  

We will build the mold for the new Elite mask outlined in the video on our design page of our website.  (see www.hockeyfaceshields.com.  The injected molded, convex lens and accompanying cage frame which snap together require two molds.  Having a replaceable convex injection molded lens provides optimal vision and durability.  The finished product lens is hard coated with 100% fog free and scratch resistant application on both sides of the lens.  The competitions one piece mask fogs on the outside and scratches on the inside.  When it scratches on the inside it soon fogs and their goes the buyers investment.  The competitors have hockey masks that clouds, discolors and fogs preventing players and parents from better overall vision to see the great game of ice hockey.  Full wire hockey cages distort every players vision and delays reaction time and are heavy and if they bend they are illegal. 

Our Avision Ahead product line at Boulder Hockey Shield Company are crystal clear and tough as nails with our two current senior and junior models and our professional convex injection molded half shield visors are fog free both sides and scratch resistant too both sides.  The Elite mask is streamlined and contoured to the face.  The design of the cage frame has aerodynamic airflow foils to channel the air to the players upper face as they skate.

Use of funds.  The mold costs are $30,000 each.  The balance of the funding will go to product inventory and packaging to meet order demands.

  • The PVC Packaging molds have been design to show off the masks for store shelves or pegs in stores.  Having clear plastic packaging allows potential consumers to see the mask and colors when entering the store as opposed to box packaging which does not show the mask and creates problems for store owners who find customer taking apart the packages to see competitors products.
  • Review of your investment.
  • The perks for investing you will receive a free Elite mask of your choice of color valued at $120.
  • We will also use the funds for HECC (United States) and CSA (Canadian) Certifications.  Our current senior and junior models are HECC approved for all levels of ice hockey in the United States.  And in Canada we are CSA certified for our junior mask.

The Impact

  • Since we are a small company but already selling these funds will help grow our business to a competitive level, avoid venture groups and maintain control of our quality and customer service.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean they can’t help:

  • Send a note to your friends.  We are a word of month company with limited advertising in USA and Canadian publications.  If we can save on marketing and advertising we can pass the savings along to you.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Hello,

My name is Kayla, I am a mother of two living in Lansing Mi. I have a 5 year old and a 1 year old. My mother has been the main support in my life. through bad choices and wrong decisions my mother has stood by my side. She has put me through school and supported me with babysitting, food, clothing, money for bills and transpiration. She is an amazing grandmother and a wonderful mother.

 

In 2009 Blue care network closed after my mother worked as a pediatric medical assistant for 17 years. She struggled to run a purse kiosk in the meridian mall for three years. In december of 2011 she closed her stand. I thought it was because she wasn't making enough income and then in January 2012 she announced to me she had found a lump in her breast and that is why she closed her business. She said that she did not tell me any sooner because she did not want to ruin christmas. In february 2012 she was diagnosed with breast cancer. My mother has been so brave through out this whole year. She has good days and bad like everyone. Without insurance she was given state medicaid and food stamps. As a daughter i feel helpless my feiance works full time minimum wage making $800.00 a month and we are doing all we can to support our daughters and my mommy! The bills are unpaid and the stress and worry is taking its toll on our family.

I started this campaign to raise money to help lift the burden of the bills. My ultimate goal is to take my mom on a short peaceful vacation with the girls so that she can have one great memory before she is to sick to enjoy her time with us. And for once let her enjoy her time without worry overwhelming her mind.

Other Ways You Can Help.

Please send your prayers to above for us. anyone who has had a family member in this situation please send any advice or hints on how to deal with this struggle. Please get the word out about our story and request. Team Kitty.

You can also follow her journey if you friend request her on facebook Kitty Fluke-Henry in Lansing Michigan.

In december of 2011 she closed her stand. I thought it was because she wasn't making enough income and then in January 2012 she announced to me she had found a lump in her breast and that is why she closed her business. She said that she did not tell me any sooner because she did not want to ruin christmas. In february 2012 she was diagnosed with breast cancer. My mother has been so brave through out this whole year. She has good days and bad like everyone. Without insurance she was given state medicaid and food stamps. As a daughter i feel helpless my feiance works full time minimum wage making $800.00 a month and we are doing all we can to support our daughters and my mommy! The bills are unpaid and the stress and worry is taking its toll on our family.
I started this campaign to raise money to help lift the burden of the bills. My ultimate goal is to take my mom on a short peaceful vacation with the girls so that she can have one great memory before she is to sick to enjoy her time with us. And for once let her enjoy her time without worry overwhelming her mind.

Other Ways You Can Help.
Please send your prayers to above for us. anyone who has had a family member in this situation please send any advice or hints on how to deal with this struggle. Please get the word out about our story and request. Team Kitty.
You can also follow her journey if you friend request her on facebook Kitty Fluke-Henry in Lansing Michigan.

story:
That's One Tuff HUBS over There

 

If the Hubs looks a little PO'd in the photo it's because his normally wonderful health insurance will not cover the surgery that his normally wonderful wife, Pamela, ME, needs to have in order to grow old with him and see the granddaughters grow up and so on.  It's wasn't a large amount... $64,000... but they would not cover it.

 I had a one year window in which my heart will remain strong enough to weather the surgery and then continue to beat long and strong for many years to come. That year is up and surgery is scheduled to take place at the end of JANUARY!

HOWEVER..we had a major donor back out due to family issues and as hard as everyone has worked to raise funds for everything and as much bargain hunting as we could safely do regarding the whole process we are still about $5500 short of the needed total.

 We have unfortunately placed deposits down that are non-refundable and even if they were, my docs have said it's now or never so... we are still hanging tough and HOLDING FAST!

I am inviting you to take part in saving a life. I am asking you to help me spend graduation day with Molly and Jocelyn, and to see my youngest daughter, Natalie, get married.

 I need $5000 just to cover the known expenses; anything over that would help to defray the medical costs following surgery.

I am a quilt and jewelry designer.  I invite you to visit my website to see my work... I have so much more that I would like to design and make!  

Please... we are desparate - we have only 3 weeks and have exhausted every financial resource that we have.  If you cannot donate funds then please share  this site, my website, my story.  And if you pray... please add me to your list.

God's peace to you for helping, Pamela and family

www.holdfastartworks.com

 

THe attached video is one that was made for a raffle of one of my art quilts...

story:
Warp 3 Medical Recorder

Estimated Retail Price*: ask us

 

 Point of Care Diagnosis Accident & Emergency 
 

 

 

 

Digitalized Medical Information Cloud-based IT Solution 

Warp 3 Medical Recorder Kit

Valkan 3 Tablet

  • Computing and Communication Platform
  • data and images Processes
  • Info-graphically Interface
  • Real-time Medical IT support


 

Volans 3 Vital Sign Module

  • Point-of-Care Vital Signs (4-lead ECG / Respiration / Non-Invasive Blood Pressure/ SpO2 / Temperature )
  • Professionally Pre-process 
  • Wireless Data Transfer

 

Urxa 3 Ultrasound Module

  • Point-of-Care Wireless Ultrasound Imaging
  • May be the Smallest Ultrasound Device
  • Quick Vescular Access Guidance

 

 


 

 

 

Standard Configuration

 (Estimated Retail Price*: ask us)

 

  • 1x Valkan 3 Tablet
  • 1x Volans 3 Vital Sign Module
  • 1x Urxa Ultrasound Module 
  • Operation Guidance & Accessory

 

Significant Milestones

2010: Project development launches with technology probe

2012: Technology integration work commences. Partnerships with: ADI, InfoRich, Skyworth, Shenzhen University and others established

2013: Technical solutions and plans confirmed

2014-2015: Prototype complete and working: Quality compliance, clinical trial and independent lab testing underway.

2016: CE marking filed, Mass production initiated, Commercial available in July.

 

Risks & Challenges

Since the prototype is already finished and fully functioning, and we work closely with suppliers here in Shenzhen, we don't foresee any major delays to production. Especially once we've reached our funding target. However, since the Warp 3 Medical Recorder is a professional medical device, the certification process could set us back a few months due to the unpredictable waiting lists of different certificate test labs that are out of our control. Our team will work day and night to keep delays to a minimum while keeping funders regularly updated.

 

Regular Updates

We have dedicated teams that handle regular updates and news feeds.

 

Reports in the Media

Rift Health - Tricorders: What are the options?

The EET Magazine from Global Sources Jan. 2015 (in Chinese). 

 

 Q&A

 

Qualified Distributors

Click to register as a distributing partner!

Warp United is willing to work with distributors from around the globe. As the medical device should be monitored under regulation by the ISO 13485 quality assurance system, we will choose only qualified partners that are capable of providing safe and efficient service on the ground. Criteria as follows:

  • Experience in medical devices, especially patient monitoring and ultrasound marketing and service;
  • Able to perform local user's application training;
  • Quality Assurence system to track down every single device for safety and service;
  • Reliable credit and good name in local market;
  • The will to go boldly beyond no one has been before.

 

Delivery, Reservation and Waiting List

Due to our production plan, the first batch of 100 units will be delivered to the first 100 pre-orders separately. And the batch afterwards would follow one month later or so, and we will deliver them according to 2 factors: funding date and quantity, the earlier and the more you fund, the sooner your order will be sent. 

Also, we will consider the funding date and volume as additional points when appointing distributors.

Meet the teams

Warp 3 Medical Recorder project is a multi-national, cross-profession joint venture of 10+ teams, here are some photos of the main body:

 

 

Warp United Scientific, Shenzhen, China

 

Give us a Tweet if you care!

Even if you cannot contribute financially, it would really help if you can give us a shout out to tell your friends about our crowdfunding campaign.

story:
Who We Are

FP YOUTHOUTCRY FOUNDATION

Mission:

To increase opportunities for success by providing programs, services and events to under- served youth and their families through experiences that Entertain, Educate and Empower.

The Facility:
The H.U.B.B. (Helping Us Become Better) Community Empowerment Center is an 8,000 square feet renovated space resulting in a “solution driven” facility strategically named The H.U.B.B. This community empowerment center will encompass and provide signature FP (and other community organizations’ programs) services and events to surrounding communities. 
In order to sustain FP’s continuous growth and success, The H.U.B.B. will house three key program entities that Entertain, Educate and Empower. These platforms encompass disciplines that have been proven to promote character building, educational development, and cultural enrichment through workforce development, social services as well as arts and entertainment in one central location.

If Not Us, Then Who? If Not Now, The When?

The Program:
Youth, Television, Film & Press (YTFP) exhibits the creativity of our children as they learn about television and video pre and post-production. Students are engaged and exposed to the tools, techniques, training, networks and real life experiences required to succeed in the careers of photography, videography and the media industry, with an overall emphasis on public speaking. YTFP concentrates heavily on developing leadership skills and creative expression through visual and moral business strategies.

The YTFP workshops are facilitated by none other than the legendary DashLiving of UndeniableTV.net (https://www.facebook.com/undeniabletv.dashliving, https://www.youtube.com/user/dashliving)


How You can Help

It takes a village to raise a child and we are moving forward to establish a system where cooperative economics is coupled with collective work and responsibility. 
As Talib mentioned in the video, in a nutshell...

We are working to raise $50,000 to be able to provide much needed equipment, materials, supplies and staffing to help us continue our work with Newark's young people. Cameras, Computers, Audio equipment and a vehicle to transport the young people. 

We are certain that when young people are provided with extra curricular activities that they are less likely to get involved in negative behavior. We are certain that being exposed to positive people, places and things helps to inspire young people to have a positive outlook. We are certain that the power of video to give our youth and young adults a chance to be seen and heard is very valuable as it relates to their self esteem levels. We are certain that there is a large percentage of people who want to be part of a positive change in the city of Newark and other urban areas. We are certain of these things because we have witnessed these things. Please help us to witness more of these things by supporting this campaign.

In return for your support we have a number of items that we are providing to our contributors. (see Perks.)

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kerri, and I am a behavioral consultant working with kids with autism.  Recently, my sister-in-law was re-diagnosed with metastatic breast cancer (at 31 and now again at 41).  Instead of sitting around and doing nothing, we have created a logo (FUBC) and are attempting to start a foundation which will allow us to donate money to research for stage 4 breast cancer (a particularly under-funded disease). We are hoping to increase awareness, raise money, save lives, and give a giant FU to breast cancer.

Currently, we need funds to create a foundation (expensive paperwork!) and to make t-shirts with our logo.  The t-shirts and hopefully other merchandise, will help raise money  for research.  Since my sister-in-law is working with wonderful doctors in the New York area, we will be donating to their research.   

Anyone who donates over 40.00 dollars will get an FUBC t-shirt!

My sister-in-law is a fighter...but can't do this alone.  I'm going to do all I can to help research and find a cure for this horrible disease that will effect 1 in 8 women.  They will be your mothers, daughters, aunts, and best friends.  Please help us set up our foundation.

If you can't help with money, please help by looking at and sharing our facebook page (FU Breast Cancer)

story:
Short Summary

Annadel Oseta is a 24-year-old woman diagnosed (at age 22) of Chronic Glomerulonephritis - an advanced stage of life-threatening kidney disease. She is currently undergoing dialysis 3x a week to fill-in her kidneys' malfunction. She is recommended for kidney transplant as the only way to survive this threat.

She was previously working as a Junior Software Engineer - but is now jobless because of her condition. Annadel is the eldest among 4 children - all her siblings are still attending school. Her mother cooks as a chef in a local catering business in her town - just enough to survive day to day living.

Annadel needs help to come up with her kidney transplant needs.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking at raising at least half of her kidney transplant cost. The remainder might have to come from other sources (help from family and friends).

  • $50,000.00 (~Php2,000,000.00) would all go to the transplant cost and post-op care 
  • If any of the fund is unused - it will be donated to the Kidney Foundation of the Philippines http://www.kfp.org.ph/

The Impact

How to save a life? This is it.

  • If you help, we have a big chance of saving her. 
  • Having the transplant would give her a chance to quality life that she once had
  • In the Philippines, there is 95% survival rate in one year and more than 70% 5 year survival rate - see http://www.nkti.gov.ph/kidney_transplant.do?id=6763

Other Ways You Can Help

Aside from monetary donations, you can help through the following:

  • Share this campaign to your contacts or whoever you think might be able to help
  • Occasionally, Ann needs blood donations (to be announced if there will be needs)
  • Include Ann on your prayers

You can all view more about this campaign on http://helpingann.blogspot.com.

story:
Short Summary

This is a personal endeavor to raise funds to be donated to the Na Wahine Softball program.  All funds raised by this fundraiser will be donated to the Na Wahine Softball program through the UH Foundation.

With these funds the Softball Booster club will purchase a complete heat press system for the express purpose of pressing custom softball designed tee shirts at each game.  They will have two new designs for each series, they will also be able to personalize each shirt with your name on the front for an additional charge.

All funds raised by selling of tee shirts will be used exclusively to support the University of Hawai'i Rainbow Wahine Softball program via post-game meals, financing the professional development of the coaching staff, assisting with the purchasing of additional softball equipment/training aids, and as needed to help offset educational-related expenses.

At the end of this campaign all funds will be deposited into my account which in turn will donated online to the UH Foundation softball booster account.

Disclaimer:  This fundraising effort is not connected or  affiliated with the University of Hawaii, University of Hawaii Athletic Department, University of Hawaii Softball Program or the Na Wahine Softball Booster Club, this it a personal effort to raise funds for the Softball team.



    Other Ways You Can Help

    Share this page on your facebook page, your twitter account any way you can, the more people who see it the better our chances are to reach our goal!!!!!

story:
We are looking to raise money for Jerry the Bear for Kolton. Kolton is 22 months and was diagnosed with type 1 diabetes at the age of 17 months. It is hard to explain what is happening to him and why at such a young age. We believe this bear will help him not only understand but learn how to take responsibility for his condition. He also has a very caring older sister who would love the non-electronic Jerry the Bear so she can help him with his bear.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise money for one electronic bear and one non-electronic bear:

  • The bear's are $299 for the electronic and $99 for the non-electronic.
  • Any funds raised over what we need will be donated to Jerry the Bear foundation.

story:
The Living Well Institute Whole Person Health Community Research Project

The Living Well Institute concept is shared by many who are empowering individuals to take responsibility for their health.  Our hope will be to connect the dots, and we are encouraged when we are reminded that the truth does endure the test of time. 

50 years ago the founding Dean of the Penn State Hershey Medical Ctr, Dr George Harrell said,    “Medicine can never be a science."   He goes on further to share... "I believe in the art of medicine, understanding a patient’s values, family and community ties were key components in the successful diagnosis and treatment of a patient.”

A time for change is coming and it is happening both within the healthcare system and the community.  We look forward to supporting the process, we hope you will join us in our efforts to make a difference.

Penny Koval D.C.

Founder

Living Well Care


What We Need & What You Get

$50,000 will go towards the research of Phase 1, Phase 2 that will allow LWC to expand its reach internationally.

Online presence to extend the Living Well Care message internationally.

CHOOSE ONE OF THE FOLLOWING PERKS

100 Perks at $50 LWC New Year's Inspiration Gift

Sign up for the LWC New Year's Inspirational Gift, which includes an hour video of the Living Well team sharing inspired stories and an MP3 album of therapeutic music by composer and certified music practitioner James Schaller C.M.P. to help calm and ease your daily transition times.

100 perks at $200 Online Seven Week LWC Seminar

The Living Well Online Seminar is a five hour, seven week online course that is the cutting-edge for self-managed health care transformations. Start 2014 with the right plan of action with a vital online community to share and grow each week.

5 perks at $5000 Private 4 week Live LWC Seminar

The LWC Team will come to your office, hospital, workplace or even home to give four, two-hour seminars to get your team and workplace on the path of three dimensional health. Imagine the productivity of your team and family rowing together for a united daily health experience! An amazing gift for your extended family, team or organization!

Even if we do not meet the full goal we will apply funds to the study and to online community awareness campaigns as funding allows.

The Impact

As our culture experiences a transition in health care it will be our hope to support the process by creating a resource that empowers individuals (both providers and consumers) to participate in the process.  

Living WellCare acknowledges the following reality:

IF…“Health is the condition of optimum physical, mental and social well-being, and not merely the absence of diseases and infirmities.”  - Dorland’s Medical Dictionary, World Health Organization 

AND…”What we eat and drink, how often we exercise, where we live and work, and how we nurture our children matter more to health than doctors and hospitals.  An estimated 60 percent of early deaths are caused by behavioral, social and environmental influences.  In comparison, medical care plays a relatively minor role preventing only 10 percent to 15 percent of early deaths.”  -Brookings Institute: Mark  B. McClellan,  Engleberg Center for Health Care Reform and Alice M. Rivlin, Met. Policy Program, Eco. Studies

THEN… “About 70 percent of our health has to do with how we live our lives.”     -Dr. John Abramson, Harvard Medical School

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Ask your friends  to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Summary

The Living Well Institute is the home for Whole Person Health advocacy, research and education that benefits the entire community – individuals, families, and the healthcare profession alike.  The research project that needs your help will provide a platform for validating the Whole Person Health methodology – providing critical proof-of-concept that the mind-body-spirit approach changes lives and dramatically increases the efficacy of existing health care approaches. 

Phase 1 

Research provided the foundation of qualitative research (n = 25) to clearly define the methodology and provide themes of experiences of people who had been part of Living Well.  The four themes identified that each person had a transformational experience by participating in Living Well, the community and the integrator were critical to that transformation, and the person took person responsibility for their health – in mind, body and spirit – to achieve balance and well-being.  As a social scientist and professor at Penn State Hershey College of Medicine, I have developed the research plan and continue to support the concept of whole-person health.  

Phase 2 

Research will involve pilot testing the methodology in a population of people with type 2 diabetes during a 12-month study.  This pilot test will open the doors for greater funding through the National Institutes of Health (NIDDK), the American Diabetes Association, or smaller foundations that support the work.  Without the research, Living Well would not have the foundation to build the concept, nor would we know the efficacy and potential improvements that could be made to the program without testing.  Feedback from real-world clinical experience is crucial for comparing and improving behavioral interventions.  After the research, the methodology of Living Well may be used by millions of people in many different contexts, not just medical-related.  Therefore, research is critical to record and assess the experiences in clinical practice to develop guidelines for best practices for integrating mind-body-spirit into life. 

Education is critical to Living Well, as it brings the three dimensional perspective of mind-body-spirit to help people become aware of the 7 steps in the lifestyle program.  They include:  (1) take responsibility for your health; (2) renew your mind; (3) attend to your body; (4) cultivate your spirit; (5) maximize your resources; (6) make a plan; and (7) practice the integration daily.  Through the lifestyle program that teaches this principles, participants learn to apply these steps into their life.  As the qualitative research has shown, the education around these principles and the daily attention to mind, body and spirit produces sustaining results.  People who are in pain, or experience illness, or heartache, are generally open to learning something new to improve their situation.  We used a people-centered approach in education, where our educators merely act as facilitators and integrators to allow individuals to create their own plan for health.  

The combination of research and education are the two pillars of Living Well, and the offer the support to sustain funding and ongoing research for the Institute.  It will assure quality, integrity and the best possible product to improve whole-person health and serve the most people in a better way.

Dr. Heather Stuckey
story_txt:
The Living Well Institute Whole Person Health Community Research Project
The Living Well Institute concept is shared by many who are empowering individuals to take responsibility for their health.  Our hope will be to connect the dots, and we are encouraged when we are reminded that the truth does endure the test of time. 
50 years ago the founding Dean of the Penn State Hershey Medical Ctr, Dr George Harrell said,    “Medicine can never be a science."   He goes on further to share... "I believe in the art of medicine, understanding a patient’s values, family and community ties were key components in the successful diagnosis and treatment of a patient.”
A time for change is coming and it is happening both within the healthcare system and the community.  We look forward to supporting the process, we hope you will join us in our efforts to make a difference.
Penny Koval D.C.FounderLiving Well Care

What We Need & What You Get
$50,000 will go towards the research of Phase 1, Phase 2 that will allow LWC to expand its reach internationally.
Online presence to extend the Living Well Care message internationally.
CHOOSE ONE OF THE FOLLOWING PERKS
100 Perks at $50 LWC New Year's Inspiration Gift
Sign up for the LWC New Year's Inspirational Gift, which includes an hour video of the Living Well team sharing inspired stories and an MP3 album of therapeutic music by composer and certified music practitioner James Schaller C.M.P. to help calm and ease your daily transition times.
100 perks at $200 Online Seven Week LWC Seminar
The Living Well Online Seminar is a five hour, seven week online course that is the cutting-edge for self-managed health care transformations. Start 2014 with the right plan of action with a vital online community to share and grow each week.
5 perks at $5000 Private 4 week Live LWC Seminar
The LWC Team will come to your office, hospital, workplace or even home to give four, two-hour seminars to get your team and workplace on the path of three dimensional health. Imagine the productivity of your team and family rowing together for a united daily health experience! An amazing gift for your extended family, team or organization!

Even if we do not meet the full goal we will apply funds to the study and to online community awareness campaigns as funding allows.
The Impact
As our culture experiences a transition in health care it will be our hope to support the process by creating a resource that empowers individuals (both providers and consumers) to participate in the process.  
Living WellCare acknowledges the following reality:
IF…“Health is the condition of optimum physical, mental and social well-being, and not merely the absence of diseases and infirmities.”  - Dorland’s Medical Dictionary, World Health Organization 
AND…”What we eat and drink, how often we exercise, where we live and work, and how we nurture our children matter more to health than doctors and hospitals.  An estimated 60 percent of early deaths are caused by behavioral, social and environmental influences.  In comparison, medical care plays a relatively minor role preventing only 10 percent to 15 percent of early deaths.”  -Brookings Institute: Mark  B. McClellan,  Engleberg Center for Health Care Reform and Alice M. Rivlin, Met. Policy Program, Eco. Studies
THEN… “About 70 percent of our health has to do with how we live our lives.”     -Dr. John Abramson, Harvard Medical School

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
Ask your friends  to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Summary

Education is critical to Living Well, as it brings the three dimensional perspective of mind-body-spirit to help people become aware of the 7 steps in the lifestyle program.  They include:  (1) take responsibility for your health; (2) renew your mind; (3) attend to your body; (4) cultivate your spirit; (5) maximize your resources; (6) make a plan; and (7) practice the integration daily.  Through the lifestyle program that teaches this principles, participants learn to apply these steps into their life.  As the qualitative research has shown, the education around these principles and the daily attention to mind, body and spirit produces sustaining results.  People who are in pain, or experience illness, or heartache, are generally open to learning something new to improve their situation.  We used a people-centered approach in education, where our educators merely act as facilitators and integrators to allow individuals to create their own plan for health.

story:
Update - Feb 4th 2016:

Dear Contributors,
We were able to find a factory in China to produce SBB and have signed a manufacturing agreement. The initial fee of $33k for tooling and sourcing of materials have been paid. But due to New Year Celebration (Chinese NY), they will start until Feb 22nd. According to the agreement, the tooling stage will take 12 weeks. Then we are looking at about 3-4 months to actually produce the first batch of 1000 units. We'are sorry, but these are the realities of bringing such a complicated product to market.

But fear not, you will not loose your contribution. We have processed quite a few refunds already and have enough money to refund the rest. Please send your Paypal email to us (cs @ smartbackbrace.com) and we will process your refund promptly.

Thank you

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
Update - Dec 15th 2015:

Dear Contributors,
I am happy to report that the design and development stage of SBB is complete! At the end we've end up making 4 different prototypes with several units each of the main body and over a dozen (!) different designs for straps. At this time we are sourcing all the components in China and working with IDP's manufacturer there to come up with a manufacturing quote. Since the SBB is fairly complex peace of engineering with few specialized components - it may take some time. We hope it will be about 1 month. Therefore, by the end of January we should have accurate manufacturing quote and actually start making the units.

Please check out our website for the updated photos and videos of the new design. Our offer of refund (see previous update bellow) still stands.

Thank you

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
Update - Nov 13th 2015:

Dear Contributors,
I'm sorry for the delay in development of SBB. We have ran into few issues with electronics and design of the straps. But I'm happy to report that all those issues are now resolved! Right now, we are waiting for the last set of straps to be made by our sewer (that would take approximately 2 weeks). After that we will send our prototype and those new straps to our manufacturer in China. Then it would take another month to get a quote from them and start making the SBB. After some time for packaging, shipping and customs we will have the units at our warehouse in California. At this time (approximately in Feb 2016) we will fulfill the orders at the maximum speed.

Please check out the new SBB website for pictures of the new unit:
New Smart Back Brace Website

We understand that we have failed to fulfill by the promised deadline. That is why we are offering no-questions-asked refund to anybody who wishes. If you wish to receive a full refund, please send your details and Paypal email address to cs@smartbackbrace.com. Thank you!

What happened in the last few months:
1. We've designed and redesign the SBB body few times (please see the website for pictures) - it now looks way awesome!
2. We've ran into the issue with strain gauges being too expensive (the part that measures the tension on the straps), but were able to find a reasonably alternative.
3. We've went through a dozen of designs for the straps. Seriously, my house looks like a fabrics store now. Many designs were created and all, but one, failed to live up to our expectations.
4. The IDP team wrote several different version of iPhone and Android apps. We've found and fix many different bugs and made interface much simpler. The apps are ready for prime-time now.

In terms of money, we are about the projected budget. Initially estimated at $100k of the development budget - we are now only about $7k over that. The additional expenses will include the purchase of the first 1000 units (estimated at $50k). But, as I said before - I've got this covered! Even though, this campaign brought only about $30k, I have promised to cover the rest - so I am. I shall see this project through, no matter what it takes. Besides, it is almost done!

Thank you
Andy



>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
The Smart Back Brace (SBB) is the posture-correcting device. In physical usage it is similar to many other clavicle braces available on the market. However, what sets it apart is the “smart” part that actually trains your upper body muscles while you are wearing it. At the heart of SBB is the tiny electronic unit that continuously monitors the tension on the straps. Using patented technology, it is able to accurately determine when the wearer is hunching. When this happens it notifies him or her by vibrating. The goal of using the SBB is to train the wearer to keep his or her shoulders back without any assistance.


From the inventor:
Hello, I am Andy and I have been struggling with my posture for years. I have tried many different devices but none of them did what I wanted. I found clavicle straps, the ones that pull your shoulders back, work the best. But the problem is they only work for the first 3-5 minutes and after that your body gets used to the device and becomes depended on  it. I thought that’s not right! There must be a better way to train your muscles to stay back by themselves. If only I could somehow detect the wearer is slacking off, and remind him or her to pull shoulders back. While wearing one of those clavicle braces, I have noticed as I relax my shoulders, the tension on the straps increases. In fact, it increases so much that it hurts my underarms! Bingo! It hit me. Why not put a small tension sensor on the strap? When it detects that the average tension has increased, it will know that the user has relaxed and will notify him or her to straighten up. This is how the original idea of SBB was born.

Development Update (December 23rd 2014):
We have contracted the Innovative Design Products (IDP) company in Irvine, CA. The IDP is the prototyping company with over 20 years’ experience developing consumer electronics products for various industries. With hundreds of successful products designed and delivered, there is no doubt that IDP has what it takes to make SBB the reality in a shortest possible time. The IDP has already completed the detailed Development Plan for SBB. This plan consists of 4 stages, starting with Stage 1: “Technical Feasibility, Design and Engineering” (estimated at $29,000, 8 weeks); Stage 2: “Alpha Prototyping” (estimated as $26,000, 8 weeks); Stage 3: “Refinement & Beta Prototyping” (estimated at $26,000, 8 weeks); Stage 4: “Comprehensive Manufacturing Package” (Estimated at $5,000, 3 weeks) - for the total of $86,000, not including additional expenses of acquiring various government compliance licenses, shipping and possible customs tariffs. The IDP has several professionals who will be working on SBB project: John Gibson (Electronics Engineer, 25 years of experience), Rob Gorman (App Developer, 20 years of experience, plus master’s degree in computer science), Bob Gibb (Mechanical Engineer, 25 years of experience, specializing in consumer products), Joseph Emerson (Industrial Design, product research and conceptualization), Hamid Ali (Custom Prototype Fabrication, 20 years of experience), Alex Chen (Manufacturing, 15 years of experience) and, most importantly, Mitch Kobara (Project Manager and IDP boss, with 25 years of experience of prototyping and manufacturing consumer products). Additionally, we expect to cut down some of the development time for Stage 1 and State 2, since we have already done some of the design and testing.


Give me simple explanation of what is SBB:
Basically, SBB is this product: Amazon.com - Deluxe Clavicle Support (please check out many positive reviews). Except, on the back, where straps join, the SBB will have a small electronic unit which is about the same size as the ring on the product above. The SBB will have durable adjustable straps that pull your shoulders back. The idea is to keep something that works as is, but add an extra "smart" part.

How exactly is it going to work?
Step 1: You put on the SBB
Step 2: You adjust the straps for correct tension. This is a little tricky because you need to select tension that is comfortable for you. In general, you would want to select tension that will keep your shoulders back but would not be tight enough to trigger warnings all the time. Think about it like this: when you are wearing SBB and you have your shoulders back - the tension should be barely noticeable. Therefore, as you start to forget about keeping your shoulders back, they will sag; consequently the tension on the straps will increase. At that time, SBB will detect this and will issue warning, either by vibrating or by sending alert to your phone. By the end of your training you will subconsciously know at which position your shoulders should be NOT to trigger a warning; thereby, the SBB has effectively trained your muscles.

Of course, the settings on SBB are fully customizable (see app screenshots bellow). Your will be able to control at which level SBB will issue warnings. Additionally, you can specify how often SBB will measure the tension and what kind of average it will use to calculate if you exceed this average. The reason why we use the average is so that SBB will NOT issue a warning when there is a sharp spike in tension. This could happen if you reach for something, for example.

How does SBB stack up against competition?


How much do we need to get it off the ground?

We estimate $100,000. More than 90% of that that money will go directly to IDP as per our contact with them to develop and bring SBB to market. The remaining will be spent on shipping, acquisition of various government permits and advertising. But, in the great scheme of things, that is truly peanuts! Search "posturenow + sharktank" - they've raised $100k for 30% of the company with inferior product and, despite that, are still profitable! Let's show those "sharks" that crowd-funding is a better way to go! This is a short fundraising campaign (40 days). So, you better make up your mind fast!

I love SBB but I don’t need it. How can I help?
The best thing you can do is to let your friends and family members know about it. The SBB will make a world of difference for somebody with posture problem. If you have connections with bloggers, tech reviewers or news agencies please urge them to take a look at our project and write something. Contact: cs @ SmartBackBrace.com


Risks and challenges

Design & Manufacturing:

Even though there are many parts to the electronic hub of SBB, there is nothing special that doesn't already exist. All those parts are available from multiple manufacturers - no special parts need to be "invented" for this device to be produced. Therefore, the real challenge is not to "invent something new" but rather use existing parts and put them together in high-quality reliable package.

Manufacturing of a product such as Smart Back Brace is a daunting task. That is why we let professionals do it. While our team has extensive knowledge of electronics engineering, manufacturing electronics is a different ball game. We are currently contacting several manufacturers to review our designs and fabricate SBB on a large scale – 10,000+ units. Additionally, we are contacting a third party engineering firm to help us with design of Bluetooth, as well as procedures to pass FCC regulations which are required for all electronics sold in the U.S.A.

Once the design is approved, prototypes are fully tested and manufacturing agreement signed, we do not expect any delays or problems. However, production will require a 60 days lead time to create molds and lining up all of electronic components.

Fulfillment:
Depending on which manufacturer we use, the shipment of orders will vary. But we will make sure that we have good suppliers with robust shipping facilities. Again, delays are always possible, but we will do our best to ensure we don’t have them.


FAQ’s

Why you are not on Kickstarter?
Because they refused to list my campaign on the grounds that they do not accept any devices that claim to “cure any disease or illness”. Though, bad posture is hardly an illness, I decided NOT to deal with those dicks. Let’s show them that IndieGoGo is better!

How the development is going?
Despite it being a holiday season (BTW, Happy Holidays, Everybody!), we have been continuously working on SBB. In the video you can see version number 4. But as of right now, we already are on version number 6. With input of mechanical engineer from IDP, we have designed 2 more bodies. The objective was to make it more ergonomic – easier to wear. As the result, they look radically different from version #4. Specifically, they are rounder and without any corners or sharp edges. Here are a couple of AutoCAD screenshots:

Apart from case design, how the development of other parts is progressing?
Together with IDP electronics engineers, we are working on finding the right strain gauges to measure the tension. There are thousands of those gauges on the market! We are trying to identify the one that would work for SBB. After we identify some, we will test them in the setting similar to SBB. Additionally, the IDP engineers are trying to identify all other components that would go inside. For example, just today we’ve had a big discussion on whether or not to include auto-shut off mechanism that would detect movement or lack thereof and automatically turn SBB on or off to preserve battery.

Does it really work? Does it correct posture? Any proof?
Yes, it does. Not only that - it does it better than anything on the market today. How can I be so sure? Consider this: the SBB is the clavicle support system (the type of posture-correcting device that pulls your shoulders back) – there are thousands of those on the market. Search of Amazon and you will see great number of them. Some are not so good, some are alright (checkout real-world reviews). Without even talking about the SBB’s “smart” part – it will already do the function of being a clavicle support – which has proven to be effective. Now, if we add a “smart” part to already effective device, it becomes ultra-effective! Not only it will physically help you correct posture, but also will teach your how to stay proper. Granted, that it may annoy you with warnings about your bad posture. But it will only do that when you are, indeed, slouching. Of course, all of the above will only work IF you are actually wearing it! The SBB will come with usage tracking to help you motivate yourself and show others that you are trying. Perhaps, you can think of some kind of reward for yourself when you don’t trigger warnings while wearing it. Motivation is HUGE factor when it comes to posture correcting.

Is shipping included?
Yes.
