Through the Lumin8 Healing Oracle, my goal is to bring a heightened level of awareness and personal power through the book, live event, group program. The Lumin8 Healing Oracle Deck is my largest project to date.
“Knowledge is something learned from a book, or gained from a teacher. True wisdom comes from experience. The Healing Oracle Deck, The Healing Oracle Book and The Healing Oracle Program are tools that support a personal transformation for each user….unlocking and activating the wisdom within us all…” ~ Gina Spriggs
Please continue to stay up to date at: GinaSpriggs.Guru

What You Get/How You Can Help

The Deck
With your intuition is your primary guide, I invite and assist you to explore the many ways you can use it. The Lumin8  Healing Oracle can be used as a healing, divination and self-exploration tool. It can be used by anyone, whether they are professional alternative practitioners themselves or desire a deeper level of self-awareness.
The deck is a full 55 card set. The cards will be high quality 3.5″ x 5” cards with rounded corners. The 55 images will be borderless.
The deck is available to those who donate $55 or more.
The Book
The full sized 5.5” x 8.5” book is an abbreviated version of the actual program. It comes complete with exercises. There are fourteen chapters that simple yet powerful, “how to’s”, insights, and resources.
The book and deck will be available to those who donate $75 or more. Chapter topics include:

Intro to Alternative Healing
4 Levels of Awareness
Energy Mapping: An Intuitive Technique
Advanced Work with Chakras & Energy Bodies
Energy Laws & How to Break Them (Cords, Contracts, Curses and Bindings)
Intuitive use of Shape & Color
Intuitive use of Elements
Plant Spirit Energy *This chapter was not in the original program.

The Program
The 7 week on-line program Lumin8 Healing Oracle Program will initially be taught live. (The sessions will be recorded so they can be accessed for future donation, purchases and reference.) The live webinar sessions are exciting because you can ask questions, which will be addressed on the call. Each session is between 60 – 75 minutes, and ALWAYS includes an intuitive process.
"My "Aha Moment " was recognizing that each Chakra carries energy from the one "below" and "above": that Space in between needs attention." ~ Desiree S. Teacher & Participant New Jersey
The class is currently scheduled for January 2017, and will be available to those who donate $150 or more. *Book and deck delivered separately.
Life is magical when you understand what Gina is teaching. Everything is energy and can be manipulated by our intention. This means that truly life is only limited by what we can imagine and we have all kinds of energetic tools at our disposal. Recently, a client didn't like her "attitude toward money" program. But she did like a coworker's. And so I uninstalled her program, made a copy of his program and installed it in her field. That was a couple of week's ago. Today she told me she is shocked at how she has the same kind of confidence this guy has! ~ Sundi B., Participant, & Practicing Healer North Carolina
The Live Event
The Live Event will be nothing short of AMAZING! Here, you’ll get a chance to experience your Lumin8 Healing Oracle with yourself and others, reviewing and applying what you learned in the book and on-line. This event will be held in Charlotte, North Carolina in October 2017, and will be open to 70 backers who donate $.150
"My biggest "aha" moment came during the energy laws section. Bindings, even those created by loved ones, can be very powerful. Clearing your energy field often is very important. A great teacher inspires... Job well done!​" ~ Gina G. Participant, North Carolina
"I absolutely am loving this course and  so excited to be a part of it!  I really enjoy the way that you deliver your information and the class was so filled with lots and lots of great "stuff"...Carolyn T. Donor, Participant & Healer Hawaii
Reward Summary

Donations of $10 or more are awarded a signed thank you postcard featuring The Star Element, known for accomplishing purification of physical matter through spiritual truth and spiritual truth to form physical matter.

The Lumin8Healing Oracle deck & signed postcard are awarded to those who donate $55 or more.
The full sized 5.5” x 8.5” Lumin8 Healing Oracle book, deck and signed star postcard, will be awarded to those who donate $75 or more.
The 7 Week on-line Lumin8 Healing Oracle Program, Healing Oracle Book, and Healing Oracle Deck will be awarded to those who donate $150 or more.
BONUS:  LIVE Lumin8 Healing Oracle Event (Yup! Hands on support with me as your Guide) AND all the other goodies (postcard, deck, book and Lumin8 Healing Oracle 7-week on-line Program) are awarded to those who donate $150 or more (*Space is limited to 70)


Risks & Challenges
The majority of the costs are in the printing, shipping, and image acquisition. A substantial amount goes towards fees and taxes. The scanning/editing adds additional costs because I process that ensure the integrity of the images. 
The program is 100% complete, the book is 70% complete and the deck is in progress. All work will be completed by the time funds are released.
Delays are sometimes unavoidable, so I’ve done my research on proper budgeting of the entire project.The main unpredictable obstacle is possible delays in proofing and printing. I’ve given myself a very generous window and shipment date of October 2017.
I will continue to update this project page as well as the Lumin8 tab on GinaSpriggs.Guru with my progress and any potential setbacks that may occur.
You will always be in the loop right along with me. We're in this together and I am so excited about this amazing journey we’re sharing.
Another Way You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, (I get it..) but that doesn't mean you can't help.
Can you Spread The Word?  Make some noise about my campaign! (*Use the Indiegogo and any social media share tools.)
Thank you SO MUCH. I will keep you posted (I am SO excited!)
You Are Loved ~

story:
Your Virtual Coach. A Really Smart Virtual Coach.


Meet Stridalyzer

Are you a "5-Star Runner"?

Defining a good running form is not Rocket Science, but it's still extremely subjective. However, most experts agree that good running form is key to better performance and an injury-free running experience. And they also agree that the five fundamental vectors - Cadence, Ground Contact Time, Foot Strike, Body Balance and Impact Stress - form the key to good running form.

Stridalyzer Smart Insoles, coupled with Stridalyzer Analytics and guidance solutions, is the ONLY solution that measures, analyzes and provides you an insight into all these vectors, and provides a proprietary rating system, that we call the "5-Star System".

And best of all - it's available NOW - we have already been supported by funders like you to bring this product to market, so when you pledge your support now, you get the product right away!


Leo Manzano: 2012 Olympic Silver Medalist (Men’s 1500m Event) – London Games, USA, National Champion – Track and Field 1500m.

Nicolas: Runner
This #Stridalyzer thing from @ReTiSenseInc is pretty awesome. It makes #running better than the Nike app. #BigData #Marathon https://twitter.com/MrBasabose/status/660809545267208195

Nate: Reviewer for magazine, Amateur Runner
I had a blast run testing a pair of RetiSense.com Stridalyzer insoles last week for my upcoming Austin Fit magazine gear review. If you’re a runner or triathlete, you’d be wise to check them out.

Stridalyzer on the news


                                                      




The Sensor-Packed Insoles

                      

Stridalyzer uses a pair of insoles with a novel, patent-pending technology with multiple sensors integrated in them, to detect how your foot lands, rolls and pushes off the ground. All you need to do is put these insoles in your shoes, turn the app on, and start running; Stridalyzer automatically understands that you are moving, and will start collecting data about your run.

                    

Stridalyzer App

Stridalyzer App has in its core, a patent-pending, real-time biomechanics engine, that uses sensor data from the insoles and your biometric information, to model your lower limb and exactly how it is moving over the ground or in the air, what forces are acting on various parts of the leg, as well as determining whether that is appropriate or inappropriate kind of motion or stress. Through this analysis, Stridalyzer App can provide an extremely powerful mechanism to understand how your body is performing in real-time! Some of the salient features of the app are described below.

  • Real-Time Impact Stress distribution display for feet and knees!
  • Real-Time Alerts for inappropriate stances and movement, excessive stress, etc.
  • Real-Time visibility into various parameters like Stride Length, Stride Rate (Cadence), Ground Contact Time.
  • Visibility into your foot-strike pattern.
  • And finally, our proprietary 5-star rating system for your running form, at the end of your run!


                                         

                          


Foot and Knee stress monitoring with Real-Time review

About 60% of runners will have some kind of running injury in any given year. Of all running injuries, about 42% are knee injuries. So we made it our top priority. Stridalyzer can estimate the various stresses acting on your feet and knee and provide you with alerts, guidance and detailed data for your review, that can help you understand when and how you are overstressing your knees, and help prevent the all-too-common “runner’s knee”.

   

Of course, Stridalyzer provides the real-time foot stress map as well.



Real-Time Audio and Visual alert and advice - when you need them
We have designed our solution to continue to monitor your run, and interrupt you only when it needs to “alert” you with some important information or quick guidance. For example, if you start persistently overstriding or overpronating, or if your footstrike pattern changes, you will get a visual as well as an audio alert - this way you can keep your eyes on the trail and still get the information or advice that's relevant for you - WHEN it becomes relevant!

                                       


The 5-Star Rating System!
To help you understand and track your running form, we have worked with coaches, doctors, experienced runners and sports physiotherapists to develop the simple yet powerful, 5-Star rating system, that takes into account the 5 most important aspects of running form. At the end of your run, Stridalyzer App displays how you are doing on that assessment, and also helps you understand your risk of injury - so that you can take steps to correct those issues and stay away from those injuries!


Performance-Train like a Pro!

If you are trying to buildup your pace or find the optimal rhythm for your next marathon, Stridalyzer helps you monitor and track the three fundamental performance parameters: Stride Rate, Stride Length and the most elusive – Ground Contact Time. Using our patent-pending technology, we can measure ground contact time extremely accurately!

Marathon Simulator

You know how you're dreaming and planning to participate in the next "Big One"? You spend months planning, preparing, you discuss your hill strategies, your crowd strategies, etc, obsess over which shoes you'll carry, etc?

How about how you'd actually perform? What kind of pacing will get you the optimal rank? How are others running the race?

Well, now you can simulate your performance using our Real-Time Marathon Simulator! Simply set the race and year that you want to simulate, and do your long run. We have meticulously collected and analyzed race data from several top races in the world to provide you with real-time ranking of how you'd do in that race. So test out all your strategies, and get a fair idea of how you would perform on the race day!

In-Device Storage

So you're one of those purists who don't want to be weighed down by your phone when you run, but still want to get all the data captured? Great - got you covered! Our insoles store upto 10 hours of run data within the devices, so that you can go run freely - and come back and get all the details - what happened during your runs, what went well, and how to improve.

And, if you would like, you can replay your entire run from our web-based visual replay tool!


Stridalyzer Web Reports

You've done your run, seen the summary on the app, shared your awesome Running Form details on Facebook. Now you want to get serious and really analyze why you're getting that ache on your right leg. 
Log on to our web portal, and you get a world of analysis and guidance! You can review your loading and impact stress over time. Or compare your current run with a previous one. Or even "Action Replay" your entire run if you want. Our Guidance section provides you with information on what to work on next - be it strengthening exercises or adjusting your body stance. Check it out at www.stridalyzer.retisense.com


Stress Map-Action Replay
Replay stress maps for your previous runs and compare your foot and knee stress over run time - An awesome tool to help you find your next pair of shoes, or to take to your running coach!



Intuitive reports and guidance

"So far most footwear wearables have focussed on mapping the runner’s route, distance, pace and time, and gamified with social shares and audio cues; few have tried to explore the runner’s technique and use data to help improve their run." -Vinay Dora, e27.co


In addition, you can get an idea of how you foot-strike and foot-roll - as an overall run-summary distribution, or as your strike type over your run duration. This can help you understand what kind of strike pattern and roll pattern you have when you hit the "fatigue wall", and can help you create the right strategy for your next 10K or the next Ultramarathon!

We started working on this product in mid-2014, and took it to Kickstarter when we had a prototype ready. After our Kickstarter success (propelled by supporters like you), we were able to get our product manufactured, and launched by October 2015. Since then, we have had numerous milestones:
  • Several features in high-profile sports gadget coverage - like Fox News, Digit.in, Austin Fit Magazine and "Best Inventions for 2015" by MSN.com.
  • Leo Manzano, an Olympics silver medal winner endorsed our product, and used them for his Rio training.
  • We partnered with various running coaching centers.
In all this effort, our team has depended heavily on the support, guidance and encouragement from our early supporters and customers like you. Now, as we bring the product to Indiegogo's InDemand program, we hope we will receive the same support, guidance and encouragement from you, as we have received so far!

story:
Short Summary

Rosco Asana’s students are fully comfortable to be themselves as they strive to create healthy habits in their lives. Rosco is gifted in spreading joy and laughter, allowing play to be more productive and work to lose its edge. He creates a space of empowerment and creativity where individuals can enjoy growing and learning about their health and their place in the world. Rosco humbly seeks to lead a colorful, vibrant life, and enables others to do the same at any age. He believes that one of the first steps toward such a life is an open mind and strong body that is capable of much activity.

“Each day I pray for supernatural levels of energy that I can share with the people around me to accomplish great things.”

Rosco has a professional background in personal training from Auburn University where he worked for four years at the Student Activities Center (2009-2013). He is certified through the American Council on Exercise. His yoga path began in 2010 when he was seeking to bring balance into his life after a period of disordered eating and exercise. After practicing for two years, he saw and felt changes in his life that he wanted to perpetuate and share with others. He became a certified teacher in 2012 through YogaFit. Since that time he has taught at the Auburn University Student Activities Center as well as exotic destinations in Costa Rica and Panama. His practice of yoga affects the way he sees health and fitness overall; this is reflected in his unique style of personal training. Rosco puts much emphasis on physical fitness, but does neglect the mind and spirit.

Rosco graduated from Auburn University in August 2013 with a degree in Interdisciplinary Studies. He currently serves as an apprentice under Kimberly Sotelo at Inner Sunshine Yoga and Wellness in Opelika, Alabama. Over the course of three years, he will study to become a better instructor, teach classes, and develop holistic personal training as a business. 

http://innersunshineyoga.com/

"Helping people to feel better and discover their full potential is my passion and purpose in this life, so I want to put more time and energy into that mission.  I want  to offer more to my clients and secure a steady income for myself and the wellness center through Holistic Personal Training. Your contributions will help me to jump-start my business by transforming my training space to accommodate more forms of exercise and a broader range of fitness goals."

What We Need & What You Get

I have experience, confidence, a vision, and a space. All I need is a few pieces of quality equipment to take Holistic Personal Training to the next level of effectiveness, but as a recent college graduate, my funds are limited. Your investment will help me to buy:

1. rubber flooring to protect Inner Sunshine's historic hardwood floors
2. a set of Bowflex adjustable dumbbells
3. a dumbbell rack
4. a weight bench.

Even if I do not reach my fundraising goal, I will put the money I raise toward purchasing these items. If by chance I raise funds above my goal, the money will go into savings for future expansion of the business.

In return, I am offering prizes that inspire. For $300, you can get your consultation and try ten sessions of Holistic Personal Training (normally $185), or for $150 you can try six sessions (normally $255)! For smaller donations I am offering yoga classes, home-cooked meals, bearded lady grams, and mixes of my favorite music to energize your life.

check out the bearded lady on Facebook here...

Please be patient as some of these prizes may take a little time to schedule. "Roscafarian" refers to my unique taste (my culture, if you will).

The Impact

Opelika, AL is growing and changing rapidly. As a radical force of positive energy, Inner Sunshine Yoga and Wellness could be a huge part of that process. It is no secret that the Southeastern United States is behind in matters of health, but each life we are able to change creates a ripple effect to which there is no limit. The time and energy we put into our clients multiplies when they go out and share their new found joy and health with others. The more lives we are able to touch in this way, the more productive and vibrant Opelika can become. With adequate facilities and equipment, I can take more clients and train each of  them better. With more stable income, I will even be able to offer more free yoga classes to the community. The more vibrantly healthy people we have in Opelika, the more contagiously radiant our town will become, inspiring wellness and mindfulness throughout the entire region.

Even if you cannot contribute to this project financially, please share this campaign with people you know who care about health or may be interested in personal training!

story:
To stay connected with TeVido BioDevices and learn about progress with the technology visit www.tevidobiodevices.com and sign up for our mailing list.
Once again, thank you for making a statement of your solidarity with breast cancer survivors that the long term, quality of life is imperative. 


This is why we fight to move forward.

Your contributions go to help people like the mother and daughter duo in the video above. Annie's mother has fought cancer 3 different times and has not only survived, but has been able to be there for her daughter through her own struggle with cancer. Annie was a fit, healthy 40 year old that found a lump and was diagnosed with breast cancer.  Annie elected to have breast reconstruction. The results, while certainly positive compared to the alternative, are not nearly as satisfying as they could be.

Building a Better Nipple for Survivors

Those who are survivors of breast cancer and have had breast reconstruction already know why this is so important.

These days, the choices for recreating anything close to a nipple include manipulation of skin through surgery or tattooing. None of which have guaranteed lasting results, and all of which are less than aesthetically satisfactory.

Cancer hits all of us. 

           ~Or will at some point. 

The good news is that the odds of breast cancer survival are increasing.  Women are finding breast cancer earlier than ever and beating it.  This means that “quality of life” issues after a mastectomy are becoming more and more important.

Whether we want to admit it or not, the way we look or are perceived by others affects each of us.  The psychological impact of going through cancer, surviving, and then being left with breasts that feel incomplete can be crushing. 


There is power in feeling “whole”.  Having nipples creates a connection to that part of us that needs to feel “normal” again.  This creates ripples and waves that influence every relationship we have, including most importantly, our relationship with ourselves.

Creating “wholeness” where there are holes.


Enter TeVido BioDevices.   

TeVido BioDevices is developing cutting-edge 3D bio-printing techniques and combining that with advances in cellular technology to create custom nipple grafts that would match the size and shape of a woman's original nipple.

Watch this  Cover Story for more insight:

The concept is to take a woman’s cells and place them into a 3D bio-printer, reinventing a woman’s own nipple with the desired shape and color.  The intended result of our research is a nipple that can be placed onto her reconstructed breasts, creating the look of the real thing. Using a woman’s own cells also reduces the risk of rejection, creating less trauma and pain for her.

Hope is here.

You can help us to bring awareness and much needed funding for this revolutionary new technology and research.

 

Taking hope in a new direction.

~The convergence of 3D bio-printing with cellular technology.

Here's how it will work:

Are you asking yourself, "how the heck did this get started?"  

Here's a Peek at the Science Behind Bio-Printing.


Help us to help your mothers, wives, daughters, girlfriends, sisters, friends… YOU.

           ~Spread the word and the wealth for a worthy cause.

 

You can make this happen.  Right now it’s still just a dream, but you can make it a reality. 

What do we need?

The great news is that right now a portion of our research and development (R&D) is funded by the National Science Foundation (NSF) and the National Cancer Institute (NCI).  We have been awarded over $900,000  in grant funding. This makes a huge difference for us.  

But this doesn't cover certain critical costs that we face in the next few months.

We need your help.

Goal - $35,000

Our goal is to raise $35,000 with this campaign to cover costs associated with patents.  I know it doesn't seem exciting... but without it... we won't be able to help the women who have survived breast cancer.   Patents are about protecting  ideas.  And we need them to be viable.

Through your funding, you can water this seed and help us grow.  In doing so, you will be helping us to develop strong roots and impact the way and direction this technology grows. 

TeVido BioDevices knows that there are so many causes out there pleading for your time, attention, and money.  We are so grateful that you would consider donating to our hopeful cause, whether it’s with your money or time.  Donating your time to help us get the word out is a big deal and a big help so be sure to pass on our story to your friends and family.

Be a part of Hope’s future. 

Reconstruct Hope… one nipple at a time.

We have had extensive press coverage.

The road to innovative discovery is endless…and TeVido is paving the way. Come join us on a journey that has limitless potential, and unlimited applications.

Looking ahead.

Can you imagine where this will lead? What we can accomplish together? The ways this will improve lives?



Come help us #ReconstructHope…



Find This Campaign On

Facebook

OnTwitter

  • @TeVidoBioDevice or
  • @ReconstructHope


Perks:

We invite everyone to tell us who they are honoring or why they are giving by submitting a comment on our Indiegogo page.
To thank you for helping make this dream a reality, we're offering some perks we hope you will enjoy.


Frequently Asked Questions

I am a survivor!  I am ready for nipple reconstruction, who do I contact to get this technology?

Unfortunately, we are still in research and development for our products.  After we complete that phase we will need to perform clinical trials.  Clinical trials are critical to ensure patients receive high quality and safe results.  We are estimating 5-6 years before the product is broadly available.  But we are working as fast as we can! 


What have you been doing since getting the two grants?

We received the grants in the Fall of 2014.  Since then we have been setting up our own lab facilities outside of the university, where we initially worked. This means finding space, buying and then setting up equipment.  We have done some hiring and will do more.  We are now starting on our next round of experiments.  

What is the status of your product development?

We are in early prototype stage. We have been able to build nipple shapes from living cells.  We have done initial testing in animals that looks promising.  We will have many iterations on the prototypes before we have a final product that has all the pre-clinical work completed that will allow us to move to clinical trials.

Is $35,000 all you need?

No.  We will need more money.  By the time it is said and done, $40-45 Million.  But receiving the grants is fantastic validation of our work.  Here is a great article that tells you a lot more about our current status, the market and our fund raising plans:

 Austin Entrepreneurs Modernize Breast Reconstruction Surgery - (by the Austin Phoenix)

I saw something about TeVido and the LIVESTRONG Foundation, what is that about?

TeVido BioDevices took 2nd place out of 752 applicants in the LIVESTRONG Foundation’s inaugural Big C competition.  LIVESTRONG has also provided wristbands as perks for our campaign.  Watch the video below to learn more about the competition:

story:
NursePro

NursePro is the result of many requests received by us from our website from which we sell specialized calculators that perform specific medical calculations.  My name is Darryl Chemel, I am an inventor and pharmacist.  I have been in the pharmaceutical industry for 28 years and in my own business Pharma-Insight Inc. for over 20 years.  One of our specialties is the design and manufacture of specialized medical calculators.  We retail them through our website medical-calculators.com.  Many of the nurses who contacted us were looking for a calculator that could calculate:

  •  drip rates (various calculations)
  •  common conversions
  • dosage calculations 
  • Body Mass Index
  • Body Surface Area

The NursePro does all this and more.  The NursePro is a great help for the student attempting nursing exams and a great assistant for the seasoned professional.   

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

Where we are with the NursePro:

  • We have already developed the programming and the molds for the NursePro including the key pad mold
  • We are working on our second prototype which is just a refinement of the first and all the calculations and functions have been validated
  • Our factory and business partner in China are ready to start production 

Where we need:

  • We need to order the ICs or Integrated circuits for the NursePro which requires us to order a significant amount of ICs or "chips"as we refer to them in the industry
  • A nice amount of orders in hand will allow us to order the critical mass of "chips" so we can make the NursePro calculator

What you will get:

  • For every  US $35.00 contribution (earlybirds a bit cheaper)  we will send a finished NursePro unit including shipping to any address in the contiguous US and Canada
  • For overseas addresses add $15.00 for shipping via surface mail

story:
UPDATE!

We are answering all questions that we receive on our blog. This includes:

  • a description of the QuASP™ application
  • technical Q&A session video 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

After launching the QuASP™ at TechCrunch Disrupt SF 2013, we are now introducing it to the rest of the world. 

Get to know the most precise wearable motion- and position tracker for teams and individuals. See how the collected is visualized through the accompanying application for iOS and Android. 

We've developed both the hardware and software together with sports scientists and physiotherapists at Sensorize who work with pro and elite sporters like Christiano Ronaldo and olympic athletes on a daily basis, so you are assured to get the absolute best.

QuASP™ Light

The QuASP™ light is the precise entry level motion and outdoor position tracker. Working together with the QuASP™ light iPhone and Android app it provides:

  • Energetic cost of training
  • 3D Acceleration/Deceleration patterns (very important in racing)
  • Quantification of reactivity in the change of direction (describing "dodging" skills)
  • Sport team tactic analysis
  • Athletic resume service (the player's profile will show the progress made over time)

QuASP™ light is ideal for: Keen sportsmen at any level for any outdoor precision sport (like golf), ball game (for example tennis, soccer, football, cricket), urban sports (outdoor basketball), etc. 

Simply place the device in one of the specially made QuASP™ vests or put it in your pocket.


QuASP™ Pro

The QuASP™ Pro provides all the services offered by the QuASP™ Light in real-time, thanks to an additional hardware component, the QuASP™ access point. Apart from the aforementioned services, the QuASP™ Pro offers:

  • real-time quantification of shocks during tackles or impacts
  • real-time tracking of the whole team
  • simultaneous access from multiple client applications running on tablets, smartphones and PCs
  • synchronization with video streaming for video analysis (camera not included)

In addition to that, the QuASP™ Pro exposes APIs for just any kind of position and motion tracking applications such as interactive scoreboard augmentation of spectators' experience with real-time predictions of plays' success. For instance, if you know the trajectory and speed of a runner and the defenders, you can easily anticipate the chance of a touchdown. 

QuASP™ Pro is ideal for: Sportsclubs and health centers to offer quantification services to their members; for college teams; schools; and all pro and semi-pro teams. 

QuASP™ Premium

  • An optional additional service for remote data storage and historical data access and analysis

QuASP™ Premium is ideal for: Semi-pro and professional teams, sport scouts, sport institutions, research centers, physiotherapists

_________________________________

Free Stuff!

We're reimbursing a number of eligible people with the full amount of a QuASP™ device if they are selected to place a small precision device on their property to provide even more accuracy for devices their radius. 

If you are interested in this special promotion you can sign up after you've pledged for at least 1 QuASP™ device. 

_________________________________

Individuals & Teams

We are all familiar with the runners watches and the motivational calorie trackers, but the QuASP™ goes further. Not only does it provide sophisticated inch-accurate positioning technology but also the possibility to track whole teams at the same time through the accompanying application. You can even use the QuASP™ devices on multiple body parts to measure which leg is capable of scoring a more powerful goal. 



Individuals like golfers and skiers will benefit from the 200+ measurements taken per second and the fact that you can wear multiple QuASP™ on your body.

Training

Plan your training or workout session according to your latest achievements. Whether it's practising that back-hand, or doing endurance training focussed on your left arm. Examine exactly what it is that your body needs.

Matches & games

Each player's movements are shown on the team-page so that you can see whether tactics are implemented and who's stamina is decreasing and should be replaced.  You can even plug in a camera and see position, video and player data all at the same time.

Injury prevention & recovery

Measure exactly when you're at risk for injury by using the concussion alerts based on the impact measurements. Or compare how you have been performing after an injury vs before. This is also valuable information for treatment by your physiotherapist.

(Heart rate monitoring device not included)

_________________________________

Why QuASP™?

Powerful

The QuASP™ is the result of years of research in the fields of motion tracking, precise positioning and sensor networks. Thanks to Beestar's patent-pending technologies, the QuASP™ provides serious sports lovers with the tools they need.

Intuitive

We're using the latest standards and best practices in user experience design so whether you're an Android or iOS user, the application will be easy to use.

Pro-grade

Professional athletes have access to a team of trained physiotherapists to understand the risk of injury; trainers to pick up on any improvements that need to be made; and coaches to develop tactics based on the team's performance. QuASP™ includes all this information!


Key Features

QuASP™ is a different kind of sport sensor than what the market is offering. The sports devices like watches and apps out there focus mainly on runners, but those who practice any other sport like precision sports or ball games have substantially different requirements. This is why we've jam-packed the QuASP™ with features that will appeal to all sports. 

  • Team/group page. With each device comes a free, personalized page for your team (or just for you). 
  • Track multiple bodyparts. Each device gives access to measurements, so if you want to track multiple bodyparts all you need to do is wear them.
  • Easy upload. For QuASP™ light your data will be uploaded as soon as you are connected to wifi. Automatically. With Pro your data will be streamed live.
  • 200+ measurements per second. Did I mention we're pro-grade? One of the reasons we're so accurate is because of the high volume of data.
  • Multi-platform. Connect to your page using Android or iOS using tablets, laptops or phones.
  • Use for all types of sport. Measurements of speed, acceleration and position are applicable to different types of sports.
  • Video. Plug in a camera and view footage, tactics and player metrics all at the same time. You can even play, fast forward or rewind.
  • Real-time. View a training or match as it's happening through streaming the collected data live (this is a pro feature)

Sleek design. We've teamed up with physiotherapists and sports scientists as well as highly experienced Italian design firms to develop the beautiful casing. It's sturdy but because of its soft touch casing and flowing design it fits perfectly on any part of the body. We had comfort and safety in mind first and foremost. 

Specs

  • Size. The size of the device is approximately 6x4x1 cm.
  • Charging. Inductive (not included).
  • Upload. Wifi (wireless).
  • Operating Systems. iOS, Android 

_________________________________

Here's how it works...

  1. The wearable QuASP motion trackers are placed on the body-part(s) you want to measure. 
  2. The signal is picked up by the hub if you’re using the pro/premium edition or the QuASP™ application if you are using the light edition. 
  3. Your individual measurements as well as those of your team-mates are uploaded wirelessly so you can analyse all your collected data. 
  4. If you are using the hub then you can also have an unlimited amount of devices (ranging from supporters to parents to coaches) can view the team data in real-time

And by the way...

If you want to geek up and learn more about the science of movement  we recommend the following free resources: science of NFL (watch short videos to learn about how acceleration, velocity, etc. is calculated), science of golf (watch short videos to learn about kinematics and golf) and beginner kinematics.

_________________________________

The team behind QuASP™

QuASP™ is the brainchild of Emanuele, Sergey, Fulvio and Charlotte and the results of a lot of late nights developing and an overload of espressos. We're a real international team based in the heart of Amsterdam (the Netherlands that is, not New York). There's a wealth of experience and MSc's between us in the fields of Robotics, Engineering, Aeronautics and product design.  

We're a startup and are looking to Indiegogo to test the market and to get inspired for new, cool features for the QuASP™. 


What We Need & What You'll Get

So here we are, asking you to help us develop this game changing product based on our developed technology. Without your support on Indiegogo we won't be able to mass produce this product and offer it for a price that is affordable to all teams, coaches and/or athletes and not just rich pro sport teams. We've developed the inch-accurate technology prototype but in order to mass-produce it and to further develop the application we need your pledges. 

If we reach our goal we'll be able to ship toward the end of this year, in time for holiday gifts. Of course we'll make sure to keep you up to date on delivery dates.  

Help us spread the word!

If we reach our goal, we will give away a t-shirt every week to the person that helps promote our campaign. Just take the link that you can find just under the video and spread the word using one of the social icons.

This is why we've jam-packed the QuASP™ with features that will appeal to all sports. 






Team/group page. With each device comes a free, personalized page for your team (or just for you). 


Track multiple bodyparts. Each device gives access to measurements, so if you want to track multiple bodyparts all you need to do is wear them.


Easy upload. For QuASP™ light your data will be uploaded as soon as you are connected to wifi. Automatically. With Pro your data will be streamed live.

200+ measurements per second. Did I mention we're pro-grade? One of the reasons we're so accurate is because of the high volume of data.
Multi-platform. Connect to your page using Android or iOS using tablets, laptops or phones.

Use for all types of sport. Measurements of speed, acceleration and position are applicable to different types of sports.

Video. Plug in a camera and view footage, tactics and player metrics all at the same time. You can even play, fast forward or rewind.

Real-time. View a training or match as it's happening through streaming the collected data live (this is a pro feature)


Sleek design. We've teamed up with physiotherapists and sports scientists as well as highly experienced Italian design firms to develop the beautiful casing. It's sturdy but because of its soft touch casing and flowing design it fits perfectly on any part of the body. We had comfort and safety in mind first and foremost. 
Specs






Size. The size of the device is approximately 6x4x1 cm.

Charging. Inductive (not included).


Upload. Wifi (wireless).

Operating Systems. iOS, Android 





_________________________________

Here's how it works...




The wearable QuASP motion trackers are placed on the body-part(s) you want to measure. 
The signal is picked up by the hub if you’re using the pro/premium edition or the QuASP™ application if you are using the light edition. 
Your individual measurements as well as those of your team-mates are uploaded wirelessly so you can analyse all your collected data. 
If you are using the hub then you can also have an unlimited amount of devices (ranging from supporters to parents to coaches) can view the team data in real-time










And by the way...
If you want to geek up and learn more about the science of movement  we recommend the following free resources: science of NFL (watch short videos to learn about how acceleration, velocity, etc. is calculated), science of golf (watch short videos to learn about kinematics and golf) and beginner kinematics._________________________________

The team behind QuASP™
QuASP™ is the brainchild of Emanuele, Sergey, Fulvio and Charlotte and the results of a lot of late nights developing and an overload of espressos. We're a real international team based in the heart of Amsterdam (the Netherlands that is, not New York). There's a wealth of experience and MSc's between us in the fields of Robotics, Engineering, Aeronautics and product design.  



We're a startup and are looking to Indiegogo to test the market and to get inspired for new, cool features for the QuASP™. 

What We Need & What You'll Get
So here we are, asking you to help us develop this game changing product based on our developed technology. Without your support on Indiegogo we won't be able to mass produce this product and offer it for a price that is affordable to all teams, coaches and/or athletes and not just rich pro sport teams. We've developed the inch-accurate technology prototype but in order to mass-produce it and to further develop the application we need your pledges. 
If we reach our goal we'll be able to ship toward the end of this year, in time for holiday gifts. Of course we'll make sure to keep you up to date on delivery dates.  



Help us spread the word!



If we reach our goal, we will give away a t-shirt every week to the person that helps promote our campaign. Just take the link that you can find just under the video and spread the word using one of the social icons.

story:
Support Women's Health

The Health and Wellness Center provides crucial health services to the community at the Asian University for Women (AUW). AUW is a university in Chittagong, Bangladesh that is funded solely on donations and grants. Its mission is to provide higher education to women from disadvantaged and impoverished backgrounds. Currently there are students from 16 different Asian nations ranging from Syria to China. The Health and Wellness Center provides care that is needed for the health of individual students and the AUW Community. 

  • The Health and Wellness Center is run by a team of nurses and a part-time doctor, acting as the primary care for the student body
  • The HWC provides vaccines, physicals, and organizes more extensive tests and visits for students
  • You contribution will help administer over 3,000 primary consultations, 1,000 doctor consultations, 100 physical exams, and 270+ lab tests in one year
  • The support you provide will help the students at AUW receive care they may never have had the opportunity to receive before. The care they need.

What We Need

Here is the annual operational budget of the HWC:

  • Vaccinations: $4,000
  • Medicine: $8,000
  • Outside Specialists: $1,000
  • Lab Tests and Investigations: $3,000
  • Emergencies: $2,5000

This campaign will fund 27% of the operational costs for the HWC for one year! Every dollar raised will directly help in one of the areas above.

What You Get

By contributing you can receive:

  • A social media shout out
  • A postcard from Bangaldesh
  • A copy of the excellent AUW Cookbook filled with recipes spanning the nations represented in AUW's communty (while supplies last)
  • Your name on our website
  • The satisfaction of knowing that your money is going directly to helping female students' health as they become educated at AUW

Your Impact Knows No Bounds

Educating women is considered by many to be the silver bullet to help developing nations grow. Women invest more money back into their families and communities than similarly-educated men. AUW graduates are encouraged to return to their communities to help stimulate growth and empower more women. Women's empowerment and education reaches well beyond the women who are educated.

The Health and Wellness Center is not just providing care to AUW's students, but also helping these women understand health in more complete context. From rural villages to packed urban areas, AUW's students enter the university with many preconceived notions of what is healthy and what is not. The HWC helps to educate as well as treat AUW students.

Help a women, help the world!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! If you can't contribute, please help by spreading the word on Facebook and Twitter. Use Inidiegogo's share tools and take to the internet to spread the word that every dollar to this campaign will help many women lead healthier lives and help those around them lead healthy lives as well!

You can also:

  • Like AUW on Facebook!
  • Follow AUW on Twitter!
  • Sign up for our updates and newsletter!

We can't do it without your support. Please help us to help others!

story:
Slick Aguilar, lead guitarist for Jefferson Starship since ‘92 (before that, David Crosby Band and KC & The Sunshine Band!) needs a liver tranaplant. He has brought tremendous joy to the world through his music. He must go to a different state from where he currently lives for this operation. Living expenses will be large for the 6-8 months he will be there. There will be many out of pocket expenses that insurance will not cover. Please help if you can.  Thanks!

Slick has been the lead guitarist in Jefferson Starship  since 1992 and is only the 3rd person to hold that position in the 40 year history of both Jefferson Airplane and Jefferson Starship. This year marks 28 years Slick has played with Paul Kantner, Marty Balin, and Company since he started with The KBC band in 1984. Before that he was lead guitarist with DAVID CROSBY and before that, KC & THE SUNSHINE BAND. His lead guitar has soared the music of JEFFERSON AIRPLANE & JEFFERSON STARSHIP far longer than the AIRPLANE’s legendary JORMA KAUKONEN and STARSHIP’s CRAIG CHAQUICO combined.

 

http://www.classichitsandoldies.com/v2/2012/11/26/jefferson-starships-slick-aguilar-needs-a-liver-transplant-is-seeking-help-with-medical-expenses/

 

http://www.jambands.com/news/2012/11/07/jefferson-starship-s-mark-slick-aguilar-in-need-of-a-liver-transplant

 

http://www.facebook.com/MarkSlickAguilar

story:
The First Fully Integrated Platform for Mental and Physical Health

Despite the ready availability of health-tracking applications, few programs provide a fully integrated platform for monitoring both physical and emotional health. Our mission is to provide psychiatric patients with the safest and most comprehensive application for engaging with providers, family members, and ultimately, their own health.

Check out our website at https://mindmentor.squarespace.com/our-sponsors/

In the Press

Sept 29th, 2013:          Winner of 2013 Health 2.0 Code-a-Thon


Features

Here at Mind Mentor, we have built a platform that includes:

  • Intimate patient-physician interface for constant communication and support
  • Medication and psychiatryc symptom assessments (or mood tracking analytics) updating in real time
  • Natural language processing of daily journals and social media to find "themes" in patient moods
  • Psychotherapy appointment tracking
  • Validic integration tracks sleep, weight, and activity in real time to help both primary care physicians and psychiatric providers
  • Unique and customized patient and practitioner interface

For Patients

Leveraging the HIPAA-compliant Validic API and symptom assessment inspired by the latest DSM-5 assessment measures, Mind Mentor provides a safe, user-friendly environment for patient-centric health evaluation.

For Physicians and Psychiatric Providers

From the administrative suite, doctors can schedule psychiatric appointments, therapy activities, create medication reminders, and monitor their patients’ health.

Patients are empowered by continual reaffirmation, staying connected to their doctor, and by witnessing their own emotional growth.


About Us

We are a part of Edge Interns. A group of motivated, focused, and team-oriented professionals passionate about healthcare, business, and technology. We go out of our comfort zone to build and expand the world around us.

Use of Funds

Software

We will build the platform across IOS, Android, and the web to provide a complete, dependable, and mobile health application for practitioners and patients alike. 

Patients and Partnerships

Funds will also be used to get our application into the hands of patients as well as build our partnership base. Here at Mind Mentor, we plan to create the largest, yet most intimate online experience for our users. 

Become an integral part of this exciting journey into catalyzing both optimal physical and mental health!

story: IM A DISABLED VET , in need of help , my husband has terminal liver failure and due to lay offs at his company he has no insurance with out the funds for a liver transplant , the father of my children only has a yr at best to be with us , this man helped me to walk again and took care of me when i was broken and sick , its my job to do everything i can to save him , he's the love of my life and how can i face his children if i dont try everything humanly possible to save his life . i know the cost is astronomical but if i can get 200 ppl to rais 1000, or 200 ppl to raise 1000, or how ever we do the numbers the only way to reach our goal is by pennies nickles and dimes , wellsfargo has already set up an account in , david caples benifit fund any donations will be recied there , call your local american leagion , we are based with the nederland group but its too much for 1 person alone to do , please i beg , i love this man with all my heart he is the air that i breath , help me help him during these trying times

story:
Goal- 

To build a CPU/GPU folding computer for the sole purpose of donating its time (24/7/365) to cancer research.
 
 

Background-

The World Community Grid project (www.worldcommunitygrid.com) is an IBM-run project that allows home users to participate and donate their own computer's time towards medical and humanitarian research. Medical research projects are normally carried out through computer simulations, in which varying combinations of proteins and compounds are broken down, combined, tested and calculated. These computer simulations allow medical researchers to compute and profile vast amounts of possible chemical reactions, model proteins, etc. 

The ability to process and compute these simulations is a massive undertaking and requires a vast amount of computational power, far beyond what any one home computer could ever provide. These types of projects would typically be reserved for supercomputers in laboratories. The problem with supercomputers is that they cost a lot of money to run. It may only take a supercomputer a couple of weeks or a month to run a medical research project, but the cost to rent the time on a supercomputer could be millions of dollars. Unfortunately, for some of these medical projects, which often endeavor to find cures to some of today's most devistating ailments, it's not always possible to attain that kind of funding. 

This is where WCG (World Community Grid) comes into play. While a single home computer is nowhere near powerful enough to process a project like this on its own, when tied together to a grid of 1000's of other computers it's possible. WCG works by allowing the home user to download an application that runs on their personal computer. This application connects to the IBM client and downloads individual WU (workunits) to process. These workunits are individual tasks that your home computer will then run on the WCG program. Each task is one workunit. It might take anywhere from 1 minute (for GPU enabled tasks) to 6 hours to complete a workunit. Upon completing that workunit it will then be uploaded back to the WCG server where the research team on that project will have access to the results. In effect, the single task completed by your personal home computer will help researchers  work towards finding cures.

 

Help Conquer Cancer Project- 

Project Help Conquer Cancer (http://www.worldcommunitygrid.org/research/hcc1/overview.do) is focused solely on Cancer research. Its mission is to improve the results of protein X-ray crystallography, which helps researchers not only annotate unknown parts of the human proteome, but importantly improves their understanding of cancer initiation, progression and treatment.

HCC (Help Conquer Cancer) has been going on since 2007 (http://www.cs.toronto.edu/~juris/WCG/wcg-hcc.html), and since that time has used the work and research completed to assist in the publication of numerous papers in the field of cancer research. These publications and findings are one of the key elements in working towards finding a cure for cancer. 

 

Requirements-

While any computer can join the World Community Grid project to contribute, the faster your computer, the faster you complete workunits, and thusly the faster you can process and return results to research teams. That said, my goal is to build a relatively high-end computer with the latest hardware capable of processing workunits in the fastest possible time. 

To build this computer, I'll research the best components for this specific task and then order the parts needed online (newegg.com). Once the parts arrive, I'll build a computer, configure the software, overclock the hardware (to attain the fastest possible processing) and connect the computer to the World Community Grid project, where it will start processing for the Help Conquer Cancer project.

Here is my parts list for the proposed CPU/GPU folding computer- 

  • Processor-Ivy Bridge 3770k
  • Graphics Processor- HD7970
  • Power Supply- Platinum 650 Watt
  • Motherboard ASUS Z77
  • RAM- Kingston 8GB
  • SSD- 40GB
  • Processor Cooler- Corsair H100
  • Graphics Processor Cooler- Artic Cooling Accel X
 

Why am I asking for help-   

The cost to build this computer is about $1,350, but once running the ongoing cost for electricity will be a considerable amount. I currently already have a cluster computer/CPU folding farm which I built last year that's purpose is to compute 24/7/365. This cluster computer costs roughly $80 dollars per month in electricity on its own or about $1,000 for the year. This first computer was also built with the intention of donating its time. I have considered whatever costs associated in building and operating it an ongoing donation.

This new CPU/GPU folding farm would focus its efforts on strictly Cancer research. The estimated cost for electricity to run the computer is projected at around $60 monthly or around $720 yearly. Combined with the cost of the computer this makes the total cost of the project around $2,000 for the first year, and then $700-800 a year in electricity for each year thereafter.

I'm asking for your help in financing the project because I wanted to contribute more towards finding a cure for cancer, and I wanted to give others the opportunity also contribute towards a good cause. We've all been affected in one way or another by cancer at some point in our lives. There are not many options for us regular people to help with the medical research needed to find a cure. But this project offers just that, a way to help build a computer that will process medical research for cancer.  

 

My Computer Building Experience-  

I've been a proponent and advocate of World Community Grid for a while now, and as a result of this I built my own CPU folding farm last year to contribute it's time and processing power to the many humanitarian and medical research projects on World Community Grid. This computer is a cluster computer that combined 3 computers into one to produce a very powerful machine capable of processing a lot of data. Since last July this computer has already donated almost 30 years of processing time (this is possible in just a year's time because this computer can process 24 workunits at one time, so for every single day of processing it completes almost a month worth of processing for a regular computer) Details on this computer are available here on my website- http://www.totalgeekdom.com/?p=572

 

What your pledges will be used for-   

Your pledges of money will go towards the purchase of the components needed to build this computer and also towards the costs of electricity to run this computer. All money donated will go into an account just for this computer, and all money beyond the component costs will be used to fund the electricity costs to run the computer. 

 

My Contribution-

My contribution towards this project will be researching the computer components, buying the components, building the computer, setting up the computer to run World Community Grid and then maintaining the computer with necessary updates and maintenance. Furthermore, I will pay for the electricity costs to continue running it. I'll send out email updates and post information for everyone to see throughout the life of the computer, showing the results of everyone's contributions. 

 

How you can follow the progress of the project-  

I'll send out email updates to everyone that contributes with a status on the project weekly. This will keep everyone abreast of its current progress. I'll take pictures of the build process as well as post the pictures along with a completed write-up on my website. Once the computer is up and running and processing, I'll send out an update with that information. From there I will send out follow-up emails letting everyone know the status of the machine, how much time we've donated, how many workunits we've completed, etc. I'll also send out progress updates from the Help Conquer Cancer project, so everyone knows exactly how our contribution is helping in finding a cure.

(An update to this section- 11/5/2012 Just came to mind that not everyone would necessarily want updates, which is totally fine. I'll send an email out to all contributors upon the completion of the project and people can choose to opt into email updates if they want, or decline updates if they would not like them. Don't want anyone to feel like they'll be getting spammed if they donate, the email updates will be optional)

 

Additional Info-

While I'm really hoping to be able to reach the project funding goal and build a high-end CPU/GPU computer just for cancer research, I realize that I might not make it all the way to my goal. In that case, any money raised will still go towards this project. I will still build a dedicated computer just for cancer research using whatever funds I've raised from this fundraiser, whether it's buying parts or paying for the electrical costs to operate it.

But this project offers just that, a way to help build a computer that will process medical research for cancer.  
 
My Computer Building Experience-  
I've been a proponent and advocate of World Community Grid for a while now, and as a result of this I built my own CPU folding farm last year to contribute it's time and processing power to the many humanitarian and medical research projects on World Community Grid. This computer is a cluster computer that combined 3 computers into one to produce a very powerful machine capable of processing a lot of data. Since last July this computer has already donated almost 30 years of processing time (this is possible in just a year's time because this computer can process 24 workunits at one time, so for every single day of processing it completes almost a month worth of processing for a regular computer) Details on this computer are available here on my website- http://www.totalgeekdom.com/?p=572
 
What your pledges will be used for-   
Your pledges of money will go towards the purchase of the components needed to build this computer and also towards the costs of electricity to run this computer. All money donated will go into an account just for this computer, and all money beyond the component costs will be used to fund the electricity costs to run the computer. 
 
My Contribution-
My contribution towards this project will be researching the computer components, buying the components, building the computer, setting up the computer to run World Community Grid and then maintaining the computer with necessary updates and maintenance. Furthermore, I will pay for the electricity costs to continue running it. I'll send out email updates and post information for everyone to see throughout the life of the computer, showing the results of everyone's contributions. 
 

How you can follow the progress of the project-  
I'll send out email updates to everyone that contributes with a status on the project weekly. This will keep everyone abreast of its current progress. I'll take pictures of the build process as well as post the pictures along with a completed write-up on my website. Once the computer is up and running and processing, I'll send out an update with that information. From there I will send out follow-up emails letting everyone know the status of the machine, how much time we've donated, how many workunits we've completed, etc. I'll also send out progress updates from the Help Conquer Cancer project, so everyone knows exactly how our contribution is helping in finding a cure.
(An update to this section- 11/5/2012 Just came to mind that not everyone would necessarily want updates, which is totally fine. I'll send an email out to all contributors upon the completion of the project and people can choose to opt into email updates if they want, or decline updates if they would not like them. Don't want anyone to feel like they'll be getting spammed if they donate, the email updates will be optional)
 
Additional Info-
While I'm really hoping to be able to reach the project funding goal and build a high-end CPU/GPU computer just for cancer research, I realize that I might not make it all the way to my goal. In that case, any money raised will still go towards this project. I will still build a dedicated computer just for cancer research using whatever funds I've raised from this fundraiser, whether it's buying parts or paying for the electrical costs to operate it.

story:
“The road to recovery will be the toughest challenge Rich has ever faced. But we all know him as a young man in the prime of his life, a fighter of fierce courage and steely determination. We believe that with all our love, care and support, we can get Rich ‘back on his bike’, to continue on his life’s journey!” ~ Rich’s mum

Meet Us

We are Amy, Tamsin and Greg - Rich's family.

We are committing to an epic 30 day BIKRAMS YOGA CHALLENGE !!

Bikrams is a 90 minute, 26 Yoga pose class in 40 degree heat and each posture is performed TWICE!! Each of us have committed to doing 30 classes in 30 days. That is 45 hours and 1560 poses each!!!!

Please support us and select a sponsorship level to suit your budget. Open your hearts (and wallets) while we sweat it out on the mat, in honour of our brother. Sponsor us by the class, by the hour, by the hour or by the calorie!( about 18 000 calories each)

3 Ways to Get Involved and Help

1. SPONSOR US Donate whatever you can (every bit helps and will be greatly appreciated)
2. SPREAD THE WORD - Email this campaign to friends and family around the globe
- Post our link and Share it on Facebook
- Tweet our campaign on Twitter
3. PRAY Light a candle or send happy healing vibes to our Ironman and his recovery

Rich is more than just our Brother. He is a World-Championship level triathlete, passionate fisherman, avid outdoorsman, excellent cook, loving brother and awesome friend.

Meet Rich

A month before his 30th birthday, our athletic and driven younger brother Richard Holland was knocked off his bicycle by a car and sustained life threatening injuries. Whilst training for an upcoming Iron Man and despite excellent safety precautions, Rich was hit from behind by a car, sustaining multiple life-threatening injuries. These included: broken ribs, punctured lungs, a fractured sternum, fractured right fibula, and severe injuries to his brain. His brain injuries are substantial, the worst of which is a contusion on his brain stem which caused an immediate coma. After months of heartbreak, waiting and praying, he slowly made his way through his coma and began to regain consciousness. 10 months later, his condition is relatively stable, but he is extremely compromised. Rich has what is known as a severe Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI), and the specific condition he has been left with is known as Locked-in Syndrome.

His brain has a loss of motor messages sent to his body and this means he is unable to move his body at all, and is unable to communicate, except through a blinking eye and a spelling board. Only time and intense neuro rehab will tell if this motor control will be regained.

This is obviously very frustrating and frightening for him, but his spirit and strength is evident, he tackles each day with grace, patience, courage , plenty of laughs and a contagious smile.

The Sim Bike

A Sim Bike is a Rehabilitation Therapy system,that has the ability for both Leg and Arm cycling.

By replicating the cycle motion, the legs, trunk and arms are stimulated and up to 10-16 major muscle groups are engaged and activated.The benefits of this include the reversal of muscle atrophy, improved circulation, an increased range of motion and the reduction of muscle spasms.

This is what Rich's mum had to say about it: "That is the ultimate dream for Rich. When I showed him the pic of the bike and explained to him how it works and what it does to help stimulate so many pathways simultaneously, he just cried. He is so desperate to do something physical."

Gratitude

The fundraising is a pivotal part of Rich's success. Most of his extensive rehabilitation is being funded privately by our family. We want to give him the best chance of recovery - and that means giving him the best equipment and rehab team we can afford.

Thank you in advance for your contribution. You are AWESOME and the latest member of #TeamRich. Your assistance is greatly appreciated and Rich is so lucky to have your support. People like you make the world a better place.

We will keep you updated with how our Bikram challenge is progressing, and please continue to be apart of Rich's progress and journey ahead.

  • Back on Your Bike website: www.backonyourbike.com

  • Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/BackOnYourBikeDonateForRichHolland
  • Twitter: https://twitter.com/BackOnYourBike

For more information email yoga@backonyourbike.com

story:
Hi everyone, please read my story.

My name is Alexandra and I'm a young girl who has been struggling to live her life the last 6 years. I have been diagnosed with endometriosis,stomach ulcers, chronic pain, chronic kidney stones, and i am still undergoing tests and seeing many doctors for sickness that doctors can not seem to understand which causes me to faint, be extremely weak,difficulty breathing, and extreme pains in my head. I have very brittle bones. I have a bone disorder where the calcium in my bones goes to my kidneys instead which creates large kidney stones. My endometriosis is slowly taking over and some people take this disease lightly not knowing it is actually a benign form of cancer.

--

I was taken out of school sophmore year of highschool due to medical issues. I was unable to function and had already missed many days of school. I couldn't live like the other kids could. I still beat myself up thinking about how I couldn't finish something so easy. I tried a simple charter school and was also taken out of that as well. I tried working and was fired for fainting and missing many days. I just can't seem to live life like a regular child. I have been feeling so elderly and depressed.

 

To make matters worse, my insurance is getting ready to end. I will not be able to see the doctors I need to or get the medicine which helps with my pain and nausea and other problems that come along with my sickness.

I was in bed for 2 years and no longer have friends to hang out with for they have moved on and led good lives. I feel so alone and stuck. I want to do things and I'm so frustrated that I can't work or school.

After leaving highschool, I had decided to help my mother's family friends who were trying to adopt for 10 years and had no luck. In november of 2011, I had a baby son named Nathaniel for the couple and due to the pregnancy, my body has endured new problems.

I am so sick of living this life and I'm worried I will get worse after my insurance ends. 

I am asking for donations to help with medicines and the hormone shots i will need for my illness along with future procedures i will need after losing insurance. I know not many may understand but I am still asking for help.

I appreciate anything even as small as a few cents. 

Thank you so very much for reading my story.

 

update:( 3/13/13) Hi everyone. I went to the ER today for painful lumps around my belly button. I figured it was a hernia, but doctor’s are saying the endometriosis tissue has covered my stomach which is why I have no appetite. ( I have lost 65lbs within last year for decreased appetite and nausea.) They gave me some phenergan for nausea so i’m happy about that! I have an appt with my OBGYN next Thursday to schedule an appt for an surgery to burn a bit of the tissue off for temp. pain relief. I hope you are all well! I will update again next Thursday after my appt if not before, thank you! 

 

update:3/23/2013
I had my appointment on thursday and got a call yesterday scheduling me for a surgery on April 3rd. The tissue has traveled to my belly and they doctor is going to see if it is as severe as we think. If it is, I will have to have a hysterectomy :/ Please keep me in your prayers! I will update after surgery!

 

updater: 4/4/13 

my surgery went well. I'm in a lot of pain but unable to buy my pain medication :/ They made 3 incisions on my lower abdomen and he burnt away all the endometrial tissue along with fatty tissue traveling along my stomach wall. This is all I know right now. I'm still in recovery thank you.

story:
Imagine a wellness center that is your second Home

A new place in Milwaukee WI with many choices in healing for you and your pets.

What We Need & What You Get

What you get is a pre-order for your interests.  We will understand exactly what you might be interested by the classes you attend.  There is also an opportunity for you to teach whatever you might be interested in (send us an email with suggestions).

  • We need approximately $1500-$1800 to open our doors.  Starting fees that include a deposit, first month rent, occupancy permits, signs and business insurance.  The rest of the money we need is for supplies like yoga mats, paint tools, chairs, massage tables etc.
  • Perks include facials with a foot soak, Reiki sessions, class options, advertising options, gifting a stranger, and lunch.
  • Even if we do not make our goal, we will work through and find what we need.  It will just mean that we will take longer to open.

The Impact

Our life purpose is to help others.  A place like this will make us able to help more people at one time then we have ever been able to do.

  • Women will be able to understand men more.
  • Happy people are just healthier physically and mentally.  
  • Jobs will be created as a result of the place.
  • We will have a cat rescue let us foster a cat, when people show up to our location, they may want to adopt it. Then we will foster another one and in the process we will save animal lives.

Risks & Challenges

So far we found a place in a city that requires more time and money to get all the necessary permits.  Then we found another one that was not as expensive but with the same issue.  Then the last place was perfect but construction shut down the street in front of it.  

  • We now understand that a place in Milwaukee or Wauwatosa have the easiest permits to obtain.  This knowledge will cut down wasted time searching for places that take longer to open.
  • If we find a place in Milwaukee we can utilize a non-profit with resources for business.
  • Reiki is a traditional Japanese healing that some people do not understand or feel comfortable with.  We just have the right space that accepts this practice. 
  • All though we would love to hurry to open a space we need to really make sure we choose the best option.  We don't want to just take anything, so it is just might take more time then we anticipate to open. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Let us know if there is a place to rent you might know about.
  • Tell us about your product or service you might want to share at our space(email Jessica@LuxuryMassageTherapist.com).
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Who we are

There is a business owner named Jessica Dragan who has been in business on accident for 10 years.  She is self taught and successful at running a mobile massage practice.

  • She is an Army Veteran
  • She is an over achiever in her credentials, which shows passion for people and the practice.  She has over 1400 hours of training in massage therapy.
  • She just wants to share the people and teachings she has found along the way with you!
  • While a wellness center is new to her, meaning she has never done this before, she is confident in her knowledge and passion to make it a HUGE success.
  • She can not sit still, so there is always a project she needs to do, and the possibilities are limitless.
  • Ask anything, we are happy to share anything with you!
