faith, focus, mentoring and nurturing has suppressed or discouraged 
these potential “Rising Stars” to come into the fullness of themselves. 

Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
Please share this with other and help us get the word out, post on your Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Share our Campaign.
Use the Indiegogo share tools!
And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Medical Mission Team and Church Plant Revisits 

I am asking the Lord of the harvest to allow me to return to Uganda July 23rd through August 13th. I will be returning to the islands of Lake Victoria with a medical mission team and to the Bugiri region to revisit, encourage and teach at churches that have been planted in the last four years.  The medical mission team is connected with the mission work of James and Sonya Herron, African-American missionaries with the International Mission Board.  The Ugandan churches in the Bugiri region were planted by Ugandan churches desiring to plant a church within 20 minutes walking distance in the remote bush of Uganda.

Prayers and Goats and Worm Pills and Corrugated Roofs Needed

In order to go, we need your prayers and your money to support these churches and to buy medical supplies. Would you be willing to spend $10 to provide a church a Lugandan Bible? Or $40 for a goat to help sustain the churches in these remote villages? Or two goats (male and female) will over a couple of years will provide milk and meat for many. Or $50 for worm pills for a small island’s day clinic? Or $100 corrugated tin for an open air church roof. Or $2,500 for land and a primitive church structure? Would you send money to buy food, seed or school supplies for a seminary student? Or $135 for a year of seminary training? All the funds go toward helping Africans and none toward the cost of my travel to Uganda.

The needs are large. The Holy Spirit is doing might things to bring glory and donor to God the Father through His one and only Son, Jesus Christ, our Lord and Savior! Please help us be more effective by joining us with prayer and financial support.


Please pray for the harvest to be plentiful, for money for Bibles, medical supplies and church support!

All of the money given in support of the churches, orphans and medical mission trip. None will be used for my travel.  The trip is conducted by O'Fallon Baptist Church with funds also collected by Memphis Fellowship.

You can also make checks out to Fellowship Memphis Church (P.O. Box 11465, Memphis, TN 38111) with memo Mike Studdard, Uganda.

Total Funding

We need $18,000 to fund the following:

  • Medical Mission Team - $9,000 for medical supplies, medicines, hygiene products, leave behind supplies for basic medical needs to last the islands visited (7 to 9 islands) for a year. 
  • Bugiri Church Plant Revisits - $9,000 will be spent to buy land for one church and a building for the church as well as a fence for goats to provide for the basic needs of the church community. Additionally, funding for seminary students ($135 to send one student to seminary) as well as Lugandan bibles for both projects.
  • I will itemize all funds purchased with funds from this indiegogo.
  • If I don't reach the goal, the funds raised will be used to purchase as much supplies as possible.

What Good Will This Do?

The island people of Lake Victoria are generally folks who have fled the mainland. They are among the most marginalized and underserved peoples in Africa. Many have not heard about the gospel, have not had medical treatment, and struggle daily to feed themselves and their families. Offering medical assistance in many cases frees them from pain, identifies problems that are life threatening and can be treated on the mainland, and just offers love for the unloved. 

The Bugiri region of Uganda is mostly populated by subsistence farmers. When the crops are good, they can feed themselves, but when the crops are not good, they struggle. Over 30 churches have been planted in this area over the last 6 years. All but one of the churches are thriving. Of the planted Ugandan churches, the more recent churches are usually led by men from the area who have received at least a GED-equivalent from a seminary. They encourage development of community savings coops as well as starting simple businesses like sewing, raising chickens, etc. A thriving local church is the hub of a rural area and provides fellowship with other Christians but also provides freedom from being under the spell of the local witch doctor.

Both of these projects are led by men and women who are passionate about the people they are serving and about the gospel's spread throughout the island or village.

Risks & Challenges

The risks to the team are minor compared to the people being served. The boat trips to each island are dangerous especially when storms pop up. If a boat sinks, there is little to do but hang on and wait for another boat to happen by in the vast expanse of Lake Victoria. The fourteen or so people on the team serving the medical clinics sleep in tents and do not have access to running water or electricity. 

But as long as we can get medical supplies to each island the people will flock to see a doctor or a nurse...we don't have to advertise!

There is little risk to being an assist to the Bugiri church plants. They love when folks who have participated in helping them begin a church come to visit....even more happy if we can buy land for the church...most churches planted meet under a tree or in mud huts if there is bad weather.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially that is fine!  Just  pray for the team while we plan to go, while we serve and while we return.  Pray for those that we will come in contact with that they will be helped in some way and that the Spirit of the living God will touch them where they live and that they will desire to have a relationship with God to know his fullness, his love, his power.  That's it...prayer is more important than finances!  That's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

I have been losing weight in the last year on a fitness journey. In 2012 I started working out. I was 176lbs, Last July I weighed in at 156lbs and today I am around 138lbs, my goal is to look fit and not really focus on my weight in particular and while my hips have stayed my boobs have decided to say goodbye to me, already having dropped from a 36DD/DDD to a 34C and losing. I have wanted a boob job for years now but haven't been in a healthy place to get one. And, not having enough money to get one I ask you my fans to help me. If every one of you donated $1-$2 I would easily have enough to make my dream a reality. 

Also, I am not looking to go over the top and be mis-proportioned. I simply want a natural hourglass shape instead of a pear shape. I want it to look as natural as possible. I plan on getting Cohesive Silicone Gel Implants and if you don't know much about them or the differences between implant types watch this informational video. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XGr5R8Bu5R8 

I plan on going to a highly qualified surgeon for this type of implant. Who uses insertion cuts that are smaller and heal more naturally. I want to look natural and have the natural slope in my chest. But since you can't grow boobs the way you can grow muscle augmentation is the option I have for feeling more like me again. While some may not understand my reasons for wanting this surgery or feel like I shouldn't get an augmentation, please keep in mind that it is for me and for my personal confidence and well-being. I want to feel proud of my body again. My chest is a big part of my body confidence and now I don't have it anymore. 


What I Need

Break down:

  • $8000 is the average price for this type silicone implants plus the additional medical costs of the surgery. This money would be going straight towards the surgery and costs associated with it and will not be used for anything other.
  • Perks for larger donations will be detailed on twitter or you can email me. 
  • If I don't reach my goal my funds will be placed in a savings account that will continue to be added onto until I do reach it whether with help or by myself. They will not be used for anything other than the surgery costs. 
  • I will be getting cohesive gel silicone implants with a periareolar incision for the most natural look possible.

The Impact

Getting these implants will make me feel better about myself. Over the years I grew accustomed to my large chest and loved showing it off. But, feeling the need to be fit and healthy set me on a path toward personal fitness.  My weight loss has me still fighting with the fact that while I am curvy still I don't feel like me, having already dropped in cup size from a DD/DDD to a C and still losing.  On the other end of things they will enhance my modeling/adult career as well, though that is just a side effect and not the reason for this. But, wanting to feel fully confident in myself is the main reason for the change.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share and help me achieve my goal!

Thank You 

xxxoo Edyn

story:
For those of you who do not know me, my name is Michael Vincent. The reason my mom and I have started this “campaign” in hopes of raising the funds necessary to send my uncle and grandmother to Florida. My uncle, Michael Hurst, was diagnosed with anaplastic astrocytoma, an incurable type of brain cancer. One of his life's dreams has been to swim with the dolphins. We are hoping to make this dream come true but need the help of friends and friends of friends.

 

Here is a bit more background on my uncle and grandmother:

January 25, 2012 we were blinded-sided when my uncle had to be rushed to the hospital because he was having seizures. Then our lives completely changed we were told that the seizures were due to a tumor in his brain that later was biopsied and showed stage three cancer. He survived two surgeries, one to put a stunt in and remove the pressure, the other to remove the tumor. He was in ICU for several days and in the hospital for over two weeks. He had to work at getting his memory back and at doing simple things like walking. He then went through several weeks of radiation and chemotherapy. We have been blessed with him being in remission for over a year; however, we recently learned that the tumor had grown back, (we were told it would, but like most people, we had hoped the doctors were wrong). He will be having another surgery on his brain sometime in the next few weeks. The doctors all feel as though this is his best chance at living a bit longer.

If you have never met Mike, let me tell you that he is a gentle soul, with a kind heart, an infectious smile, a hardworking man and a much loved person by family and friends. He is a man that finds great joy in the simple things in life, and is also extremely generous. He is an avid sports fan, (loves the buffs, the Av’s, the broncos and for some reason the Duke basketball team). He enjoys playing golf, skiing, fishing, going bowling, ice skating, swimming and is pretty darn good at hoops. Mike has always loved animals and though we are not sure how it happened, he loves dolphins (course who doesn’t).

Please follow the link below to watch a short inspirational documentary I made for and about my uncle, called "The Fighter: An Unfinished Story." 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gmS7xabKgd8

Many of you may know Mike because he is the son of my grandmother, Bonnie Hurst. For over thirty years she was the best kindergarten teacher in the world!

She loved and nurtured each and every child who passed through the door of her classroom. To this day many of her students still remember her as their favorite teacher. Whether you have or have not had the pleasure of knowing her as a teacher, you should also know that she is the most loving, kind, generous, forgiving soul you will ever meet. She loves her family beyond words; and, I think we can all agree that no parent should have to watch their child, (even if that child is now an adult), battle an illness or watch them be in pain. This is an extremely difficult time for her, I mean,  she is the mom after all.

One of our dear friends showed us a place in Key Largo, Fl where my uncle could swim with the dolphins. They offer a special program for cancer patients. If you are interested in learning more the website is: dolphinsplus.com

Due to the financial burden from the medical expenses, the fact that my uncle does not make the kind of money that affords him a trip, and that my grandmother is living on a fixed income, neither one of them are able to “make his dream come true” on their own. Plus their dog Cookie is in need of surgery herself and they must save for that very important expense. We want to make this dream a reality for my uncle and grandmother. Any amount is deeply appreciated and please know that 100% of proceeds go to pay for travel expenses for the two of them. Thank you for taking the time to visit this site and for reading our story. May God bless each and every one of you, just as he has blessed us with these two beautiful people. 


Also, this is a Surprise! Please do not tell Bonnie or Michael Hurst that we are doing this! I am going to put together a short video that will reveal everything to them, and I will put everyone who donates names in the credits, so they know who made this possible! Thanks!

story: .

Lakeshore's Challenge is simple: We raise $5,000 for Craig Hospital Programs through The PUSHing Possible Campaign, and they will donate $3,000! Help us unlock Lakeshore's $3,000 challenge donation by making a donation today! Then share the campaign with your friends and family.

Help patients at Craig Hospital PUSH the boundaries of what is Possible. Patients with spinal cord and brain injuries fight an uphill battle to return to work, school, home and their passions. Many of the programs that our determined patients need in order to rebuild their lives are not covered by insurance. By raising $5,000 through the PUSHing Possible Campaign, we will unlock $3,000 from Lakeshore and allow 51 patients to benefit from Craig Hospital's innovative PUSHing Possible Programs.

Programs 

  • Return to Work Training Program
  • Adaptive Driving Program
  • Adaptive Technology
  • Horticulture Therapy
  • Rehabilitation Engineering                                                                                           

Innovation Begets Progress

Craig Hospital has helped more individuals rebuild their lives than any other rehabilitation facility. We are more than just a hospital. Our innovative programs are proven to work. We PUSH the boundaries of what is Possible. We know that insurance companies will fund our approach one day, but until they are convinced of the efficacy of our innovative approach, five of Craig Hospital's cutting-edge rehabilitation programs need your support.

Doug Finds Independence with the Adaptive Driving Program

Doug Fryendenlund had been driving for more than 30 years before he survived a tragic spinal cord injury. After his injury, Doug worked hard in rehabilitation to reach the point where he could drive once again. Working with Craig Hospital's Driving Program he has learned to transfer from his electric wheelchair inside of his van to the driver's seat. Being able to drive has given him the confidence and the independence to do the things that are important and meaningful to him once again.

John gets Back to Work in a New Way with Adaptive Technology


John Kivimaki sustained a spinal cord injury due to a fall in his own home. Work and people have always been John's focus. After his injury, John needed to learn a new way to use a computer and the telephone due to the limitations of his injury. Through the Adaptive Technology Program, John learned how to use the adaptive tools to check and write emails and use a phone again in a new innovative way. John says he uses adaptive technology everyday as he returns to work.

Keagan Returns to Construction Thanks to Rehab Engineering

Keagan Smith's passion was construction. He framed houses, did a some metal work and welded on the side. Surviving a car accident, Keagan is now a spinal cord injury survivor. Working with the Rehab Engineering Department, he realized that he could return to his passion and weld from his wheelchair. Currently, Keagan is making handrails for the inside of his car so he can transfer himself into the driver's seat with ease. Next, he will work on a more creative project welding a sculpture of a fish.

Jenny Receives Training to Return to Work after a Brain Injury 

Jenny Jabel was an ICU nurse before her injury. She found meaning in helping others through nursing. After a severe car accident where she survived a traumatic brain injury, Jenny had to relearn how to speak, eat, walk, and write. She still works hard to keep moving forward and meet new goals. She has been working with the Return to Work Program for 6 years to develop her skills and focus on her strengths. Jenny's goals of returning to work and feeling like she was contributing to her community motivated her to take classes to learn new skills and volunteer in her community. Thanks to support from the Return to Work Program she secured a job, obtained her driver's license and sets new goals for herself.

Beth Rediscovers her Passion Because of Horticulture Therapy

Beth Pratt was an avid gardener before she sustained a spinal cord injury in her home. She wasn't sure if she'd ever be able to get back to her plants now that she was in a wheelchair. Working with the Horticulture Therapy program, Beth learned how to garden in a new and different way. Learning that she could garden gave her the confidence that she could do all of the things that were meaningful and important to her before her injury. This gave her the confidence to return to work and partner with master gardner's in her area.

Currently, Keagan is making handrails for the inside of his car so he can transfer himself into the driver's seat with ease. Next, he will work on a more creative project welding a sculpture of a fish.Jenny Receives Training to Return to Work after a Brain Injury Jenny Jabel was an ICU nurse before her injury. She found meaning in helping others through nursing. After a severe car accident where she survived a traumatic brain injury, Jenny had to relearn how to speak, eat, walk, and write. She still works hard to keep moving forward and meet new goals. She has been working with the Return to Work Program for 6 years to develop her skills and focus on her strengths. Jenny's goals of returning to work and feeling like she was contributing to her community motivated her to take classes to learn new skills and volunteer in her community. Thanks to support from the Return to Work Program she secured a job, obtained her driver's license and sets new goals for herself.Beth Rediscovers her Passion Because of Horticulture TherapyBeth Pratt was an avid gardener before she sustained a spinal cord injury in her home. She wasn't sure if she'd ever be able to get back to her plants now that she was in a wheelchair. Working with the Horticulture Therapy program, Beth learned how to garden in a new and different way. Learning that she could garden gave her the confidence that she could do all of the things that were meaningful and important to her before her injury. This gave her the confidence to return to work and partner with master gardner's in her area.

story:
My name is Kafi Stockwell, I'm 29 and I'm a full time Mum.  I have a fantastic husband and my daughter really is the greatest and most beautiful girl anyone would have the good fortune to meet.

My Dad has a tumour in his brain.  It's fairly large and obviously very serious.  I've started this campaign to raise money for his medical care as he lives in St Lucia and unlike here in the UK, medical care is not free.  If I could afford to pay for this I would've done in a heartbeat but I am one of many whose household income is too large for government help and too little to be called anything but survival.

Granted, this is not the picture of a cute infant with a serious condition but I only have one Dad and I have  to do what I can to help him.  In receiving the complete £15000 (I know, it's a bloody lot), my Dad would be able to get treated and be with me long enough for him to see his granddaughter (he has never met her).  The help and generosity of the general public would mean more to me than I can put into words.

The funds will go to the Victoria Hospital in St Lucia and another hospital in Barbados where they have the relevant equipment and doctors required to perform the life saving surgery.

It is as much as I can offer to give my handmade wares to as many contributors as I can as a thank you.  My skills are all creative and practical and as I can't guarantee you a concert on the flute, I hope my perks will satisfy most.

Needless to say, if achieved, this campaign will give me something more important than the money which is the time I have left with my Dad and my daughter with her Grandfather.  Anything over the contributions received will be donated in turn to cancer research charities so that we can spread the love to as many as possible.

I can fully appreciate that not everyone can make a contribution and I would ask that if not, please share and forward my cause to as many people as possible to help spread the word and increase the chances of raising this huge amount of money, every little helps, even if it's just a thought.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Nina Wilson, I am a grandmother, and a mother who is obliged by the very nature of being a woman honoring her duty, to protect life, water, the unborn.  I am from The Kahkewistahaw First Nation and have many relative in the Moose Mountains, White Bear, Pheasant Rump, and Ocean man.  I am Nakota Dakota Nehiyo, and i hope to meet the goal of raising enough funds to build a camp out on the lands in Treaty 4. I am honored to work with Jessica Gordon, who is also a co-founder of the Idle No More movement, who hails from the Pasqua First Nation. 

This camp will be open to all who want a future, who want to protect the waters, and the unborn, by simply using the lands again, in the ways they were left for us to take care of and use to sustain us in an open and transparent way.  This camp is about being on the land and understanding what we will lose if the lands, people, waters, are continually comprimised by industry and mining development. 

 

All proceeds will go towards costs to set up camp and to get people trained in living off the land and reconnecting with the stewardship responsibility.  

What We Need & What You Get

Your donations will help us achieve what could very well be, the last line of defense against exploitation and corporate take over in Canada, by offering what rights we have as Indigenous people, in water and land protection from industry encroachment. Offering education on the land also provides an opportunity to share what responsibilities we are obliged by in being Stewards of this Earth.  I ask you all to please support this cause and pass along the information.

 

We need approximately $9000.00 to start with.  This would cover all supplies, such as axes, shovels, food seeds as we will be growing our own foods, and wood, canvas for shades, chainsaws, hoes, gardening tools, water barrels, foods, toilets, blankets, tents, tipis, wall tents, cooking pots, dishes and utensils, materials to build a hunting trapping cabin.and day to day means to communicate, information flyers and sessions on the dangers of fracking and invasive mining, as well as water shed and aquifer information regarding protection and awareness.   Cultural resurgence on the land includes utilizing rights to build cabins that are used for trapping, hunting, and providing shelter while engaging in gathering as well.  Survival skills training for men women and children, are what will be the focus as the cabin becomes a reality.  This cabin will be the first, in a series of cabins built to provide shelter as hunting, gathering, and living off the land becomes a common reality across the Treaty 4 territory. 


The Impact

 

If we do not reach our goal, we will simplify and downsize, carry on and continue, perhaps taking more time to develop our camps by further fundraising.  We want to invite many ppl out to come and enjoy the camp, to come out an see why the lands waters, air and creatures are worth fighting for.  To come out and hear why our elders and spiritual people always encouraged wellness that includes a balanced and healthy involvement in being a part of the lands and waters that provide us all with much more than enjoyment and relaxation.   

 

We will utilize many  volunteers,who will record the day to day process that would be a learning tool for the young people, as well as the public to see, how people caring for lands and waters, are this countries last hope of ensuring all people have safe and clean air, soil, and water.  It is time to reveal to the public, that people simply utilizing lands and waters have stories that need to be told. We want people to know how powerful stories are and how healing the lands and waters are, regarding protection, usage, and living off the lands. From this place we can engage leadership in both indigenous and non Indigenous communities, in creating a cleaner, greener, more sustainable future.  The beginning is always uncertain, but the truth is there are many who can and will contribute to leading the way to a better future for all those yet to come.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help get the word out and share this as much as you can, offer advice, concerns, and encouragement.  We love our land! We love our Water! We love the ppl!

 

Come out n help build, come out n boss us around lol!

 

ninawilson101@gmail.com

story:
I  am hoping to support and gain your support in helping to grant a colleagues wish.

She has suffered recent months due to throat cancer and unfortunately   there is no  more that can be done  to improve her condition! 

So her wish is to see some snow,  it would be great if you and I  could  help towards  her achieving  this.

I am hosting  a tea party at my house this Saturday of Scones and Pimms from 11am onwards.I know this is such short notice for everyone but this is the harsh reality of the situation.

I would love to see as many faces as possible Saturday but I know  everyone has very busy lives, 

So if your unable to bless us with your  company this Saturday I hope you will be able to make a donation how ever big or small via this page! 

Thanks for reading!! Hope to see you soon xxx

Or donate directly via PayPal to amfreya@gmail.com xx

story:
As a successful athlete, I bring ethics and hard work to any challenge or group I am a member of.

As an athlete, I know I am a role model to young aspiring athletes and I conduct myself in a respectable and appropriate manner in all situations, in and out of the cage.

By donating to help fund my air travel back to my coach in Brazil for my 7 week Pro-training camp.

Each and every individual that helps and donates any amount of money towards my training will receive a signed photo at the end of this campaign and anything over $25. free signature autographed tee ...I will also be obliged to set up personal training session for after my next professional fight in December 2013.... All pre deposited funds will go towards this camp and will get extra allotted time. Email me for appointments.. NYFIREFOX31@gmail.com

Contributing to me will allow me  the peace of mind to focus on my Professional goals and to continue my  focus on my aspirations.


By making a donation , you put your trust in me and I become an ambassador for the East Coast. As with every opportunity, I will represent the East Coast with the highest level of morals and ethics.

A little bit about me:

WWW.CASSIECRISANO.COM

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute,  that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • You can help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
What's the deal?

My name is Keri and I was born and raised Philadelphia. I've been working since I was 13, with the goal of eventually having a business of my own to grow from the ground up. A business that would benefit my community, that would improve peoples' lives, and help people to be their best selves. Good news - I'm almost there!

Halcyon Floats will be the first Float Center in Philadelphia. Located in Northern Liberties, we are excited to bring the progressive technique of sensory deprivation to our hometown community.

 Never heard of Floating?

That’s okay! It’s easy to understand the benefits, and it’s
easy to float. Let me give you some info about floating, as well as why
everyone can benefit from it.


Imagine a tank filled with water 10 inches deep, heated the
skin temperature. Mixed in the water is over 1000 lbs of epsoms salts, making
it completely sterile, and making you completely buoyant. The tanks are
soundproof and pitch dark, allowing for you to rest all of your senses. With
your body free from the pull of gravity, your spine releases and stretches
freely as you enjoy the sensation of what seems to be floating in air. Once you
finally hit full relaxation, your brain begins to produce Theta waves, allowing
you to experience perfect clarity of thought, crispness of creativity, and the
deepest meditation. These waves are normally only produced when falling asleep
or waking. By restricting your sensory intake you are allowing yourself to
reach and maintain a level of rest that is next to impossible otherwise. One
hour in the tank is equivalent to 4 hours of sleep.


As if the ability to achieve that level of calm was not enough, there is an extensive list of benefits to go along:
 

  • Reduces stress and stress related pain & illness
  • Helps eliminate addictive behavior, including weight loss
  • Creates an ideal environment for meditation & lucid dreaming
  • Is ideal for managing back pain throughout pregnancy
  • Enhances higher learning and aids in visualization
  • Speeds healing and recovery from physical activity and injury
  • Relieves pain from illness and injury,
  • Increases harmonious brain patterns
  • Enhances the creativity process
  • Speeds recovery from jet lag and exhaustion
  • Lowers blood pressure, and cortisol level
  • Improves athletic performance
  • Cleanses the body of toxins

 

What We Need & What You Get

It's simple, we need help funding our first few months of business in order to bring affordable floats to our community.

With the understanding that money is tight we are asking for your support in the form of a $1 donation accompanied by 1 share.  In return, you will be entered in a drawing to win a 90 minute float.

If you would like to donate more, please do! We have great incentives that include Floats! Floats! Floats!! And/or some awesome Halcyon Floats swag!


The Impact

Your help will bring floating to the fine city of Philadelphia, as well as it's suburbs, introducing a brand new method of healing the mind, body, and soul that everyone can benefit from.

As you can see in the list provided above, floating isn't a spa treatment as much as a therapy.  Floating can improve the way we think, feel, and thus treat one another.    This campaign will get our shop off the ground on the right foot, allowing us to bring affordable floats to the community that needs it.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for taking the time to watch my video and read about my campaign. If you are unable to contribute but still want to help, it's as easy as a share on Facebook or Twitter, or a quick email to your friends our family, to help spread the word about the Halcyon Floats campaign.

story:
*UPDATE* Thank you to everyone who's supported Bella so far, we are so blessed to be so close to meeting our goal, but of course WE CAN GO OVER OUR GOAL!  Please spread the word and get Bella's story out there.. Not only are you helping Bella, but you are also rasing awareness for OI!!!

Bella was born with Osteogenisis Imperfecta. It is also referred to as brittle bone disease.

Bella has two older brothers Landon and Tyler and two loving parents Bill and Mindy.

Bella’s Story

Bella’s mom Mindy went for her seven month ultrasound when the doctor noticed that the baby’s limbs were much shorter than they were supposed to be. A more detailed ultrasound would reveal that she also had numerous fractures throughout her small frame, along with bowing in her arms and legs. Her skull showed signs of being demineralized.

Because of the severity of her broken limbs she was diagnosed as having type III which is severe.

The doctors told Mindy and Bill that their baby would not survive birth.

Many infants pass away from respiratory difficulties. Children that do survive past infancy often do not grow past three feet tall and spend most of their life in wheelchairs.

Bella was born on January 30th 2009. She was a miracle.

She weighed 5 lbs 7 ounces and was 16 inches long. Her family had to carry her on a pillow because she was so fragile.

During her first few months of life she suffered numerous breaks and so she started receiving infusions of pamidronate to help with the pain and to thicken her bones.

Even with the infusions her limbs would keep breaking.

She would often break both arms so she would accommodate herself by using her feet to hold her bottle.

She continued to have many breaks so to strengthen and reinforce her bones she had rodding surgeries in her legs and upper arms. She will need additional surgeries as she grows to replace them.

Because she started having a lot of spinal fractures she started on a new treatment called zolendronate.

She’s had a decrease in spinal fractures and so she continues to receive these treatments every four months.

Bella also has brittle teeth. Her front tooth recently just suddenly broke off.

The dentist said she will need her teeth capped to keep them from breaking and to help her be able to eat more foods. Bella‘s diet consists of mostly very soft foods.

Bella just turned 4. She is very small for her age. She is 25 inches long and weighs 16 lbs. She is very intelligent for her age. She enjoys going to preschool twice a week. She loves to sing and dance and enjoys being a special princess. She continues to exceed her expectations.

She enjoys physical therapy and water therapy each week. Water therapy is a way for her to strengthen her muscles.

She strives to become stronger everyday.

Hopefully someday she will achieve her dream of being able to walk.

Bill works very hard just to make ends meet for his family. Mindy provides constant care for her daughter and is not able to work outside the home.

Because Bella’s condition is so rare the family has to travel to see specialist’s familiar with treating children with OI.

Her family is burdened with ongoing medical cost and travel expenses. They family desperately needs a new vehicle that can accommodate her. Her home needs to be modified to fit her needs. See complete list of Bella’s needs for details…

Friends and family are reaching out to ask for help.

How You Can Help

You can alleviate some of the overwhelming financial burden of Bella’s medical treatments and dramatically improve her quality of life by contributing.

Every donation helps.

Other Ways to Help

Please pass the word to help this family and to raise awareness of OI. We pray her video will go viral. The family has a fund set up on face book under Bows For Bella and at indiegogo.com/Itty Bitty Bella

Medical Need List

Per Mobile Powered Wheelchair

Mini van to transport power chair

Teeth capping Surgery

Trips to Omaha for specialized care- rodding surgeries and yearly clinical checkups

Trips to Nashville for infusions- Zolendronate

Rifton Dynamic Stander- for weightbearing

Trips to Jackson MS- Dental Specialist

Home Modifications

 

More Info on Bella

www.caringbridge.org/visit/isabellaparker

http://www.facebook.com/pages/Bows-For-Bella/134015569295?ref=ts&fref=ts

http://www.wmctv.com/story/21237200/mid-south-f...

 

What You Get

Updated pictures of Bella and a spreadsheet of where the money has gone to help her.

Teeth capping Surgery
Trips to Omaha for specialized care- rodding surgeries and yearly clinical checkups
Trips to Nashville for infusions- Zolendronate
Rifton Dynamic Stander- for weightbearing
Trips to Jackson MS- Dental Specialist
Home Modifications

story:
My name is Stephanie Rigdon, and Gina Grimes is my cousin. Recently, she has had some health problems. This began over a month ago with a peristent fever, fatigue and a rash, and has now progressed to extreme swelling, low hemoglobin count and internal bleeding. At first, the signs pointed to lupus, but with the increasing complications it is unclear what is the root condition. The internal bleeding stopped on its own yesterday, and is thought to be the result of a liver biopsy that was done. Her kidneys were not working properly, and it was exacerbated by draining the fluid in her body and medication. Today, she is bing transfered to another hospital to begin dialysis and there has been talk of cancer being a possibility. The truth is, they do not know what is afflicting Gina and it seems the road to a diagnosis will be a long one; with the one to recovery being even longer.

Gina is a devoted and loved mother, granddaughter, daughter, wife, sister, aunt, niece, cousin and former teacher. She has two young children at home, and gave up teaching in order to stay at home with them. She has also been the caretaker of my two year old daughter for most of her life. She has been an inspiration to many chlldren in her lifetime. Her husband is also a teacher, and being a teacher at a private school, does not provide with the best health insurance, unfortunately.Their medical bills are accumulating rapidly with no end in sight, so ANY money donated will go directly to paying any medical expenses not coveredy by insurance (estimates so far are upward of $9,000). The holidays are not the easiest times to worry about money in addition to worrying about your health and having to be away from your family.

Gina is so young, and this could easily happen to any one of us in an instant. Any financial support is obviously appreciated during this Christmas season, but so are positive comments, prayers and spreading her story to others. It would be great to know just how much people really care! 

An account has also been set up for Gina through thirty-one, because she also sells these products. My sister, Mandy Storm, does as well and has agreed to process these special orders. All prodeeds raised (as well as commission) will go directly to Gina. You can check out what you like and contact Mandy at mythirtyone.com/alstorm

story:
My name is Jack Tucker and I am a tow truck driver who is not working right now because of a tragic accident to my 11 year old daughter, Jacklyn. On june 19, 2012 she was having a sleepover at her friends house. She was laying on the couch and rolled off and her friends dog (jack russel, bull dog mix) was laying there and began to growl, when Jacklyn got up to get on the couch the dog viciously pounced and attacked my daughter tearing off her upper right side of her lip, nostril, and cheek. She couldn't get the dog off and it also took a chunk of her left side just beneath her arm and tore it open and bit her on the back of her left arm.

 

That is the worst phone call i have ever received. She had to be trauma hawked to the st mary's trauma center in west palm beach, fl where they began an emergency repair on her face. The surgeon was able to put her original skin back on but he said it will not work because the blood vessel was unrepairable. He had my daughter go through one and a half weeks of hyperbaric treatment to see if they could get blood flowing to her skin. The treatment did not work and the skin died.

 

We had to go to the Joe Dimaggio childrens hospital in hollywood, fl for her to see a facial reconstructive surgeon. The surgeon forwarned me of many future surgeries to repair her face. The next morning she went to surgery and was in for 6 hrs of surgery. He was able to use the live skin on her face and lower lip to save the damaged area. It was a very horrific experience that I hope no parent has to go through. My daughters mouth is now stiched shut for three weeks and cannot eat solid food. I told Jacklyn that i would stay at her side the entire time and i have. I have not been back to work since the accident so i can take care of her while she has her face stitched up. The medical bills are piling up and our home bills are starting to pile up. Jacklyn will also have to have cosmetic surgeries in the future also that we need to have money for. I just can't do this myself but i don't want my daughter to stay with a damaged face. She needs the cosmetic surgeries so she will be normal and not self concious.

 

This is a plea for help from any and everyone to help achieve our goal of $225,000 for everything that needs to be paid and done in the future. Even if we do not meet our goal anything will help our situation. My daughter deserves to have her face back. Indiegogo.com has plenty of tools to help get our story for help out to everyone so please if you can donate something we would really appreciate it .

 

Think, what would you do if this happened to your child. Thank you for your time.

story:
YES! She's finally doing it.

Misch is going to massage school.

For years I've been giving friends, family, and colleagues little massages for the pleasure of doing so, but without really knowing what I'm doing. It's all been instinct and feedback.*

I was laid off a few months ago and decided to take this as an opportunity to make good on that long-expressed intention to learn and train and share this gift. Massage therapy is also a portable skill to build professional practice upon, and I'm excited by the range of ways I'd like to use it.

Everyone has been so wonderfully encouraging that I'm launching this campaign as a way for you to tangibly contribute--with perks courtesy of my soon-to-be "magic" hands.

The goals: CMT, 500 hours, $3325

My current goal is to become a Certified Massage Therapist, which in California requires 500 hours of coursework plus practice. It's the middle level of professional certification and will lay a solid, well-rounded foundation to begin working in the field. 

I'm attending a wonderful school, McKinnon in Oakland. Tuition for 500 hours, not including textbooks, is $6635; I've already paid about half, and this campaign goal of $3325 is toward the rest.

I researched scholarships quite a bit and have found none that I qualify for; McKinnon doesn't offer financial aid, and no state job re-training funds are available. So this is our own deal. The campaign spans the holidays and ends next Valentine's Day--share the love.

The perks for contributing

Why, massage, of course.

Basically, every dollar entitles you to either 2 minutes of "guinea pig" (practice hours) or 1 minute of "pro" (once I'm certified). We can mix, too. Perks are transferable; GIFT me!

Seattle friends, I'll be in town Dec 19 through Jan 2. However, I'm not sure what I'll do about not having a massage table. Anybody have a portable one I can borrow?

And if you're in a "pay it backward" position instead of a "pay it forward"... You can still be a guinea pig and cheer me on! Your guinea pig feedback helps me become a better bodyworker, and there are other ways to help, like spreading the word once I hang a sign outside my door.

Lastly, for a little extra fun: anyone who contributes $250 gets massage perks AND gets to choose my next hair color! Light pink? Emerald green? Zebra stripe? Can a bunch of people team up to get this one? Absolutely!

And after?

I've got a ton of ideas about how I want to apply my skills. Many of these are inspired by YOU. 

I'd like to:

  • Use it as a vehicle to travel by studying local modalities and teaching and/or practicing abroad for a portion of each year.
  • Research touch therapies in Africa--so far in reading I have come across discussion of the Americas, Europe, Australia, and Asia, but NOTHING in Africa, which has amazing healing traditions, surely some with touch. Ideally I'll be student and teacher, to train a few local people in a bankable skill.
  • Work with the special needs of the elderly. And people with MS. And musicians. And cats and dogs. As well as regular folks and desk jockeys.
  • Set up a "scholarship" fund so I can give massages to people who can't afford it and to the underserved, like veterans with PTSD. Maybe even organize a non-profit for it.
  • Explore lots of healing modalities (reiki?) and see where this all leads...

Thank you!

Humbly yours,

Misch

 

* And the occasional challenge. My friend Eric told me about this singular spot from an old neck injury that only ONE person had ever been able to find, and it was such a release that he'd passed out. A few minutes later, I became person number two.

story:
Thanks to the Health Journals for featuring the Define Bottle, an eco chic fruit infused        water bottle to take on the go and me!  Great photo shoot and article!  Will post the    article soon…

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Confirmation that we filed for our patent - we are patent pending

holder

Tooling Invoice for 50%
Cleared check for 50% of tooling
Production Schedule - click for larger view

Questions?

Please contact us at: 

carter@definebottle.com or

carla@definebottle.com

Please note that this was developed by my 14 year old son and that all funds raised through indiegogo will be managed by his parents to go towards production.

 

 What is the Define Bottle?

The Define Bottle is a beautifully crafted glass and bamboo infusion bottle for creating fresh fruit infused water and taking it on the go.  It represents getting back to the basics and a step towards helping the obesity and diabetes epidemic that has been caused by soda and other sugary drinks.  Fresh fruit and water is pure and simple.

 

PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE AT:

www.definebottle.com for all the details and features of The Define Bottle.

Please note that to get a bottle you will need to support us through indiegogo.com/definebottle

What stage is the bottle in?

We are currently in the tooling phase, where the factory is making the parts that will make your bottles.  We anticipate production will be complete by mid December and we will be shipping towards the end of that month.  If you contribute to this project, we WILL deliver the product. 

 

ABOUT THE DEFINE BOTTLE TEAM


Thank you for taking the time to learn more about us. 
Before I discuss the bottle, I would like to give you a little background on how it came about - it’s a pretty cool story.  For the past few years my son and I would make fruit infused water everyday in either a countertop vessel or in a pitcher that would fit in the refrigerator. However, when I would run out, I would always grab a diet soda or artificially sweetened water. One day, my son asked why don’t you just take fruit infused water with you. I explained to him that I cant just throw fruit in to a water bottle because it would float up to the mouth piece and swell and get stuck in the bottom of the bottle. Trust me, I had a few bottles with science experiments growing in the bottom. I couldn't get the fruit out.


That was my son’s  “Aha” moment where he turned into a 14 year old entrepreneur. He developed sketches of what he had in mind, did a lot of research on how you develop a product and pitched it to my husband and I. Instantly we both thought it was a great idea not only for your health but for the environment too.


It has been a lot of work and it has taken us over 9 months to get us to the point to where we are today. Once we knew we were going to invest in this monetarily and pour tons of time and energy in to it, we enlisted the help of an industrial design firm in Los Angeles. We are currently in the tooling/molding phase and our first run will be in early November with delivery to the United States in December.


Our industrial design team offers end-to-end product design and development out of its studio in Los Angeles, CA. They provide Industrial Design, User Experience, Mechanical Engineering, in addition to Supply Chain Setup, Manufacturing Support, and Quality Control services to their clients.


An Design Lab works with multiple factories which we got samples from and quotes. We picked one that was not the cheapest but had the samples closest to our vision and has experience in working with glass and bamboo.We were looking for great craftsmanship and quality materials.We are through the design and prototype stages and have also completed the patent process with an intellectual property firm out of San Francisco (filed for a Utility Patent). We also have a branding expert from San Diego helping to bring the vision to reality. We figured if we were going to do this then let's do it right and find a team of experts to help make our vision a reality.


Through our industrial Design team we have selected a factory that is not necessarily the cheapest but has the craftsmanship and quality that we were looking for.  It truly is a beautiful bottle and it makes you feel great to see your fresh fruit floating in your bottle and knowing that you are doing something great for your body and the environment! It really is one of those things where people will stop and ask you about it.


Now I introduce you to my son Carter:


My name is Carter. Six months ago I began formulating a concept in my mind to give people the tools they need to choose healthy options.  The Define Bottle is the result of my efforts. It is a cutting edge, glass and bamboo reusable water bottle for great tasting fruit infused water. I took the idea behind fruit infused water pitchers and made it mobile, not to mention stylish.


After watching “super size me”, I began to research about the negative health effects of soda and juice. Diabetes and obesity sounded like terrible diseases and I desired to do something about it.  I saw the need to make a sustainable, portable version of fruit infused water pitchers for people on the go. The only other option for health conscious people is for them to buy plain water or plastic bottles of artificially flavored and sweetened water beverages.


I also wanted to to do something good for the environment. The amount of disposable plastic bottles we use is ridiculous and the carbon footprint of a plastic water bottle is not something I want to think about every time I take a drink.


So I wanted the product to be healthy, environmentally friendly, and fill a void in the market. Here are the features I knew it must have:
- A great look. I wanted the bottle to be the best looking water bottle anyone has ever seen.
- Functional. It must keep the fruit cool, and keep the fruit and ice away from the spout to prevent snarfing a large piece of orange when taking a drink.

- Perfect size. It must be large enough to hold a decent amount of water, but not too big or else it will be too heavy or not fit in standard cup holders.

With these ideas in mind, I set out to create a sketch and that started the ball rolling.  Our goal is to have an alternative way to hydrate on the go and not be forced to grab a soda, artificially flavored water or juice and to do something that is good for our bodies and the environment.


We sincerely thank you for taking the time to learn more about us and we hope you will have a bottle in your hand soon!

Below are either our websites or the websites of our partners that have tremendous talent and worked extremely hard on this project!

Websites

  • http://definebottle.com
  • http://fruitinfusedwater.com
  • http://spawaterrecipes.com
  • http://bayareaip.com
  • http://andesignlab.com
  • http://youngentrepreneur.com
  • http://plus.google.com
  • http://facebook.com
  • http://entrepreneur.com
  • http://AkulaKreative.com

story:
Who are We?

Founded in 2006 by a group of west Texas physicians, Mercy Trips is a non-denominational Christian team of healthcare workers who partner with local doctors and nurses to provide free medical clinics, surgical procedures, and health education to underserved areas in Uganda, Africa. Our teams include compassionate individuals from all backgrounds and experience levels. Our goal is to provide medical relief but also disease prevention.  Each team member/volunteer pays or raises his or her own expenses each trip. THESE CONTRIBUTIONS are used to purchase medications, mosquito nets, vaccinations and surgical supplies. When funds permit, we partner with local foundations to provide clean water sources and medical training for locals who aspire to the medical professions. 

Since we will use 100% of the contributions for the people we serve, we can't offer any perks. But we do want you to know that we appreciate your help immensely, and all the people who benefit from your kindness appreciate it even more! 

What We Need 

Our teams have been travelling to eastern Uganda twice yearly. In 2013 -2014 we would like to add two additional trips each year into western Uganda near the Congo border. In 2012 our teams were performing up to forty surgical procedures per trip and treating as many as 800 people per day in clinics! We purchase all of our supplies and medications in  Uganda to make the contributions go further. However, it's never enough and we have to turn people away every day from the medical clinics for lack of supplies. 

Ten thousand dollars in contributions will help us ensure that the summer and winter trips this year will be better prepared to handle the extraordinary need in these rural areas. 

1 round of malaria treatment: $10 per patient

1 course of typhoid treatment: $10 per patient

1 round of Antibiotic treatment: $5-$15 per patient

But prevention goes even further:

1 mosquito net costs $10 and can protect an entire family from malaria!!

1 water well in Eastern Uganda costs $2400 and can provide clean water to an entire village!

Surgical supplies: we "stuff" our luggage with local contributions and equipment but have to purchase the anesthetics, pain medications and post-op supplies.

Our Goals

1) To meet the medical and surgical needs of underserved areas in Uganda

2) To promote disease prevention via education and active intervention

3) To educate and train local healthcare professionals and encourage them to continue independently of Mercy Trips 

Impact

Most of the people we serve have no other source of healthcare. Our impact is twofold: we treat the diseases but also focus heavily on their prevention. The surgical team provides general and gynecologic procedures including major neck, abdominal and pelvic surgeries as well as numerous hernia repairs and other minor procedures to people who would otherwise go untreated. A simple hernia repair can allow a father to return to his work and keep his family fed. Basic health exams, vaccinations, de-worming of children, mosquito net distribution as well as urgent treatment of malaria, typhoid, respiratory infections and other tropical illnesses are carried out in our village outreach sites.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute. There are other ways you can help! 

-Get the word out! Please share our campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, and any other social media platforms. Tell others about us so that we can provide even more care. 

-Join us! All are welcome, regardless of religious affiliation. Come see how your contribution is spent. There's plenty of work and never enough workers!

-Like us on Facebook and keep up with what we're doing.
story_txt:
Who are We?
Founded in 2006 by a group of west Texas physicians, Mercy Trips is a non-denominational Christian team of healthcare workers who partner with local doctors and nurses to provide free medical clinics, surgical procedures, and health education to underserved areas in Uganda, Africa. Our teams include compassionate individuals from all backgrounds and experience levels. Our goal is to provide medical relief but also disease prevention.  Each team member/volunteer pays or raises his or her own expenses each trip. THESE CONTRIBUTIONS are used to purchase medications, mosquito nets, vaccinations and surgical supplies. When funds permit, we partner with local foundations to provide clean water sources and medical training for locals who aspire to the medical professions. 
Since we will use 100% of the contributions for the people we serve, we can't offer any perks. But we do want you to know that we appreciate your help immensely, and all the people who benefit from your kindness appreciate it even more! 



What We Need 
Our teams have been travelling to eastern Uganda twice yearly. In 2013 -2014 we would like to add two additional trips each year into western Uganda near the Congo border. In 2012 our teams were performing up to forty surgical procedures per trip and treating as many as 800 people per day in clinics! We purchase all of our supplies and medications in  Uganda to make the contributions go further. However, it's never enough and we have to turn people away every day from the medical clinics for lack of supplies. 
Ten thousand dollars in contributions will help us ensure that the summer and winter trips this year will be better prepared to handle the extraordinary need in these rural areas. 
1 round of malaria treatment: $10 per patient
1 course of typhoid treatment: $10 per patient
1 round of Antibiotic treatment: $5-$15 per patient
But prevention goes even further:
1 mosquito net costs $10 and can protect an entire family from malaria!!
1 water well in Eastern Uganda costs $2400 and can provide clean water to an entire village!
Surgical supplies: we "stuff" our luggage with local contributions and equipment but have to purchase the anesthetics, pain medications and post-op supplies.
Our Goals
1) To meet the medical and surgical needs of underserved areas in Uganda
2) To promote disease prevention via education and active intervention
3) To educate and train local healthcare professionals and encourage them to continue independently of Mercy Trips 


Impact
Most of the people we serve have no other source of healthcare. Our impact is twofold: we treat the diseases but also focus heavily on their prevention. The surgical team provides general and gynecologic procedures including major neck, abdominal and pelvic surgeries as well as numerous hernia repairs and other minor procedures to people who would otherwise go untreated. A simple hernia repair can allow a father to return to his work and keep his family fed. Basic health exams, vaccinations, de-worming of children, mosquito net distribution as well as urgent treatment of malaria, typhoid, respiratory infections and other tropical illnesses are carried out in our village outreach sites.

-Get the word out! Please share our campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, and any other social media platforms. Tell others about us so that we can provide even more care.

story:
Hi my name is Kristy Lockhart and I work in a retirement home as a cook. My best friend has been diagnosed with Lyme Disease and I wish to do everything I can to help her. This is a desperate plea to everybody to please help me financially get her the treatment she requires in the U.S.A. In Canada testing and treatment are not available. The majority of people with Lyme disease are misdiagnosed for years and by the time it is discovered it is almost too late.
The very first visit to the USA that day cost me $1500. Thanks to YOU and your generous donations I was able to provide this for Heather. Monthly treatment (not including her antibiotics) suggested from the lyme doctor is hundreds of dollars on potent specialized probiotics that have to be special ordered, certain vitamins and minerals, supplements as we as a very strict NO yeast/gluten/wheat/yeast/sugar diet. One teaspoon of sugar/honey/sweetner/etc can suppress Heather's immune system for 6 hours.

4 years ago she had a gym membership, walked 5 miles a day, hiked, spent time in nature, and constantly doing photo shoots. Now, she can't walk more than 20 minutes, has to ride a handicap bus, has difficulty breathing, chest pains, migraines, her joints swell up so bad she can't write or type, difficulty folding laundry, doing dishes and playing with her cat. Something in her body is malfunctioning as her entire body is covered in edema and this year she had to go on heart medication as this disease is affecting her heart now.

This woman means everything to me.  I can't put into words how much I love her. She is an amazing artist/photographer (www.redbubble.com/people/locustgirl) and a genuine pure soul and there's nothing I won't do for her. Meeting someone like this only happens once in a lifetime, and I fear her lifetime will be over soon if her medical treatment is unable to continue.

Donating to this compaign will ensure proper medical care and treatment and lodging while undergoing this care. It doesn't matter if it's $1 or $1000 every little bit helps. Even if you have no $ to donate, please will you post this on various social networking tools to spread the word?

Even while ill, both she and I helped out with other fundraisers (Rideau Valley Wildlife Sanctuary) by donating hundreds of dollars worth of her art to be sold to help treat injured wildlife. She went to college to learn how to take care of the disabled, now she is disabled.

She left home at 15 and she has no blood relatives who can help her, and she hasn't worked for the last 2 years due to being so ill. I am a single woman and the ONLY person who has been helping her for years, please can you help me help her.
There is a serious gap in Canada for testing and treatment of this horrible disease. Recently Elizabeth May (MP) introduced a new bill into parliament detailing how this disease should be dealt with.  This is good for the future, but my friend needs help IMMEDIATELY.
My best friend, Heather, has seen 50 doctors in the last 4 years (including 3 neurosurgeons, infectious disease doctors, rheumetologists, dermotologists, neurologists) which she was left with no definitive answers as to the root cause of all her symptoms, until now. Lyme disease, if not detected in the early stages becomes chronic lyme and ends up attacking the heart, kidneys and liver.
 
We are givers and this is very hard to ask for help. To prove this, for certain denominations I will print and mail to you your choices from Heather's photography gallery. If you love wildlife and nature or creative works combining the beautiful female form with nature, you are sure to love Heather King's artwork. Side note: there are some pieces on her site which have a filter on them. Please know that nothing was done for shock value. Heather did darker work in her past as a release from brutal physical and sexual abuse.
Please do not place an order through RedBubble as you will be charged for the prints and you have already generously donated to this campaign. Please use Redbubble as a gallery and email me directly what prints you would like.  Any questions or for a list of the prints you would like, please email me here lockhart_ottawa@hotmail.com
 

I promise you if you were to meet Heather you would love her almost as much as I do.  I have never met another soul with such an enormous loving heart as hers.
Please helps us
love
Kristy

story:
The Plan!

Hi! My name is Dave Weale. I'm a success coach, ski coach, and personal trainer. Basically I spend my life helping people make theirs better :)

In partnership with Whistler Community Services Society (http://www.mywcss.org) and Comor Sports Whistler (http://www.comorsports.com) we plan to expand WCSS's existing Summer Camp Fund program. The program currently helps send kids to summer camp that wouldn't otherwise get to go. Our goal is to expand it to a year round program to help kids with sports related goals (camps, coaching, traveling to contests,etc)

On October 1st, I will begin cycling over 3000 km from Whistler, BC to Twentynine palms, California to help youths from financially restricted families in Whistler. Along the way I will be blogging (written and video), and shooting lots of photos. These will be posted on my personal website: http://www.daveweale.com and in the updates section of this campaign.

With your help, we can help countless kids realize their sports dreams, which in turn will spread tons smiles, help boost self confidence, and improve as many lives as we can :)

For contributors wishing to receive tax receipts, donations can also be made directly to the Whistler Community Services Society at http://www.mywcss.org/pages/donate


What We Need & What You Get


  • Our goal is to raise at least $25,000
  • After possible expenses of up to $3000, that $25,000 combined with the existing $2000 in the fund currently will make $24,000.
  • This $24000 will start the program off with enough funds for the first 2 years. The fund will make available $1000 per month to be used for helping financially restricted youths in Whistler be able to pursue their sports dreams!
  • Specifically, this will be used to pay for equipment, coaching, competition fees, travel expenses, etc.
  • Even if we don't reach our full goal with this campaign, we will continue fundraising and doing additional campaigns and events until we get there!
  • We are already planning a series of public speaking events at schools in the Sea-to-sky corridor for when Dave returns home after the adventure!


The Impact


  • During my 10+ years coaching competitive freeskiing, I have seen over and over again, kids with the talent, desire, and passion to succeed, but without the financial backing from their family to realize their dreams.
  • This program will help kids pursue their sports dreams that wouldn't be able to otherwise.
  • Being able to pursue their dreams will build self confidence, improve goal setting skills, and generally improve happiness of the kids we help.
  • This program is an extension of WCSS's Summer Camp fund, which was started in 2009 by Dave and has since helped 50+ kids attend summer camp that wouldn't have otherwise been able to.


Other Ways You Can Help


Just because you can’t contribute, doesn’t mean you can’t help!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
  • Use the share tools and share on your facebook, twitter, etc and help as many people as possible find out about this to help us reach out goal!

story:
We all want to be healthy. The best way is with better food and lifestyle choices. But, what are the right choices? Paduin knows.

Paduin gets to know you. Then, bit by bit, it changes your eating and lifestyle habits. It's a coach in your phone.

Press for Paduin

  • Telegraph Journal (New Brunswick, Canada): Healthcare startup looks to crowdfunding (also here)
  • Startup Kitchen (Atlantic Canada): Interview with the CEO of Paduin
  • Here Magazine (New Brunswick, Canada): Magazine on 14 November 2013
  • StartupDigest Health Reading List: Newsletter on 22 November 2013

About Robin

Hello! I'm Robin. I'm a software developer. I have spent my career making complex software for big companies. Now, I want to make something that will help people.

I could not find an app that would help me get lean and healthy. Instead, I looked for an app for treating chronic diseases like obesity, diabetes, heart disease, or dementia. That’s because the best known treatments for those diseases are with nutrition and lifestyle habits. But, there were no apps delivering those treatments.

That's why I formed a team, incorporated our company, and began making Paduin.

About Paduin

Paduin is a way to get lean and healthy. It is also a way to treat obesity, type 2 diabetes, heart disease, and certain other chronic diseases.

Paduin delivers personalized nutrition and lifestyle habits. It's a nutrition and lifestyle coach in your smartphone.

How To Help

Purchase a perk, at right, and send a message that there is demand for a way to use food to improve health!

We are only offering perks that we know we can deliver. So, you are guaranteed to get what you pay for.

Funds will be used:

  • To pay for graphic design required for the smartphone app.
  • To test Paduin with its first users.
  • To help us learn which features are most needed for users to succeed.
  • To reach more people to tell them how Paduin can help them.
  • To support the software development of version 1.
  • To pay for server costs.
  • To pay the other costs associated with the perks, like the hardware.

The Impact

Support Paduin's bigger cause! Direct health care costs for the chronic diseases that have their root causes in nutrition and lifestyle choices exceed $1 billion per day in the U.S. alone.

Paduin provides a low cost solution to what is already more than a trillion dollar yearly cost, worldwide. The potential reduction in human suffering by itself justifies massive investments in Paduin, and there is also a huge potential reduction in health care costs.

Using technology to achieve a significant reduction in chronic diseases of civilization is an idea whose time has come.

Buy a perk, at right, and support this cause!

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you just can't contribute. That doesn't mean that you can't help. Tell others about us! Get the word out. Use the links above to share with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, and email!

The Perks

Here are descriptions of all of the perks available at right.

Paduin Early Access

With this perk, you get access to Paduin version 1 as soon as it is released, on 1 February 2014. Features include:

  • Accessible via the web, iPhone, and other mobile devices
  • A personalized nutrition plan, with food preferences learned by your answers to simple yes-or-no choices
  • Detailed recipes that tell you how to prepare your food
  • Grocery lists automatically provided for you
  • Reminders for eating, food prep chores, grocery shopping
  • Photos to help you understand how to prepare food
  • ... and you never have to type in what you eat or log your food!

See our blog to learn about all planned features.

Recipe Named After You

The Paduin team designs recipes carefully. All recipes can be seen and selected by any Paduin user. With this perk, we will name one of our recipes after you! We can use your name, or that of anyone (or anything) that you choose.

iPod touch 64 GB

This perk comes with a brand new iPod touch 64 GB, but is available only in Canada. The iPod will ship to you before Christmas 2013, with the associated Paduin perks arriving on 1 February, 2014. This perk is great for those who do not now have a smartphone, but who have wireless Internet access.

Assignable User Licenses

This perk is part of clinic packages for those who are helping others with their nutrition and lifestyle habits. An assignable user license is a license for Paduin that can be given to someone else, such as by a physician to a patient.

Pay Per Pound!

With this perk, it costs $19 to enter the pay-per-pound program. Once entered, you only pay $10 for every pound that you lose with Paduin. Didn't lose any weight? Don't pay.

Paduin will ask you your weight as part of its normal operation. (Your food requirements are related to your body weight.) We use the honour system, and expect you to tell the truth. In each month, if you lose weight, you will be billed $10 for every pound lost. If you do not lose weight in a given month, you do not have to pay for that month.

Corporate Sponsorship Package - Gold

You want to augment and strengthen your brand? Support healthy eating, and drive healthy eaters to your site! This package includes: in-app clickable logo display, and 500 guaranteed click-throughs to a (web) landing page of your choice.

Corporate Sponsorship Package - Platinum

Massively strengthen your brand by supporting healthy eating and driving healthy eaters to your site! This package includes the sponsorship position on our app's splash page! Also, we will develop video marketing materials for your business. This package includes: your clickable logo on the Paduin app's splash page, 20,000 guaranteed click-throughs to a (web) landing page of your choice, and three 5-minute videos made by our filmmaker to augment your online marketing. We will also provide professional advice on how to better your online presence.

story:
mushtube.com reloaded/#watchlikegive 2013

 

mushtube.com originated in 2009 as an idea for softball teams to be able to post videos, pictures, etc. something similar to youtube. 2009 was also the inaugural tournament softball season.

after a rough 1stseason, 2010 proved to be a much better year. with mushtube placing 2ndin both states and nationals and just missing winning a ring in colorado, placing 3rd at worlds. mushtube’s 2010 record was an astonishing 74 –23, while being ranked #1 in the nation in usssa class e.

after a couple seasons to regroup, mustube is back. bringing back former players such as jason “uncle mvp” martin, caleb davidson, mark stoziak, eric m sear, bobby greene and jason brender. while adding several pieces from ohio, mushtube.comreloaded/#watchlikegive looks to bring home their first of many world championship rings…….

we have added other great talent such as james “itchy” boren, ben rogowski, rex groll, brian shafer, danny michaels, dave dedonatis, eric and rick shiple, shane “bird” de’joonier, ryan kottke, and corey kuskowski.

we are traveling the country for tournaments in our quest to win 1 or more usssa world tournaments. travel destinations include columbus, ohio; las vegas, nevada; long island, new york; sylvania, ohio; detroit, michigan and cincinnati, ohio.

we are thinking outside the box as far as fundraising as many teams every year do poker tournaments, bowling fundraisers, and other specialty drawings. with the perks we are offering helping us fundraise, everyone walks away a winner.

please find it in your heart to help support us in a successful season.

mushtube.com originated in 2009 as an idea for softball teams to be able to post videos, pictures, etc. something similar to youtube. 2009 was also the inaugural tournament softball season.
after a rough 1stseason, 2010 proved to be a much better year. with mushtube placing 2ndin both states and nationals and just missing winning a ring in colorado, placing 3rd at worlds. mushtube’s 2010 record was an astonishing 74 –23, while being ranked #1 in the nation in usssa class e.
after a couple seasons to regroup, mustube is back. bringing back former players such as jason “uncle mvp” martin, caleb davidson, mark stoziak, eric m sear, bobby greene and jason brender. while adding several pieces from ohio, mushtube.comreloaded/#watchlikegive looks to bring home their first of many world championship rings…….
we have added other great talent such as james “itchy” boren, ben rogowski, rex groll, brian shafer, danny michaels, dave dedonatis, eric and rick shiple, shane “bird” de’joonier, ryan kottke, and corey kuskowski.
we are traveling the country for tournaments in our quest to win 1 or more usssa world tournaments. travel destinations include columbus, ohio; las vegas, nevada; long island, new york; sylvania, ohio; detroit, michigan and cincinnati, ohio.
we are thinking outside the box as far as fundraising as many teams every year do poker tournaments, bowling fundraisers, and other specialty drawings. with the perks we are offering helping us fundraise, everyone walks away a winner.
please find it in your heart to help support us in a successful season.

story:
Pledge to my 5K run for Camp Ronald McDonald & I will match all donations up to $250!

Me and my co-counselor (wifey) Wedge with our girls from cabin 12! (I'm that total goober on the right)

FAQ's (Ficticiously Asked Questions)

••Who are you, what is this website, and why am I here?••

• My name is Rachel Yonda and I like to run! Sometimes, I like to run to raise money for a good cause. Why, you ask? Why NOT?! I created this page solo, but the actual campaign/donation will be a group effort, accomplished by all those who choose to participate by donating.

• I'm running a 5k this November in honor of Camp Ronald McDonald for Good Times. This summer I had the opportunity to volunteer there as a counselor. I am very grateful for the profound impact it had on my life & would like to give back. Every dollar rasied via this campaign page will be donated straight to Camp Ronald McDonald!!

• You might say, "Well, that's great but if they have people volunteering and everyone's having a good time then they don't need anything from me!"

I'll steal some words from one of the greatest counselors on the mountain & answer that with a big "Nay, nay, my friend!" This camp is a non-profit and while volunteering our time is priceless, let's face it- when the camp needs hiking gear, bunk beds, medical supplies, chocolate milk? That calls for some ca$hmoney! 

••OK how much money do you want? A million dollars? Cause I don't have a million dollars!••

Every little bit helps! You don't spread much awareness with just a few large donations, but you spread major awaresness with *lots* of little donations! The point is to get as many people involved as possible. How about 5 bucks ($1 per Kilometer)? Since I'll match every buck up to $250, we could easily get $500 together! 

••But you are only running 5k. That's wimpy baby stuff. I only pledge to people running super-ultra-megadeath-marathons!••

I have other races to run this year and the 5K is indeed the shortest one. Actually, it's my first 5K (I've never run anything shorter than 10K). But, this event is the most appropriate to the cause. You'll see why in the next question.

••I WANT PROOF you ran this 5K. When/where is it so I can hide in the bushes with binoculars and confirm your participation?••

The 5K I am running is The Color Run 5K, taking place in San Diego on Saturday November 3rd, 2012. I'll sporting the CRMFGT T-Shirt. Out of all the races I'm running this year I figured this would be the best one to raise money for camp because

•1• there are lots of families participating and everyone gets covered in rainbow colors during the race which is crazy fun

•2• there will be LOTS of photos taken, and I will be making a fool out of myself to make sure the CRMFGT logo on my shirt gets in as many pictures as possible! Raising awareness FTW!

••So, how awesome is Camp Ronald McDonald, exactly?••

Very. VERY AWESOME. But you don't have to take my word for it...watch the video above, filmed by a fellow counselor- the talented Josh Hoa Pham.
