story:
OUR STORY

 

The Share Your Voice Foundation's mission is simple.  We believe strongly in the transformative power of the arts to change lives and are dedicated to helping young people (primarily underprivileged teens in rural areas ages 13-17) transform their lives through powerful arts-based programs like the Empowerment through Performance (ETP) Workshop program. 

 

Thank you for watching our video (feel free to check out others on our vimeo page). It's been a remarkable journey thus far and we're so proud to still be going strong - changing the lives of a special group of young people each year, one summer at a time. 

 

SYVF serves these teens regardless of race, religion, creed, sex or socio-economic status.  We are committed to making a difference through the tremendous power of the arts by helping them find and share their voice to promote positive difference.

 

We ask for your support in making this vision come true in 2012.  It will not happen without your contribution. The workshop is being held July 16-20 with the final performance night for the community, 'Night at the Landing' being held at beautiful Stillwater Landing, 15 miles from Whitefish in Northwest Montana on Saturday, July 21.

 

Funds raised on IndieGoGo ensure we can run the 2012 workshop and also contribute to recording the song the participants write with a singer-songwriter during the workshop. 

 

SYVF is a qualified 501(c)3 nonprofit association so all donations are tax-deductible.

 

 

 

THE IMPACT

 

We're very proud and excited that this will be our 6th year of providing the workshop to young people. This is due to the commitment and generosity of individuals, local organizations, returning graduates, talented guest educators, assistants and volunteers in Montana.

 

SYVF has already helped over 100 young participants develop higher self-esteem, contribute to their community and become the best they can be. They have graduated from high school, gone on to be awarded college scholarships to Princeton, degrees at MSU, joined and performed in other community theatre groups, and generally succeed living their lives with a greater sense of happiness and solid self-concept. Many choose to return the following year as volunteers to champion the next group of participants.

 

Through the unique mesh of the creative fields of writing, performance, music and film, participants from SYVF's summer outreach program are encouraged to unleash their creativity in a safe environment while improving self-esteem and developing strong, effective communication skills. They are guided to discover their own innate talents, cultivate a sense of pride and appreciate the importance of collaborating with others.

 

 

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

 

To run the workshop a lot of careful preparation, team effort, commitment, skilled guest educators, dedicated volunteers and local support is required. It is made possible entirely through community and individual philanthropy. 

 

Your generous contribution to this IndieGogo campaign will enable us to ensure that each participant is given a full scholarship to attend the program and enjoy the benefits of a safe venue, access to talented guest educators, adequate supplies, qualified care and meals during the workshop plus help make the experience of recording a music track in a professional recording studio a reality. Watch the clip from a previous year for the beautiful song, Love Is The Bridge To Peace.

 

Our donors are offered a number of benefits for sponsorship, from VIP access to the gala event night, t-shirts, recognition in media and photo opportunities with the graduates. Read the perks and get involved!

 

 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

 

PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD!  You can make a huge difference by involving others.  Please tell all your friends and family about our IndieGoGo campaign and share the donation page link on facebook, google, twitter and via email. This really helps us get the word out - the more hits - the higher our profile.

 

BECOME A VOLUNTEER!  If you are located in the Flathead Valley in Northwest Montana, consider volunteering during the 5-day workshop, or helping out on the final performance night. We need all the help we can get to make the experience the best it can be for our young participants and it's a great way to meet other creative, service-minded folk and members of the community. Contact us via our website.

 

DONATE ITEMS!  If you live elsewhere but have access to 'goods and services' or wish to donate in this way, please consider donating to the 2012 workshop.

 

With 25 participants involved in the workshop we need:  25 CARRY BAGS, 25 WATER BOTTLES, 25 PENS, 25 MARKERS, 25 HIGHLIGHTER PENS, 25 NOTEBOOKS & BLANK CDS/DVDs.

 

Thanks for any help and donations you can make ~ Time to Shine!

 

Share Your Voice Foundation:  Helping Teens Empower Themselves Through The Arts

story:
Hi, my name is Aida. I am the mother of Frederick. Frederick was recentrly diagnosed with two forms of cancer (kidney and liver cancers). We are seeking help in paying for his medical bills.

Frederick is a good man who has gone through tremendous struggles in his life but has never given up hope. At a young age he was physically, emotionally, and sexually abused. At 15 Frederick was then gang raped. Despite all of his adversities he never became bitter or angry. He is a generous man who even adopted an abandoned child which he continues to raise even through his illness. Frederick has also been active as a coordinator and speaker with Alcoholics Anonymous. He has been sober for over 10 years and works to help others with substance abuse.

Frederick has had a very challenging life and now he is faced with a new challenge. Through all his challenges Frederick has never given up and have always remained positive. Please help in any way you can!!!

 

THE CAMPAIGN: 

Frederick is battling two forms of cancer. He was diagnosed with Renal cell carcinoma ( stage 2) in November 2011. In order to save his life, he had surgery to stop the bleeding only to find out the same cancer reoccurred after 5 months. In August 2012, Frederick went under the knife again to remove the kidney cancer but this time, his doctor discovered that the cancer had now spread to his liver.  The doctors removed the tumor from the liver also and started aggressive chemo and kidney dialysis. He now receives 4 dialysis per week , 3 chemo therapy per week and takes numerous antibiotics and medications to prevent from further spread to the other organs.. His body is convulsing from this illness everyday. His will to live is what gives him the power to wake up every morning. His days are spent from 8 AM to 2PM in getting this treatments. His faith is what keeps him alive and hopeful.  He has NO insurance and depends on help from friends and family but that too is beginning to phase out. Their resources has been exhausted. This is coming to halt almost immediately. You are his last resort. 

Please allow Frederick to live... give him the the gift of life. He says if God will extend his life, he will spend his remaining days continuing to do God's work by helping substance abuse victims and spending quality time with his son.

THE REQUEST: 

Donate what you can ... $5, $10, $50, $100 or more. Every donation counts. Your donation will fund for all the treatments that he needs to continue to battle this life threatening disease and prolong his life. 

 YOUR DONATION:

Your donation how little or how large will be used almost immediately to finance his chemo and dialysis and medications. He has no money and living from hands to mouth. Sometimes, he skips days without dialysis and chemo. This action is dangerous as his cancers will advance to next stage and his kidney may fail and the result can be fatal. 

SPREAD THE WORD OUT:

We realize that not everybody can help, you can in other way. Please spread the word to your friends, colleagues, family who will be part of this "Save Frederick's life " campaign . We will appreciate it. 

A gift of life is priceless. We will be forever gratetful to you for your kindness and generosity. 

THANK YOU FROM OUR HEART!

 

Ian - Frederick's Adopted Son

story:
WHAT IS GBM?

Glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) is the most common, aggressive, and lethal adult brain cancer, and is currently largely untreatable. This terrible disease, which affects 75,000 new patients worldwide each year (and took the life of the late Senator Edward Kennedy) is almost 100% fatal within 2 years of diagnosis, and many patients do not survive beyond 6 months from diagnosis.  GBM is the 3rd leading cause of cancer death among those 20-29 years in age.

WHAT TREATMENT IS AVAILABLE?

At present, the only approved drug for treating newly-diagnosed GBM is a chemotherapeutic that creates DNA damage leading to cancer cell death. Unfortunately, the benefit of this drug is short-lived, because DNA damage repair mechanisms -- that are overactive in GBM cells -- undue and repair the damage created by the drug.  Despite this, nearly all patients continue to receive this chemotherapeutic by default.  We need to move away for the current one-drug-fits-all approach, to a modern approach of tailoring treatment options to a particular patient's tumor ("personalized medicine").

HOW CAN WE IMPROVE THE ODDS?

There is a pressing, unmet need for better diagnostic tests to help identify and predict which GBM patients may most benefit from alternative therapy options, including combination therapy with chemotherapeutic plus DNA damage repair inhibition, and highly targeted inhibitors in clinical trials for GBM.  Such tests will help  bring personalized medicince to the underserved GBM patient population.

OUR MISSION

PARADIGM ONCOLOGY (Danvers, MA) is a start-up cancer diagnostics company dedicated to Bringing the Promise of Personalized Medicine to GBM patients. We are developing a first-in-class and first-in-kind, GBM-specific tumor-profiling test to help inform treatment options and decision-making for GBM patients and their treating neuro-oncologists. Our predictive diagnostic test is based, in part, on a pair of novel biomarkers that we have exclusively licensed. It will be offered to patients and their physicians at the time of GBM diagnosis and prior to chemotherapy in order to provide valuable information about the molecular mechanisms of each patient's particular tumor as early as possible, to help guide subsequent patient care. Our experienced leadership team is complemented by a world-class advisory board, including some of the most respected GBM experts working at the forefront of GBM tumor biology and therapy.

OUR TEAM

Our experienced leadership team is complimented by a world-class advisory board, including some of the most respected GBM experts at the forefront of our understanding of GBM tumor biology and therapy.  We are all committed to improving GBM patient care and treatment by developing predictive diagnostics to help usher in a personalized approach to this terrible disease.

HOW CAN I HELP?

PARADIGM ONCOLOGY intends, with your generous support, to develop our predictive diagnostic test for GBM patients to offer them hope, improved choices, and therapy options. Your donations will be used to buy the initial equipment and materials, and support the research staff, that we require to start building our GBM predictive diagnostic test.  Our test will help usher in a more personalized approach to the treatment of these patients.

story:
Camp CATAWAMPUS

  

Just a few years ago, four strangers, all of them new to the scene, arrived at Lakes of Fire (a regional Burning Man event).  Each of them expected to have a good time, what they didn’t expect was to have their lives changed.  Over the course of a few days, these four strangers bonded for life with a new understanding of self, community and love.  For the first time in a long time, they allowed themselves to become the real them and wanted to share this with everyone!   A few months later, the small group had grown to 20 strong. 

Today, we’re at 83 members; we are creative, we are doers, we are BURNERS! 

We practice the 10 Guiding Principles of a Burner:

  • Radical Inclusion – Anyone can be a part of CATAWAMPUS.   We welcome the stranger.  No perquisites exist for participation in our community.
  • Gifting – CATAWAMPUS is devoted to acts of gift giving. The value of a gift is unconditional. Gifting does not contemplate a return or an exchange for something of equal value.
  • Decommodification – In order to preserve the spirit of gifting, our community seeks to create social environments that are unmediated by commercial sponsorships, transactions, or advertising.  We stand ready to protect our culture from such exploitation. We resist the substitution of consumption for participatory experience.
  • Radical Self-reliance – CATAWAMPUS encourages the individual to discover, exercise and rely on his or her inner resources.
  • Radical Self-expression – Radical self-expression arises from the unique gifts of the individual. No one other than the individual or a collaborating group can determine its content. It is offered as a gift to others.  In this spirit, the giver should respect the rights and liberties of the recipient.
  • Communal Effort - CATAWAMPUS values creative cooperation and collaboration.  We strive to produce, promote and protect social networks, public spaces, works of art, and methods of communication that support such interaction.
  • Civic Responsibility – We value civil society. Catawampi who organize events assume responsibility for public welfare and endeavor to communicate civic responsibilities to participants.  They must also assume responsibility for conducting events in accordance with local, state and federal laws.
  • Leaving No Trace – CATAWAMPUS respects the environment. We are committed to leaving no physical trace of our activities wherever we gather.  We clean up after ourselves and endeavor, whenever possible, to leave such places in a better state than when we found them.
  • Participation – CATAWAMPUS is committed to a radically participatory ethic. We believe that transformative change, whether in the individual or in society, can occur only through the medium of deeply personal participation. We achieve being through doing.  Everyone is invited to work.  Everyone is invited to play.  We make the world real through actions that open the heart.
  • Immediacy – Immediate experience is, in many ways, the most important touchstone of value in our culture. We seek to overcome barriers that stand between us and a recognition of our inner selves, the reality of those around us, participation in society, and contact with a natural world exceeding human powers.  No idea can substitute for this experience.

What We Need

One of the main goals for CATAWAMPUS is enlightening others to the Burner lifestyle.  We do this by make life-changing experiences available to as many people as possible for as cheaply as possible.  A cornerstone in helping to make this happen is using our bus for transportation!  That’s where you come in; we need you!

We’re now on bus II (bus I met an untimely demise).  Bus II, the sequel, needs some major work in order to get it ready to meet the needs of group. We have two areas where we must focus:

  1. Repairs – We recently took the bus in for a DOT inspection.  The following issues were found.
    1. Tie Rod ends must be replaced (Completed).
    2. Wheel Seals must be replaced.
    3. Pinion Seal and Gear Oil must be replaced.
    4. Axle Pins, Shackles and Hangers must be replaced.
    5. Torque Leaf Pins and Bushings must be replaced.
    6. Requires transmission and engine check (due to seepage).
    7. Possible transmission work needed (determined by #f)
  2. Construction – In order to meet Michigan (and other states) standards (for retitling, allowing regular Driver License holders to drive), we must add the following.
    1. A food preparation area.  This involves plumbing for fresh and gray water, cooking/heating source and refrigeration.
    2. A restroom area.  This also involves construction and plumbing.
    3. Independent electrical / heating system.  Uhhhh… this involves a lot (including installation of a second alternator)! 

We currently estimate all repairs and construction needs to be approximately $11,000.00 (ouch!!)

What Your Help Means

       

Our group is amazing!!!  It may be that you’ve participated with us before or perhaps you will in the future but, either way, you’ll find that we are open, real and caring.  We care about our community and the individuals around us.  Helping us to reach our goal is one of many ways to support your community and make impacting changes in the lives of others!

Other Ways You Can Help

     

Maybe you’re not presently financially able to help us with monetary support.  No problem.  Here are a few additional ways to support us.

  1. SHARE – Share about us on every social media possible and make a recommendation to ALL of your friends.
  2. JOIN – Join us at one of our many workdays or fundraising events.
  3. GIVE – Do you have any construction materials around that are in good shape, but are no longer needed?  We could probably use them!!!

Thank you so much for your time, effort and belief!!  We love you!
story_txt:
Camp CATAWAMPUS

   

Just a few years ago, four strangers, all of them new to the scene, arrived at Lakes of Fire (a regional Burning Man event).  Each of them expected to have a good time, what they didn’t expect was to have their lives changed.  Over the course of a few days, these four strangers bonded for life with a new understanding of self, community and love.  For the first time in a long time, they allowed themselves to become the real them and wanted to share this with everyone!   A few months later, the small group had grown to 20 strong. 
Today, we’re at 83 members; we are creative, we are doers, we are BURNERS! 
We practice the 10 Guiding Principles of a Burner:


Radical Inclusion – Anyone can be a part of CATAWAMPUS.   We welcome the stranger.  No perquisites exist for participation in our community.

Gifting – CATAWAMPUS is devoted to acts of gift giving. The value of a gift is unconditional. Gifting does not contemplate a return or an exchange for something of equal value.

Decommodification – In order to preserve the spirit of gifting, our community seeks to create social environments that are unmediated by commercial sponsorships, transactions, or advertising.  We stand ready to protect our culture from such exploitation. We resist the substitution of consumption for participatory experience.

Radical Self-reliance – CATAWAMPUS encourages the individual to discover, exercise and rely on his or her inner resources.

Radical Self-expression – Radical self-expression arises from the unique gifts of the individual. No one other than the individual or a collaborating group can determine its content. It is offered as a gift to others.  In this spirit, the giver should respect the rights and liberties of the recipient.

Communal Effort - CATAWAMPUS values creative cooperation and collaboration.  We strive to produce, promote and protect social networks, public spaces, works of art, and methods of communication that support such interaction.

Civic Responsibility – We value civil society. Catawampi who organize events assume responsibility for public welfare and endeavor to communicate civic responsibilities to participants.  They must also assume responsibility for conducting events in accordance with local, state and federal laws.

Leaving No Trace – CATAWAMPUS respects the environment. We are committed to leaving no physical trace of our activities wherever we gather.  We clean up after ourselves and endeavor, whenever possible, to leave such places in a better state than when we found them.

Participation – CATAWAMPUS is committed to a radically participatory ethic. We believe that transformative change, whether in the individual or in society, can occur only through the medium of deeply personal participation. We achieve being through doing.  Everyone is invited to work.  Everyone is invited to play.  We make the world real through actions that open the heart.

Immediacy – Immediate experience is, in many ways, the most important touchstone of value in our culture. We seek to overcome barriers that stand between us and a recognition of our inner selves, the reality of those around us, participation in society, and contact with a natural world exceeding human powers.  No idea can substitute for this experience.
What We Need



One of the main goals for CATAWAMPUS is enlightening others to the Burner lifestyle.  We do this by make life-changing experiences available to as many people as possible for as cheaply as possible.  A cornerstone in helping to make this happen is using our bus for transportation!  That’s where you come in; we need you!

We’re now on bus II (bus I met an untimely demise).  Bus II, the sequel, needs some major work in order to get it ready to meet the needs of group. We have two areas where we must focus:

Repairs – We recently took the bus in for a DOT inspection.  The following issues were found.
Tie Rod ends must be replaced (Completed).
Wheel Seals must be replaced.
Pinion Seal and Gear Oil must be replaced.
Axle Pins, Shackles and Hangers must be replaced.
Torque Leaf Pins and Bushings must be replaced.
Requires transmission and engine check (due to seepage).
Possible transmission work needed (determined by #f)


Construction – In order to meet Michigan (and other states) standards (for retitling, allowing regular Driver License holders to drive), we must add the following.
A food preparation area.  This involves plumbing for fresh and gray water, cooking/heating source and refrigeration.
A restroom area.  This also involves construction and plumbing.
Independent electrical / heating system.  Uhhhh… this involves a lot (including installation of a second alternator)! 



We currently estimate all repairs and construction needs to be approximately $11,000.00 (ouch!!)


What Your Help Means

        

Our group is amazing!!!  It may be that you’ve participated with us before or perhaps you will in the future but, either way, you’ll find that we are open, real and caring.  We care about our community and the individuals around us.  Helping us to reach our goal is one of many ways to support your community and make impacting changes in the lives of others!
Other Ways You Can Help

      

Maybe you’re not presently financially able to help us with monetary support.  No problem.  Here are a few additional ways to support us.

SHARE – Share about us on every social media possible and make a recommendation to ALL of your friends.
JOIN – Join us at one of our many workdays or fundraising events.
GIVE – Do you have any construction materials around that are in good shape, but are no longer needed?  We could probably use them!!!

Thank you so much for your time, effort and belief!!  We love you!

story:
Water to the People

 

People across the globe die every day, because they don't have any clean water to drink. We believe that water should be in the hands of the communities and not owned by big corporations and sold back to the local people in plastic bottles.

We are a group of children between 11 and 14 living in Berlin. We visit the ESBZ, a school where a lot of what we do we learn through projects, through cooperation, rather than a teacher at the front of the class, telling us what we need to know.

Just now the theme is "Water". The projects can deal with any aspect of water. But we in our group decided to dedicate our time to help bring water to some of the poorest people in the world and raise the money to build a well in a place were people have no clean water.

Our well will be build with the help of a charity that helps communities in Brazil. They are called Projekte für arme Menschen e.V. (Projects for poor people).

                                http://www.armemenschen.de

Depending on the ground where the well is build we will need between 800 and 1500 $. So we are aiming for 1500 $, if the well costs less, the rest will go to other projects in the same community.

Please help us achieve our goal. If you don't have a lot, make it one dollar or tell your friends about our campaign. (benjamin.dikmans@gmail.com)

 

                     Thank you for your support.

story:
My Story

Akwaaba Family, Friends and Supporters!!!!!


Thank you for taking time to stop by and find out more about my field work experience in Ghana. I sincerely appreciate the love. 


I will be interning for the Planned Parenthood Association of Ghana (PPAG) in Cape Coast from January - May 2012. I am excited for this opportunity, as it encompasses many things that I am passionate about: sexual and reproductive health; activism; community outreach; and education. I believe the cultural experience that I am about to embark on will be life changing. 


My duties as an intern will include involvement in daily sexual and reproductive health counseling and treatment, as well as participation in sexual and reproductive health education and training programs for local communities and villages in the cape coast region. These duties are an opportunity to exercise the skills that I have acquired while studying community health, allowing me to advance and showcase my abilities as an aspiring health professional. Additionally, I have no doubt the exposure to the rich cultures of Ghana will contribute to my personal growth.

 

I will be posting in my blog while in Ghana and during the months prior to my departure, so that I can share my experience with you from beginning to end. I welcome and encourage your comments, questions, and words of support throughout this momentous time in my life. 

 

This blog can be found at http://missbehavinbad.blogspot.com/

The Impact

As mentioned before, this fieldwork experience with the Planned Parenthood Association of Ghana is an exceptional opportunity to further my ability as an aspiring public health professional. I believe this is my chance to completely immerse myself in the field of sexual and reproductive health, while serving an international agency, and becoming a more diverse individual. I intend to take advantage of this opportunity by contributing to the PPAG's aim of improving the quality of life of Ghanaians by improving their sexual and reproductive health.

 

What I Am Asking For

Currently, I am in the stages of addressing the logistics of this experience and it is an exciting yet stressful process because it draws me nearer to Ghana. As you can imagine, this opportunity is going to be quite costly. 


As an unpaid internship, I will receive academic credit that is required for the completion of my undergraduate degree. However, I am responsible for airfare, immunizations, securing a visa, travel insurance, and a program fee that covers my lodging, food (breakfast and dinner), and local transportation. As a non-governmental organization in a developing nation, the Planned Parenthood of Ghana relies on resources such as donations and interns, like myself, and therefore cannot support the expenses associated with this experience. 


While I have applied for a scholarship and am working full-time, there is still an economic disparity that I need to address. Below I have listed quotes for some the expenses I am referring to:


  • Program Fees - $2,200 (lodging, food and transportation for 4 months)
  • Airfare - $1684 (direct flights through Delta airlines as of Oct.1)
  • Vaccinations/Medication - $350 (Typhoid,Yellow Fever and Hep A vaccinations, Anti-Malarial medications and travel clinic visit)
  • Visa - $130 (Visas are required for my entry into Ghana and must be renewed after 60 days)


This is why I have turned to you for help. I have setup a PayPal account in which anyone with a debit/credit card or PayPal account can donate to my fieldwork experience fund. If this method is problematic, please do not hesitate to contact me, as other arrangements can be made.


Every contribution will help to alleviate the expenses that I will encounter during my field experience. Not only do I appreciate your donations, but I appreciate your thoughts, prayers, and encouragement while I am abroad.  

 

Can't afford a monetary contribution but still want to help?

  • Tell your friends, coworkers, family, and professors so that they can pass this information on to others 
  • Re-post the link to this website in your Facebook statuses
  • Help me learn 'Twi', by finding a website or another helpful resource
  • Suggest a book that I can read while I'm abroad
  • Share your knowledge about Ghana and it's people in any capacity; this includes food, culture, history, landmarks, cultural/societal norms

story:
What is this about?

We want to send one or more individuals on our inaugural 10-Day Yoga Retreat in India for FREE! To learn more about the Retreat, visit this site: http://TheJourneyofJoy.com.

You can help choose who these individuals are by simply nominating them using this link: http://joyfulbreathyoga.uservoice.com/

Consider this as a "Scholarship" for a Yoga teacher or remarkable individual you know who would be truly transformed by this opportunity and experience.


We Need your Nominations!!

Do you know anyone who would be really touched by a cultural, spiritual, and culinary immersive Yoga Retreat to India this October?

We want to hear their stories! Nominate someone close to you, someone who has touched your heart, or a Yoga instructor / holistic professional who you think would deserve an opportunity like this!

We simply need:

1) Name of the nominee (you can leave this anonymous for now)

2) Short Description (or story) of why you think this remarkable individual should be able to join us on this Retreat! (3-5 sentences please!)

Submit your nomination here: http://joyfulbreathyoga.uservoice.com/

or send it directly to our e-mail here to keep it more private: contact@joyfulbreathyoga.com

This person could be selected to attend a 10-Day Yoga Retreat with all expenses paid!


The "WHY"

Our project is important to us not because it is about Yoga, but because it is about helping people transform, find true joy within so that when they return home to their communities, they can set an example that others can emulate.  As Gandhi said - "Be the change you wish to see in the world".

We believe that when you touch someone's heart and soul, you will forever change their lives and positively impact the world beginning with those around them. It creates a ripple of love that radiates from within and that is the truth we want those who join us on these Retreats to experience for themselves so they can share this with their own communities.

Being a contributor to this project will help us create an unbelievable experience for individuals who otherwise would never have the opportunity at immersing themselves in the the rich culture and community in India. This isn't a simple tour of India… participants have the opportunity for some incredible experiences: washing hands in the holy pristine waters of the Ganges at the foothills of the Himalayas, doing Yoga in Rishikesh (the "birthplace" of Yoga), meditating with Monks at a famous Monastery near the Himalayas, and soaking in the energy under the Bodhi tree where Buddha attained enlightenment. All of this while learning to tune into the senses of their body with the foods they eat in a Mindful Eating exercise, taking control of their Breath with techniques (Pranayama) from a renowned Ayurvedic doctor in India, and recording their innermost thoughts and reflections in a personalized journal handmade from natural banana fibers.

Please, if you know someone who has touched you deeply, has an incredible story, is an inspiring Yoga instructor or holistic healer and you think they would be an incredible candidate for this opportunity, we want you to nominate this person above and we will be selecting a few of these candidates to join us for free on this Retreat to be a part of this life changing experience. :)

What is Joyful Breath Yoga?

Simply, Joyful Breath Yoga is a Virtual Online Yoga studio that empowers teachers around the world to globally share their gifts, passions, and unique practice of Yoga.

When we started the Joyful Breath Yoga project, we envisioned making a huge impact in the communities we serve and the world. Our mission statement includes 'empowering our students to find their inner joy'. We want to live and embody this message, not simply have it as a tagline. :) 

All of us that are part of this project have put our entire heart and soul into this which is why for our inaugural Retreat this year in India we want to give some incredible individuals the opportunity of a lifetime to take a life changing trip to transform their lives physically, mentally and spiritually and use the energy to change the world around them!

Where are funds going?

We feel we need at least $6000 to make this possible for two remarkable people based on these expenses:

  • $1500 per person for flights to India
  • $10/day per person for food, $40/day for transport, $100/day for lodging ($1500 total)
  • So with $6000, we could comfortably afford to take 2 people, but if we get more incredibly inspiring stories, we will use extra funds from paying attendees of the Retreat to offset these costs :)

What can benefactors of this campaign expect?

We are deeply grateful to anyone who decides to contribute even a small amount to this campaign. We will involve all contributors who give at least $10 to this Retreat with a special memorabilia from this experience in art form mailed directly to their home address. This will be a surprise because it involves a special group activity that will be taking place during this Retreat, but we feel it is so special and will be so highly energetic, we want to share this energy with everyone who has decided to contribute even a little to make this experience possible for those need it or who could make the most impact in their communities. 

Along with this special gift, contributors at $25 will receive a special Journey of Joy embroidered handmade journal made of banana fibers.

Contributors at $50 will receive this journal and a special handmade Yoga Bag made from recycled silk material. 

Contributors at $100 will receive this journal and bag along with a special Yoga mat crafted from the fibers of the Jute tree! A completely handcrafted mat designed with each individual in mind and embroidered with your name on it. It will be a limited edition Journey of Joy mat that will keep the memory and impact of this Retreat rooted in your heart and soul forever. 

Contributors at $250 will receive all of the above plus a special, private 1-hour Yoga session with Debra OBryan, founder of the Joyful Breath Yoga project, virtually through our website. Work through any issues you have, focus on any aspect of Yoga you want, and get tips on Mindful Eating based on your lifestyle and blood type.  

Contributors at $500 will get all of the above and exclusive access to participate virtually during many of the group activities LIVE during the Retreat in India! Join us from the comfort of your home while we share your energy at these places in India and fully immerse you in the experience as it is taking place. We will also have these group sessions and workshops recorded for you to view later.

At $2500, you will receive all the above and can send someone specifically who you think would be transformed by this experience on the Retreat.

The Impact

We are attempting to bring individuals who truly deserve a Retreat like this because we believe we can make a deep impact in the hearts of those this project touches and continue to do this for the years to come. When you contribute to this project, you are also investing in the long-term commitment from all of us involved to continue to bring this experience to those who most need it. We see this Retreat empowering:

  • Those in lower socio-economic situations.
  • Individuals who have overcome numerous challenges in life and deserve an experience to brighten their inner light.
  • Yoga instructors who are already creating unbelievable change in their communities but have never had the financial means to visit the birthplace of Yoga and immerse themselves in the culture and traditions of a country which has already touched their hearts. 

The Founder of Joyful Breath Yoga

Debra O'Bryan is a renowned Yoga instructor from the Midwest in Lees Summit, MO. She has been featured on numerous media outlets including NBC, has brought yoga to large school districts and big corporations, and is the official Yoga instructor of the Kansas City Chiefs Football team. Even with such notable accolades, those who know her would tell you they appreciate the heart and soul she brings to her Yoga practice.   Debra takes lessons from her own personal journey to empower others on theirs. She sees the beauty in helping individuals overcome physical obstacles such as being wheelchair bound to fully participate in a flowing Yoga class. The energy behind the Joyful Breath Yoga project originates from Debra's vision and passion in helping people see the world through their own inner light and greatness. 

These Retreats will be an extension of this energy that Debra brings out into the world. 


Watch and hear from Debra on her vision for creating Joyful Breath Yoga:


Help Change the World

If you are unable to monetarily contribute to this project, just nominate someone who can transform their lives or those of others.  We want to impact the lives of people who can truly benefit from the experiences provided by this Retreat. 

  • Contribute a small amount to this project (even $5 will get you a specially delivered art memorabilia from this event that will be highly energetic and handcrafted by attendees!)
  • Nominate someone close to you, a Yoga teacher, or holistic healer who has incredibly impacted your life and would deserve an experience like this! We are truly grateful for those of you who reach out and give us stories of people who would be ideal candidates to bring along on this incredible journey :)
  • Share this with all your friends and family in the hopes that they may know someone who this project can truly help. 
  • If you are deeply inspired by this Retreat and all it stands for, consider joining us as a paying attendee for just $2999 (not including flights)! You can learn more at this link: http://TheJourneyofJoy.com.

Hear from current Joyful Breath Yoga Members!

Listen to the stories of current Joyful Breath Yoga members on how this project has helped change their lives!


And that’s all there is... Please learn more about all of us who collaborate and contribute to this beautiful Joyful Breath Yoga project and make it what it is... more than just a Virtual Yoga Studio online: http://joyfulbreathyoga.com/about-the-creators.

A completely handcrafted mat designed with each individual in mind and embroidered with your name on it. It will be a limited edition Journey of Joy mat that will keep the memory and impact of this Retreat rooted in your heart and soul forever. Contributors at $250 will receive all of the above plus a special, private 1-hour Yoga session with Debra OBryan, founder of the Joyful Breath Yoga project, virtually through our website. Work through any issues you have, focus on any aspect of Yoga you want, and get tips on Mindful Eating based on your lifestyle and blood type.  Contributors at $500 will get all of the above and exclusive access to participate virtually during many of the group activities LIVE during the Retreat in India! Join us from the comfort of your home while we share your energy at these places in India and fully immerse you in the experience as it is taking place. We will also have these group sessions and workshops recorded for you to view later.At $2500, you will receive all the above and can send someone specifically who you think would be transformed by this experience on the Retreat.The ImpactWe are attempting to bring individuals who truly deserve a Retreat like this because we believe we can make a deep impact in the hearts of those this project touches and continue to do this for the years to come. When you contribute to this project, you are also investing in the long-term commitment from all of us involved to continue to bring this experience to those who most need it. We see this Retreat empowering:
Those in lower socio-economic situations.
Individuals who have overcome numerous challenges in life and deserve an experience to brighten their inner light.
Yoga instructors who are already creating unbelievable change in their communities but have never had the financial means to visit the birthplace of Yoga and immerse themselves in the culture and traditions of a country which has already touched their hearts. 
The Founder of Joyful Breath Yoga





Debra O'Bryan is a renowned Yoga instructor from the Midwest in Lees Summit, MO. She has been featured on numerous media outlets including NBC, has brought yoga to large school districts and big corporations, and is the official Yoga instructor of the Kansas City Chiefs Football team. Even with such notable accolades, those who know her would tell you they appreciate the heart and soul she brings to her Yoga practice.   Debra takes lessons from her own personal journey to empower others on theirs. She sees the beauty in helping individuals overcome physical obstacles such as being wheelchair bound to fully participate in a flowing Yoga class. The energy behind the Joyful Breath Yoga project originates from Debra's vision and passion in helping people see the world through their own inner light and greatness. These Retreats will be an extension of this energy that Debra brings out into the world. Watch and hear from Debra on her vision for creating Joyful Breath Yoga:Help Change the WorldIf you are unable to monetarily contribute to this project, just nominate someone who can transform their lives or those of others.  We want to impact the lives of people who can truly benefit from the experiences provided by this Retreat. 
Contribute a small amount to this project (even $5 will get you a specially delivered art memorabilia from this event that will be highly energetic and handcrafted by attendees!)
Nominate someone close to you, a Yoga teacher, or holistic healer who has incredibly impacted your life and would deserve an experience like this! We are truly grateful for those of you who reach out and give us stories of people who would be ideal candidates to bring along on this incredible journey :)
Share this with all your friends and family in the hopes that they may know someone who this project can truly help. 
If you are deeply inspired by this Retreat and all it stands for, consider joining us as a paying attendee for just $2999 (not including flights)! You can learn more at this link: http://TheJourneyofJoy.com.


Hear from current Joyful Breath Yoga Members!
Listen to the stories of current Joyful Breath Yoga members on how this project has helped change their lives!




And that’s all there is... Please learn more about all of us who collaborate and contribute to this beautiful Joyful Breath Yoga project and make it what it is... more than just a Virtual Yoga Studio online: http://joyfulbreathyoga.com/about-the-creators.

story:
Short Summary

We brought you YEG Fitness in 2013 with the goal of bringing together readers and fitness businesses. Since that time, we've featured dozens of local fitness and wellness companies, and local athletes and coaches who represent all the great things our city has to offer. We've grown leaps and bounds during that time and have developed an amazing following - something we're extremely proud of. But we don't want to rest on our laurels. We want to get better. 

We are currently working on developing a digital magazine to allow our readers the ability to download the magazine onto their tablets and smartphones to take with them anywhere. Our goal is to develop an interactive magazine featuring video, links to company websites and exclusive content for our subscribers. In today's tech savy world, this is something our readers have been asking for.

That's where we're asking for your support. By supporting our campaign, you will be responsible for helping bring the project to life. You will be instrumental in helping a small local business develop an amazing platform to showcase everything health and fitness related in the Edmonton area. While our goal is to grow the reach of our magazine, the intent is still the same - to provide locally developed content and feature some of the best fitness and wellness businesses this city has to offer.

We pride ourselves in supporting local. We're asking for your help by doing the same.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to obtain $4000 in funding to help us launch this project. This money will be used to develop the magazine itself, get it hosted to be downloaded or viewed directly on your smartphone, tablet or computer in a magazine like interface. The cost of developing the digital magazine is  $1400 plus the cost of photography, graphic design and layout of the magazine. We plan on covering costs to continue each edition through advertisement in the magazine, so the initial $4000 is to get the development off the ground and to market the project. 

We will be offering some amazing perks in exchange for your support. Everything from having yourself featured in the magazine, photography packages, and for businesses, a unique opportunity to take advantage of reduced pricing for advertising in the online and digital magazine. 

Our intentions are to have this digital magazine created by summer. We need your help to make this a reality. If we are unable to raise the full amount through our campaign, money raised will still be used to develop the product, but will likely take until the late fall before it is ready to be released. We're putting together a great group of contributors in an array of fitness and wellness fields. All we need now if the financial support to turn our dream into a reality.

The Impact

Our online presence as a source for fitness information is unmatched in Edmonton. We are the only magazine covering exclusively Edmonton based content. Yes, we could make a magazine with national or international context, but this is not our goal. We want to create something local. Something readers from the Edmonton area will look to if they are wanting to find something new to try out.

We have recently completed a complete redesign of our online magazine to make it more interactive and easier to use on smartphones. This will allow us to distribute information to our readers in a way that is easier for them to use. 

Over the past year, we've developed other successful applications including our Trainerize program and Podium Project. Each was developed from scratch and have been met with great support. 

This latest project will be another avenue for us to help spread fitness through the city. The goal is not to create another glossy magazine full of fitness models and hard core lifting. Don't get me wrong, there will be some of that. We want this magazine to represent all people. We will have features on people just starting a workout program and have photo spreads of everyday Edmontonians. We will feature some of Edmonton's best athletes training to represent the city on the world stage. We will continue to feature the great businesses in and around the Edmonton area so you can try new activities and keep motivated as you continue with your lifelong fitness journey.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. If you are unable to support our project financially, we understand that. Please continue to support everything we are doing by following us on social media and by reading our online version of YEG Fitness. That will always be free and will continue to provide great content. If you could help us by spreading the word of our campaign to your own friends and followers on social media. We have a great following through social media, and it is amazing how quickly an idea can spread by sharing it with your own group of followers. At the end of the day, that's our goal. To spread the great fitness happenings going on in our great city with as many people as possible. 


Bonus Offer

If we sell out our Summer Fitness Passes prior to the end of our campaign, we will be drawing for a pair of Ride-All-Day passes to K-Days. Draw will be made from all participants.

story: Working with the John Fawcett Foundation (jump to our website!) and it's Indonesian implementing partner Yayasan Kemanusiaan Indonesia, one of the Foundation’s five mobile eye health care clinics and highly-trained professional staff will use donated funds to “adopt” a two-day clinic providing i) community eye screening for up to 500 poor men, women and children; ii) 250 pairs of eye glasses; iii) 250 bottles of eye medicines to treat minor eye disorders; and iv) up to 10 sight-restoring cataract surgeries and post-operative care and instruction for adult cataract patients. The cost of the community eye screening is $2.70 per person; the cost for an adult cataract surgery is $65. One half day is dedicated for eye-screening about 300 elementary-aged school children (ages 5–11) at a local elementary school.

story:
What We're Doing

Tooth decay has a severe burden on billions of impoverished people around the world. They can’t always afford preventative dental care, but they can afford and enjoy our tasty Xylitol Chewing Gum, which is scientifically proven to fight cavity-causing bacteria in the mouth. We’re committed to creating a sweet solution for this bitter problem.

We've reached our goal thanks to almost 200 funders! The more we raise, the more people we can employ, the more kids we can distribute dentally beneficial gum and information to. The $15,000 funding goal sustains our project for the next two months. With your support, we could sustain and scale Sweet Bites for many months more. Let's exceed expectations! Break the dental burden bubble.

The Sweet Bites team is made up of 5 best friends from the University of Pennsylvania. We launched this project in Bangalore, India. Every day, our team distributes the gum to children in primary schools, many of whom live in slums and have very little access to healthcare. The kids especially love our fruity banana flavor!

Unfortunately, we had to say our (temporary) goodbyes to Bangalore and are back in our Boston office. Now, we need your help to sustain and scale the Sweet Bites project until we can raise enough money to return to India in the fall. If Sweet Bites is a success in Bangalore, it’s just a matter of time until we’re saving smiles around the whole country, and then the world.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds raised here will go directly into sustainably scaling our project in Bangalore over the next two months and beyond. We've met our fundraising goal! We're ecstatic, because this means the 25,000 pieces of Sweet Bites gum distributed to date will quadruple to 100,000 pieces distributed in the next two months, a big step towards achieving our target impact of 1 million children chewing Sweet Bites in the new year.

Thanks to our generous funders, we've already sent our teammate Thoba back to India! Right now, he is meeting with strategic partners, sponsors, and new Bangalore team members to start scaling. With your continued support, we will send Eric back in early September! 

If we exceed our goal, we will be able to make the initial investment for the factory we are planning to build outside of Bangalore. We already have deals lined up for the land, equipment, and raw materials - it's just a matter of funding and getting Eric on the ground. Local production will drive our costs down, and enable us to keep the gum affordable for children. 

This is Your Only Chance to Try the Gum

We’re offering quite a few perks but most important to note is that this IndieGogo campaign is the ONLY way to buy Sweet Bites online.

The Impact

Dental Health

Sweet Bites contains 20 times more xylitol per piece than the competitors in India, yet we offer it at competitive prices at small corner stores in underserved communities. The science recommends chewing 3 – 5 grams of xylitol gum per day, which can easily be done by having a piece of Sweet Bites after meals.

Education

Moreover, we include health messaging on the wrapper so each piece reinforces important behaviors, like brushing twice a day.

Employment

Lastly, Sweet Bites is providing meaningful, part-time employment to local students because we want our product to be distributed by people who deeply understand their community’s culture and needs.

Fight Tooth Decay. Educate Children. Empower Students.

Our company was recently listed as the #1 Simple Invention Changing the World on the Huffington Post. (Actually, Xylitol is a natural sweetener and the gum has been scientifically proven and FDA approved for decades, so it’s a bit of a stretch to say we “invented” it. Our innovation is in our model - providing the highest dose of Xylitol at the lowest cost to people who need it most.)

Back in March, our team was selected as one of six finalists out of 11,000 university applicants for the $1,000,000 Hult Prize for social entrepreneurship. The funds we raise here will keep our project’s momentum growing until the finals in September when we pitch at the Clinton Global Initiative, a major global health conference.


Check out the Facts behind Xylitol Gum!


Challenges

Public health problems are never easy to solve, and the developing world is littered with the skeletons of failed foreign interventions and technological innovations. A healthcare professor at Penn once warned us about the dangers of working in the slums: 

When it comes medicine, free is not cheap enough.

By delivering our health solution in a tasty, inexpensive treat that people already know and love; we hope to overcome these challenges. Education is a key aspect of our vision; Sweet Bites is just as much about distributing gum as it is about empowering local students to do meaningful work and providing important health information to underserved children.

Other Ways You Can Help

This campaign is about much more than the fundraising. According to WHO statistics, oral disease has a more severe burden on the population than leukemia, breast cancer, and heart disease (just to name a few). Yet, it’s too often overlooked. There are many ways to help. You don’t have to contribute your money; we deeply appreciate anyone who contributes their voice. Spread the word!

Win 500 Free Pieces of Your Favorite Flavor!

We're rewarding the person that wins us the most support! If you're logged into an Indiegogo account and you share our campaign using the Indiegogo links (twitter, email, etc); we'll get to see how much funds were raised because of YOUR help sharing the project! At the end of the campaign, we'll count up who was the best at spreading the word and hook them up with free gum.

story:
Who is Street Level Health Project?

Street Level Health Project is an Oakland-based grassroots organization dedicated to improving the health and wellbeing of underserved urban immigrant communities in the Bay Area. Our organization centers around four programs. The Health Access program (1) provides the Alameda community with necessary healthcare services like medical health consultations, herbalist/nutrition consultations, health coverage enrollment and drop-in clinic hours. The Community Building program (2) strives to build a safe space for isolated individuals to connect with the local community through events like the Fiesta de Navidad. Our Immigrant Rights and Empowerment program (3) develops immigrant day laborer’s understanding of worker rights, civic involvement, health and safety in the workplace. Lastly, our Wellness and Prevention program (4) aims at tackling health determinants through exercise classes, healthy lunches, and distribution of food bags.


What is the Fiesta de Navidad en Comunidad?

Every year, Street Level celebrates the holidays with 300 to 400 community members of the Fruitvale district in Oakland. This annual event celebrates diversity, community and culture. Because many of our community members face difficult circumstances in their daily lives, such as deportation of relatives, lack of safe jobs, and living away from loved ones, Street Level provides them with a safe and welcoming environment to celebrate the holiday season.


Our guests will enjoy live entertainment, games, and a healthy dinner. Additionally, Street Level provides our guests with winter necessities, such as hygiene packets filled with healthcare essentials, toys for children of low income families, and food bags with an assortment of fruits and vegetables.


Our Goal:

This is Street Level Health Project's second year participating in Giving Tuesday. Our goal is to raise $2,500 dollars to help us put on the 2014 Fiesta de Navidad en Comunidad and help us continue to provide services into 2015.

How will your donation help?

Your donation of any amount is greatly appreciated by Street Level staff and community members. A donation of $20 can help provide a nutritious meal for 2 community members or it can contribute to the creation of 4 hygiene packets. Your donation will also be used to help ensure that Street Level can continue to provide services to the community into 2015.  

Be sure to claim the perk to be entered in the drawing for your chance to win the Bose Soundlink Mini! 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Share this page with your family and friends! Post this on your Facebook, Twitter, or any other social media site. Thank you for supporting Street Level Health Project!

story:
Transform Health Care

Hello! Thanks for checking out Karisha. We are doctors and health professionals, and we're ready to transform health care for all.

Once funded,
we can create our vision of Karisha Community, which includes: 

  • a medical clinic offering acute, chronic, and walk-in care
  • a teaching kitchen
  • a yoga space
  • a physical therapy area
  • a networking space with wifi
  • beautiful and edible gardens
  • a physical therapy and healing arts studio
  • and more 

Karisha Community will be an integrative food, medicine and well-being space, for all. Karisha represents a new culture of health care, delivered in a nurturing environment where patients love to get care and where providers love to work. In time it will serve as a vehicle to transform health care in Central Texas and the US.

As Karisha providers, we listen intently, then individualize health care to the patient’s goals, their health needs, their prefered modality to receive care, and their background. We care for acute and chronic illness as indicated, while also supplementing the body’s innate capacity to heal. For those free of disease and those gaining freedom from it, we illuminate the path to well-being:  health for the body, calm for the mind, and bliss for the spirit. 

This is Karisha, a new culture of health care.


How this Campaign Helps Karisha (and You!)

Let me be clear: if we don't raise $25,000, all the money is returned to the donors. 

Hi there, I'm Amina. I'm a doctor, and I'm ready to transform health care.

After life changing events in our family -- the loss of my dear sister Priya Haji, the gain of her two angels Zen (2) and Omi (1), and the loss of my dear cousin brother Nasiru -- I decided to depart from my urgent care position with Baylor Scott & White and pursue my professional dream. 

I truly believe in the power of this community. I know we can raise the money, and if we don't, we give it back, and Karisha stagnates. 

But let's think positively. We'll raise the $25,000 and MORE! 

Because as you can guess, it takes much more than 25k to start a health clinic and center. 

So what will this money be used for? Great question. 

Your donation takes Karisha from idea to reality. Karisha is a concept that everyone loves, but how to make it a reality is the challenge... and that's our work. The money we raise goes toward research for best practices, collaborations with similar centers across the US, and creating the financial model. 

If you live in Austin, the $25,000 helps us secure a site for the Karisha Community integrative health center in Austin. 

If you are a person or provider elsewhere in the US, or anywhere in the world, this $25,000 gets you closer to having a blueprint in your hand that allows you to create a Karisha Community in your town . . . one step closer to creating a space that bridges food, medicine, and health, that delivers patient centered care with brilliant minds and tender hearts . . . one step closer to transforming health care.

By contributing to our campaign at this stage, you are literally a co-creator of the Karisha Community. You are a Karisha 'good luck token' and you are a foundational part of this movement to transform health care. 

Beyond these initial uses of the money, we will take on the costs of:

  • Building a beautiful, welcoming medical clinic and healing center to industry standards and beyond
  • Implementing and training staff on innovative internet technology that allows you as a patient to connect to us, for us to support you, and so you can receive multiple forms of service with adequately monitored treatment plans
  • Hiring amazing providers and support staff from around the country who are excited to create a new model of care with us

  • Paying the providers a salary that is worthy of their expertise and skills


When is this all happening?

We have a two year launch plan. The Karisha Center will bridge food, medicine and health by bringing medical providers, quality food, and healing practitioners under one roof in a community space. 

The center will house: 

  • a medical clinic offering acute, chronic, and walk-in care
  • a teaching kitchen
  • yoga space
  • physical therapy area
  • networking space with great wifi
  • beautiful and edible gardens
  • physical therapy and healing arts studio
  • and more 

It will be co-located with an integrative health and medical clinic, Karisha Health, that will provide acute, chronic and walk-in medical care to the community.

And furthermore, the name "Karisha" comes from my parents - Karim and Asha Haji. (Kari + sha) They taught me the art, humanity, and service of medicine. I had the privilege of watching them create an amazing economically and ethnically diverse medical practice in Bryan with a free medical clinic that continues to be my inspiration for what I want to do today.

I wish to take their work to the next level. 



Karisha's Impact

Our current health care system fails to address fundamental elements of health: 

  • the food we eat
  • stress reduction
  • exercise
  • social supports
  • restorative sleep
  • mind-body practices
  • and more.
We live in busy times, with packed schedules, little time to prepare food and high stress. Self care and preventative aspects of healthful living are not facilitated by our current health care system, culture, or food industry. For those who struggle to pay bills, these aspects of healthy living are even harder to come by.

At Karisha Community, we teach people how to care for themselves, where self-care becomes the basis of preventive health. We offer services to nurture self care, which translates to care of our families, children, and community at our center for food, medicine and well-being for all.



The Worthwhile Risk

I've been researching and visiting with integrative health centers for over 10 years, and I understand the inherent risk in this model.

Karisha Community values:

  • creating healing spaces that are truly nourishing for staff and patients
  • maintaining a clear work - life balance for practitioners 
  • working with the entire spectrum of health services - from intervention to maintenance to prevention
  • serving all clients, regardless of ability to pay
  • practioners working together in the same practice, rather than renting space
  • a physical center which houses the spaces and practitioners, providing choice and ease for patients, allowing for enhanced collaboration among providers

All of these components translate into higher start up and operational cost.

And Karisha believes in these components because without a doubt, they result in a higher quality of service and health for the patients and the staff. We believe and will ultimately show that this model decreases costs to our health care system. By empowering patients to take care of themselves, we decrease the burden of chronic disease, we can reverse diabetes and hypertension; we can prevent hospitalizations. By staying accessible financially and though our hours of operation, we decrease emergency room visits. By partnering with patients and facilitating self care as the basis of preventive of preventive health, we ultimately save costs to our far too expensive health care system.

Additionally, there are successful models for this type of center and clinic. The one closest to my heart is the clinic started in Bryan, TX, which was started by my family. Health for All has been in flourishing since 1985. It serves approximately 5000 patients today and is now affiliated with the Texas A&M Health Science Center Medical School so that doctors in training receive experience in providing underserved care. I had the privilege of watching the ins and outs of an amazing economically and ethnically diverse medical practice with a free medical clinic that works with people of all backgrounds, cultures, and socioeconomic status. At Karisha, I will utilize the best practices observed, creating a financial model where those who have resources to pay, receive great care and make it possible for those with fewer resources to get the same great care just by coming to our beautiful center. 

We also have the incredible advantage to ALREADY have a team of providers in place. I cannot say enough about the collective power and wisdom these skilled providers bring to the Karisha Community. 


I don't know of another collaborative like this one in the country -- with this many ethical, mission driven doctors and holistic providers dedicated to providing patient centered preventive, primary and urgent care, coming together to bridge food, medicine, and health, for all. I am honored to list them here:

Adam Smith, DO: Integrative Urgent Care and Life and Wellness Coaching 

Emily Hirsh, MD: Board Certified in Emergency Medicine; Integrative Urgent Care

Paulina Caban, ND: Integrative Naturopathic Medicine 

Darshan Shah, MD, FAAFM, ABIHM, RYT: Board Certified in Family Medicine, American Board of Integrative and Holistic Medicine, RYT; Integrative Family Medicine & Yoga

Edith Martinez: Community Based Nutritionally Oriented Cooking Instruction

Simel Bey, LAC: Acupuncture, Herbal and Planetary Medicine (Celebrating 10 years of his own practice, Bey Acupuncture in Austin, this year on April 18, 2015!) 

Oliver Rajamani: Nada Yoga 

Anita Jung-Rajamani, LPC, FAPA: Integrative Mental Health Counseling 

Geeta Cowlagi: Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction

Pamela Brewer: Therapeutic Yoga

Jariatou Sibi: Nutritional Cooking Class Instructor

Amina Haji, MD, FAAFM, ABIHM: Board Certified in Family Medicine, American Board of Integrative and Holistic Medicine; Head Clinical Director

To see a complete description of the *incredible* providers, you can click here. 


Additionally we are already greatfully collaborating with some transformative organizations. 
The Sustainable Food Center, la Cocina Alegre will provide the curriculum and instruction for community based, nutritionally oriented gardening and cooking instruction.

Huffman Group is proud to be the builder / developer for Karisha Community. Huffman Group specializes in development for physician and providers, and Karisha Community honored to work alongside him to make our dream a reality.

Jonathan Epperson is providing invaluable guidance to refine our business plan through Health Care Finance Consulting.
Alegria Systems has signed on to support with communications and marketing strategy, as well as large scale promotion.
Sutarwalla and Associates is providing legal consultation to ensure Karisha is structurally sound and ready to expand and thrive in the coming years.



Other Ways You Can Transform Health Care

If you can't financially support Karisha, that's ok! I bet you know someone who can. 

Please do us a favor and forward this page to them, and let them in on all the goodness that we're cooking up. 

You can use the #karisha_atx if you want to share it on social media, too. 

Click here to share on Facebook

Click here to share on Twitter

Click here to share on LinkedIn

And if you have more time than money, write to us here, as we have more than enough volunteer opportunities - childcare, events, green space development, technical and IT expertise, management consulting, and beyond. 


This is a community effort, and we appreciate all levels of investment and support. 

Thanks for your time, for your interest, and for being a foundational part of transforming health care by creating Karisha Community: Bridging Food, Medicine, and Health, for All.

Many thanks,
Amina Haji

We care for acute and chronic illness as indicated, while also supplementing the body’s innate capacity to heal. For those free of disease and those gaining freedom from it, we illuminate the path to well-being:  health for the body, calm for the mind, and bliss for the spirit. 
This is Karisha, a new culture of health care.

I truly believe in the power of this community. I know we can raise the money, and if we don't, we give it back, and Karisha stagnates. 
But let's think positively. We'll raise the $25,000 and MORE!

story:
Our tree-planting condoms are now available for purchase at rele.af

 

###########################################


 

Wait - what? 
 

It's quite simple:
We sell great condoms. For every single condom sold, we plant one tree.

 

We provide documentation of all our tree planting donations here.


Our condoms are made by a long established manufacturer that supplies dozens of large brands world-wide with high-quality condoms. They are vegan, ethically produced and are fully tested and certified according to the strict ISO quality standard required for sale in the EU.

 


But why trees?

Even if this didn't contribute to climate change (which it does) this would suck, as forests are important for biodiversity, air quality, and preventing both floods and droughts.

Planting trees is one of the most effective tools at our disposal for climate change mitigation and our individual choices can add up to make a big difference.


Fair enough, why condoms?

  • they're a high throughput product (globally +27 billion pieces per year)
  • sex feels good, and with RELEAF you can feel even better
  • many people are still needlessly ashamed when buying them - not with these!
     

This may sound ambitious, but it's actually quite realistic. We only need a tiny fraction (~0.03%) of the global market to achieve our goal. And who knows - the big players may end up planting trees, too, if they see that the customer (that's you!) supports us.


How are you going to plant all those trees?

We've partnered with Eden Reforestation Projects who have already planted 265M+ trees. Eden works directly with villages and communities suffering from extreme poverty resulting from the deforestation and destruction of the land that sustains them. This means the positive impact of planting trees is both ecological & social. For every condom sold we donate funds to plant one tree.

Here we provide documentation of all our past and future donations.


 

Why do you need my support?

Condoms can only be competitively produced if they are manufactured in high numbers. Minimum order quantities vary between 50-300,000 pieces. We're confident in our idea but we need your help to get this off the ground.

UPDATE: Thanks to our backer's support so far we've been able to order the first 50.000 condoms! Every further order helps us to establish our idea as an actual sustainable business and of course to plant more trees.

 

Ok, sounds good. What now?

Have a look at our perks! You're not merely buying a few condoms that happen to come with trees:


Obviously buying condoms that come with trees is not enough to save our planet, but it certainly is one step in the right direction. Here's our plan for the coming months.
 


Don't need condoms? Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Take another look at our perks - you can also plant trees without buying condoms
  • Earn some karma and give RELEAF to a loved one as a gift
  • Take a critical look at your diet: Animal agriculture is a leading cause of deforestation
  • Share this page with your family, friends, colleagues, people you barely know, your political representatives, your shaman, anyone!
 

 

 

_______________________________________________________________________________________

Who is behind this?

 

Calculation details

 

Selection of sources used:

  • FAO Global Forest Resources Assessment
  • Forest assessment of planted, naturally regenerated and primary tropical cloud forest
  • A spatial model of tree alpha-diversity and tree density for the Amazon
  • Modelling Growth and Yield of Dipterocarp Forests in Central Highlands of Vietnam
  • UNFPA, WHO and UNAIDS: Position statement on condoms and the prevention of HIV, other sexually transmitted infections and unintended pregnancy
  • Tackling Climate Change through Livestock: A global assessment of emissions and mitigation opportunities

story:
Short Summary

Tina is a single parent with three children. Sean was diagnosed with cancer at age 3 and he just turned5 continues to fight his cancer battle and Tina struggles daily trying to cover the cost of his medications (that are not covered by Pharmacare), and the basic living costs of a family of 4.

She can’t work because Sean’s care is a full time job in itself. I’ve shared Sean’s story beginning with his diagnosis at age 3 and now Sean and Tina’s family face another challenge in that the cancer may have spread to Sean’s testicles or brain.

How You Can Help

Tina struggles every month to put food on the table, cover the rent and pay for all the extras that Sean needs. Her story tells it all. She can't work because Sean needs her full time and his condition changes daily.

Tina asks for nothing except for Sean, affectionately nicknamed Seany, to get better. Every little bit of money we can raise will help her in ways that many of us do not understand. $5.00 $20.00 it doesn't matter the amount, although we would ask if you can offer more that would be amazing. Especially right now when Sean faces yet another battle.

A huge thank you to anyone that can help this family.

Tina and Sean's Cancer Story

Sean was diagnosed with " ALL", Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia B-Cell, High Risk on Oct.6,2011( 2 weeks after he turned 3)

We thought he had the flu as he was very pale, very lethargic and had a constant fever. Our GP refused to examine him and made us rush to BcCh ER ASAP. There were easily 20 kids in that waiting room. When the nurses saw Sean they started whispering amongst themselves and he was brought into an ER room right away .

An hour and a half later, after the blood work was done, the doctor came back to see us with the saddest face as he explained they were 95 % sure Sean had Leukemia:

It took a few min to sink in and then I couldn't stop crying and begging the doctor not to let him die . Whatever he needed, my blood. bone marrow, whatever I can give to him to save him. Just please don't let my baby die

An Oncologist explained he would require an emergency transfusion right away and then we literally went from the ER to the Oncology ward (3B) where we were supposed to have stayed for 3 weeks. I was in a cot beside his bed for almost 9 weeks, as he developed many I fractions- blood, fungal, etc. and he list the ability to walk for several weeks too due to one of the chemos.

He continues to take daily chemo, steroids, Septra, Methatrexate and more in addiition to monthly Lumbar Punctures where he goes to BCCH , put under GA , Methatrexate is injected into his spine and they extract spinal fluid which is taken to the lab to examine for presence of cancer cells. With Leukemic patients, if they do relapse , quite often it is in the brain or spinal fluid.

Update on Sean

We saw Dr.Rod today and again I gave to say how very blessed we feel to have him as Seanny 's oncologist.He wants to move on Sean's case very quickly. Wed. am we'll have the biopsies done on both testicles and bone marrow. Sean will be admitted into BCCH indefinitely to begin treatment depending on biopsy results which Dr.Rod is working on getting expedited ASAP . Potential treatments discussed were more aggressive forms of chemo, radiation, removal of testicle and / or bone marrow transplant. I will keep you all posted as soon as I learn something from Dr.Rod. I just ask that you please continue to pray for my baby boy and send positive healing thoughts / vibes his way. Love, Tina

The News Isn't Good - An Update From Tina


Thank you all for your very kind messages of love and support for Seanny. He was a year away from the completion of his treatment for Leukemia and now he is starting at "Ground 0". As I have not heard a word regarding the leukemia spreading to his brain, I am assuming no news is good news on that front. Today, Sean begins phase 1 of very aggressive chemo and everything that entails- nausea, mouth sores, hair loss. In several weeks he will then start radiation, leaving him infertile. Lastly, he will undergo a bone marrow transplant. This means he'll be in total isolation for between 3-4 months. Fortunately , Sean's older brother , Dylan is a perfect match for Seanny- blessing #1.
Blessing #2, we have a great room up on 3B with a comfortable cot thanks to Tanna Fleming who vacated the room yesterday and asked the nurses if we could get this room.
Right now, Sean is in a great deal of pain, and is taking morphine every 4 hrs. Please continue to keep him in your thoughts and prayers. I know with all Seanny's tenacity, your amazing words of support, our wonderful oncologist, Dr.Rod and the nurses here at BCCH , we are going to give this beast a run for its money!!
